loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.I.'s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Beatrice, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 27 years of age. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She loves and treasures her family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Beatrice's primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 5 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Kapsowar area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. Beatrice upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Beatrice has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Beatrice is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Despite being a 23-year-old single mother (with one child) who has gone through many bad times in her life, Immaculate has not given up her dream to improve her quality of life.

Five years ago, Immaculate started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kerugoya, a remote rural town in Kenya. Today she sells milk, raises a dairy goat and sells eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes a profit selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and wants to increase her poultry and horticulture business.

She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit, buy seeds to expand her horticulture farm, and buy good quality poultry. She will use the loan to have an easier time to milk and feed s her cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. She will acquire good quality breeds of poultry and sell eggs to her neighbors. She will be able to expand her horticulture farm and sell to both domestic and international markets. Immaculate believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. Immaculate waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit, buy seeds, and buy poultry.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Meet Lydia. She is a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Kapsowar in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her secondary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children.

Ten years ago, Lydia started farming on her husband's two-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She keeps a dairy cow that gives her fifteen liters of milk every day for sale. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food and also to sell.

Lydia is seeking a loan to purchase a quality breed of sheep. The sheep will produce wool and meat (mutton). The Kapsowar area has a ready market for mutton but the problem is that there is low supply. Through this loan she is going to meet the demand. These investments will not only double the income that Lydia is making. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle food and education costs, which are her highest expenses.

Consider lending a loan to Lydia to help her improve her economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of sheep.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a widow with one child. Purity believes that when smallholder farmers come together, they are powerful. This analogy led her to join Ngariama self-help group. For the past 5 years, Purity has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work. This has not been a setback because Purity has been making great profits in farming. Kerugoya is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transportation systems, and market.

Purity has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds because most financial institution do not want to lend to her. But Juhudi Kilimo agreed to the loan. She requests a loan to buy seeds to start farming. The Ngariama self-help group members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan. Purity joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. She intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. She lives close to an airstrip which will allow her to transport the produce to an international market, enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Purity's living conditions and secure the future of her child since she is the sole bread winner.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She works untiringly every day of the week, from Monday to Sunday. She lives in Kapsowar, a remote town in Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kapsowar area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 25,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: 36 летный опытный и профессионал водитель такси, Орифчон. Он из города Турсунзаде. Орифчон женат и отец одного 8 месячного ребенка. Жена умная, талантливая женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды, и помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Орифчон  более 5  лет занимается таксистом. Его доходы только от этой деятельности. Благодаря автомашине он, зарабатывает на жизнь. На данный момент источник доход, находится на мастерской. Орифчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы починить любимую машину и продвигать работу. Он очень нуждается в кредите. Поддержите Орифчону! Он заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Orifjon is a 36-year-old experienced and professional taxi driver. He is from the town of Tursun-zoda. Orifjon is married and the father of an eight-month-old child. His wife is a clever, talented woman. She sews women's clothes, and helps her husband to provide for the family. Orifjon has been a taxi driver for more than five years. His income is just from this business. He makes a living thanks to his car. At the present time his source of income is in the repair shop. Orifjon has applied for a loan in order to repair his beloved car and continue work. He really needs a loan. Please support Orifjon! He expresses his gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to repair his taxi car.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is not looking for a job now because she is content being a farmer. She sells crops from their small farm and keeps dairy cows and poultry.

Elizabeth is seeking a loan worth 40,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed with Kiva to give Elizabeth access to a loan that will help her farm grow into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. Elizabeth’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good-quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
For years rural smallholder women have lived poor lives In addition, in some parts of Kenya like Kerugoya, more women were rendered poor by the clashes that followed disputed presidential elections of 2007.Priscillah, a youthful 37-year-old farmer from Kerugoya, a remote town in Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Kerugoya area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Priscillah has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Priscillah started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 10 years. With time, she has grown her passion about dairy cattle farming. For a living, she sells milk and maize among other varieties of crops and flowers from her farm. She also diversified into a small business “side hustle”. Priscillah is seeking a loan for two things: to purchase a hybrid dairy cow and to buy a chaff cutter. She loves raising cows. However, over the years the biggest challenge for farmers has been diseases. For this reason, most rural farmers would rather keep traditional breeds that are resistant despite being way less productive. Traditional breed is simply not an option for progressive farmers like Priscillah. With your loan, Priscillah is going to buy a high quality breed that is very productive. To curb diseases, she is going to tighten her belt as far as dairy management in the farm is concerned. An efficient management of cattle will be incomplete without a well-planned and adequate housing of cattle. The Chaff cutter which is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces will be used in aiding the cow in eating. No food will be left out because the food will be in smaller pieces hence easier feeding of the cow. Through this loan, Priscillah will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her milk business.
 Lenders if there is someone that you should lend to your $25 or more then that person is Priscillah you will not regret!

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow and a chaffcutter

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Speaking with Peres, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

Peres has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. Peres is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards.

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Peres and her family. With your help Peres will be able to fulfill her dreams.
Go ahead, make a loan and keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose was inspired to improve her farming business when her friends told her about Juhudi Kilimo and the partnership they have with Kiva to support marginalized women smallholder farmers. Juhudi Kilimo was established with a mission to uplift, empower, and validate women across Kenya.

Rose is a farmer from Kuserwo, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya, who believes that agriculture is not just for the older generation. She is a loving mother who has farmed for five years so that she can supplement her income from the small “side hustles” she does. Rose grows crops and raises cattle. She enjoys farming. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances and fighting diseases. She will use the loan to purchase a sheep. She will sell the wool, which is very expensive and earns more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. She will sell the meat and sheepskin to increase her income.

The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business. Rose wants to set up an example for her children by being the most successful sheep farmer in her village because she finds farming very rewarding.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of sheep

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат вежливая, умная и ответственная женщина. Она с семьёй живет на районе Кубадиён. Ей 45 лет. Уже несколько лет она занимается земледелием. Она решилась начать новую деятельность в сфере животноводства. Она любит животных и давно хотела начать этот бизнес. Саодат просит кредит, чтобы купить необходимое количество телят. Она давно мечтала начать маленький бизнес именно в этой сфере деятельности. Саодат верит, что с Вашей помощью ей удастся реализовать задуманное. Поддержите Саодат.
texts.en: Saodat is a polite, clever and responsible woman. She and her family live in the Qubadiyon region. She is 45 years old. She has been growing crops for a few years. She has decided on starting a new business in the sphere of animal rearing. She loves animals and has wanted to start this business for a long time. Saodat is asking for a loan to buy the necessary number of calves. She has long since dreamed of starting a small business in this specific sphere of activity. Saodat believes that, with your help, she will be able to realize her plans. Please support Saodat.

loans.use: to buy a few calves and start a new animal rearing business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Thirty years ago Juliana started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Litein, a remote town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Litein area. Juliana has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry flock, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Juliana can achieve their dreams and goals. Juliana believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.
Kindly lend to Juliana to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer and salesperson from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He practices livestock and crop farming for a living. On his one acre farm, John raises cattle, poultry and pigs. He further engages in the cereal trade as a middleman to generate extra income for his family. He aggregates cereal produce from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers at a higher price.

Given that John can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, he prefers to stock a large volume of cereal produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers which he will later sell at a higher price, using his understanding of the market conditions and prices.

Income from this investment will help John generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Mary, a dedicated, determined and honest mother of a lovely family. She is based in Kerugoya, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest maize growing regions, lending it the nickname of “the maize region”.

For the past 10 years, Mary has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income.

Mary passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village. They have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance institution that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and providing training. Mary is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy additional poultry and also buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Mary will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry and horticulture business to international markets.

If there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Mary!

loans.use: to buy poultry, buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy dreams of getting her family out of poverty, and to that end, decided to practice mixed farming. Daisy is a native of the village of Moiben in the Kapsowar area of Kenya where she lives with her lovely family. Her upbringing was challenging and she never went to college or had a formal job. She has farmed for five years and is able to take care of her family. She sells milk, raises sheep and goats and grows crops.

She is able to support her family as the only breadwinner. Daisy loves farming and has nicknamed one of her animals. Daisy stated that the most enjoyable bit about farming is “it gives me personal fulfillment and feeds my family." Although she has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious woman. She is challenged by transporting her produce from the farm to the market and will use the loan to buy a motorbike.

The Kapsowar area is a rural town and roads are very poor and transporting goods for Daisy has always been a “nightmare”. She losses sales because goods reach the market when they are not fresh. Vegetables and milk are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market. Daisy is someone who wants to empower others and she plans to employ someone who will help with farm work and transport the produce to the market.

Increased profits from the loan will allow her to repay the loan fully, permanently change her living conditions, and assure her aging parents a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Eshonqul

texts.ru: Эшонкул активный мужчина из района Шахритус. Ему 50 года и он женатый мужчина. Эшонкул живет в одном из сел района Шахритус. Там он занимался растениеводством, вместе с женой. Причина, по которой он выбрал эту деятельность, является чистый, свежий воздух и климат, который благоприятно влияет на такую деятельность. В этом году он хочет посадить лук и морковь. Для посева урожая он просит заем. Эшонкул за счет заемных средств купит семена лука, моркови и минеральных удобрений, способствующих здоровому росту черенков. Эшонкул верит, что он получит кредит и посадит урожай.
texts.en: Eshonqul is an active man from the Shahrituz region. He is 50 years old and he is a married man. Eshonqul lives in one of the villages in the Shahrituz region. He has been growing crops there with his wife. The reason why he chose this activity is the clean, fresh air and the climate which positively influences such a business. This year he wants to plant onions and carrots. He is asking for a loan to plant his crops. With the borrowed funds, Eshonqul will buy onion and carrot seeds and mineral fertilizer that will promote the healthy growth of the plants. Eshonqul believes that he will receive a loan and plant his crops.

loans.use: to buy carrot and onion seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
HELLO, LENDERS! Meet Sarah who is a smallholder farmer and lives in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, where she has been practicing farming for the past ten years. Farming has helped her not only survive but become an entrepreneur. At her age that is not that common, but she knows that it doesn’t come with an age limit. She is committed, honest, responsible, and works really hard to see her farming business become successful. The Nandi Hills area is a place that has produced some of the world's top elite athletes. Nandi Hills has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming.

Sarah is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming. Through all the years she has been farming, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Sarah offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mother, Sarah has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Although Sarah reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing that is dragging her down and preventing her from reaching the top of the skies is lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Sarah is seeking a loan of KES 160,000 to be able to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Sarah is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions.

Sarah is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. Sarah has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan.
Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 59-year-old independent farmer. She is a very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya.

Elizabeth has farmed for 15 years and provides for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. She gets income from selling milk, crops, and some personal business. She enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. The main challenge that Elizabeth faces is that her cows stray to her neighbor's compound. This has caused many losses because she has to pay for the damages caused by the animals. She requests a loan to buy barbed wire to control her animals. She will save more money.

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness. She promises to repay the loan because it is a way of showing gratitude towards the confidence that the lenders have in her.

loans.use: to buy  barbed wire.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a smallholder farmer based in the North-rift area of Kenya, where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. His main source of income is milk. Ben aspires to grow his business, make better income and take good care of his wife and children.

One way that Ben can improve his business is by ensuring his cows are more productive. He used his previous loan to buy a machine that turns hay into chaff, for feeding his livestock. Today, he is seeking a loan that will help him to introduce zero-grazing on his farm. The borrowed money will be used to buy tools and materials for constructing a cowshed that contains a confined feeding area for the stock.

After implementing the zero-grazing technique, Ben expects to cut costs and make better income from using the grazing area of land to grow fodder and vegetables. Since the cows will not have to constantly move around for pasture, the saved energy will be concentrated on the production of milk.

Your loan investment will change Ben's business trajectory and improve the livelihood of his family.

loans.use: to introduce zero-grazing for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Meet Mathew. He is a small-scale farmer from Kapsowar, a rural town known for dairy farming. Mathew is blessed with a lovely family whom he has fought so hard to raise. For the past five years, Mathew has been actively involved in mixed farming, and his primary source of income has been milk and maize farming. He sells his produce to the nearby market and also to neighbors, and has been making positive strides.

Mathew wants to diversify and he is seeking a loan to start sheep farming and be able to make his dream come true. He is very passionate about sheep farming, and his most enjoyable task is raising the sheep. Sheep farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for sheep meat (mutton) is always high, being such a popular meal for many people in Kapsowar.

Mathew will also benefit from sheep wool, which fetches a high price both in international and domestic markets. Additional profits from sheep farming will change his life, and he will be able to take care of the family’s expenses. Contribute to this man's life; grant him a loan.

loans.use: to start sheep farming.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам молодая девушка из района Шахритус. Ей 29 лет. Мухарам имеет троих детей. Она большое внимание уделяет воспитанию детей. Мухарам решила купить мебель для дома, но к ее разочарованию, ее денег не хватило для совершения покупки. Мухарам обратилась за кредитом и верит, что ей помогут. Поддержите Мухарам.
texts.en: Muharam is a young lady from the Shahrituz region. She is 29 years old. Muharam has three children. She devotes a lot of attention to raising her children. Muharam has decided to buy furniture for her house, but to her disappointment she did not have enough money to complete the purchase. Muharam has applied for a loan and believes that she will be helped. Please support Muharam.

loans.use: to buy some furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a hardworking, rural smallholder farmer from North Rift area of Kenya. He practices mixed farming to make a living. He is also involved in value addition activities such as flour processing to make better profit margins and satisfy customer needs.

Dennis is seeking a loan to buy cereal produce. Your loan will enable him to aggregates cereal produce from local farmers, which he will process and sell in its final form --flour--at a significantly higher price. Income generated from this investment will enable Dennis to repay the loan, settle farm expenses, and take care of his family’s basic needs. His ultimate goal is to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Norgul

texts.ru: Норгул живет на районе Кубадиён. Ей 47 лет. Норгул занимается животноводством. На данный момент у нее не большое количество скотин и она хочет расширить деятельность путем увеличения поголовья скотов. Тогда увеличится доходность. Норгул планирует купить необходимое количество скотов и корма для них с помощью кредита. Она считается, что таким образом бизнес принесет хорошую прибыль, что способствует улучшению ее жилищных и жизненных условий.
texts.en: Norgul lives in the Qubadiyon region. She is 47 and works in animal husbandry. She currently only has a small number of livestock and wants to expand her business by increasing her head count of animals, so that she can increase her income. She plans to buy the necessary number of animals and feed for them with the help of this loan. She believes that in this way, her business will bring in a good profit, which will improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Olivia es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de cereales tostados y acaramelados.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, activa, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ caracterizada por su topografía accidentada, variable en sus diferentes sectores, dónde existe la presencia de piedras de grandes dimensiones y bastante cascajo, lo que la convierte en una región muy estable. También existen aguas subterráneas que han dado lugar a que la zona tenga algunos ojos de agua en toda su estructura. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados.
Olivia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su madre que es mayor de edad y no trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el comercio de cereales tostados y acaramelados, como; Ajonjoli Acaramelado, Almendra Fileteada Acaramelada, Cacahuate Acaramelado, Nuez Acaramelada, Pepita Girasol Acaramelada y otros, “ofrezco alimentos gourmet y tradicionales, que son nutritivos, saludables, naturales e innovadores; cuidando la calidad y el servicio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de almendras, maní, girasol y otros cereales por mayor. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y formar una familia, ella desea realizar la compra de almendras, maní, pepitas de girasol y otros cereales por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Olivia solicita un préstamo para la compra de almendras y otros cereales por mayor para tostarlos y acaramelarlos.
texts.en:
Olivia is a 42-year old, single woman, without children. Her business is the sale of toasted and caramel-coated nuts and seeds.
She is very enterprising, independent, active, reliable, patient, responsible, and hard-working. She conducts her business in the "villa Fatima" zone, which is characterized by rough terrain that varies across different sectors. There are large rocks and ample gravel, which makes it a very stable area. There are also underground waters that create a zone with springs throughout its structure. The climate is cold and dry with a daily temperature ranging from 1-12 degrees centigrade (34-53 Fahrenheit).
Olivia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black braided hair. She is of short stature, with a thin frame. She wears traditional dress (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in her daily life and in the business she conducts.
She shares her life with her mother who is elderly and does not work. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and wood floor. The house has potable water, electricity and plumbing.
Her business is the sale of toasted and caramel-coated nuts and seeds like: caramel-covered sesame, peanuts, walnuts, sunflower seeds, sliced and caramel-coated almonds and others. She notes, "I offer gourmet and traditional foods that are nutritious, healthy, natural and innovative, caring for quality and service...".
The advantage of her business is that she sells wholesale. The disadvantage is the lack of capital for the wholesale purchase of almonds, peanuts, sunflower seeds and others. Her dream is to improve her business and create a family. She wants to purchase almonds, peanuts, sunflower seeds and the other nuts and seeds wholesale. This is her first loan with the institution in the five years she has devoted herself to this activity. .
It is for these reasons that Olivia requests a loan for the wholesale purchase of almonds and other nuts and seeds for toasting and coating with caramel.

loans.use: for the wholesale purchase of almonds and other nuts and seeds for toasting and coating with caramel

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a rural woman who has had to endure many hardships in life, but she has always found the strength to press forward and continue making progress with her family. For the past five years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and selling milk. Veronica’s upbringing was very challenging and, because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Veronica is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Veronica is seeking a loan to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture farming.

Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Veronica is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticulture farming, Veronica will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved. Please support her!

loans.use: To buy seeds for horticulture farming.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Selling goods and other various products--this is what Rebecca has been doing for the past eight years with her sari-sari store to earn money for her three children. As a mother, she still makes sure of her dependents’ benefits despite her age of 53. 

Though weakened by age, Rebecca chooses to busy herself for business. This is why her customers in Lanag, Sta. Barbara are already familiar with her credibility and quality service. However, it sometimes becomes a difficulty for her when chances of competition arise between the other sari-sari stores nearby. But Rebecca is not the type of woman for easy defeat. 

To make her store a bit more attractive, she is planning to expand her business and add more merchandise products inside her kiosk. With this, she wants you to know that she wants to borrow a PHP 25,000 loan for the realization of her plans. This will surely help to make her sales boost. 

She hopes that you indeed extend your helping hands to her. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to add more merchandise products for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
Dairy farming is an important source of income and employment for smallholder Kenyan farmers like George. He is 59 years old and is blessed with a happy family. For the past 10 years George has operated a mixed farm in Sinyereri village located in the Central Province of Kenya. He keeps dairy cattle and grows maize, vegetables, and other crops on his farm. He also engages in other side businesses for additional income. He is constantly upgrading and introducing new ways and approaches of doing business to make his farm more sustainable to the environment while still being profitable.

George is seeking a loan to fully incorporate zero-grazing into his farm. The cattle management system on his farm is shifting from being extensive (which is confined in ranches and large-scale farms) to being intensive. The intensive systems are the most predominant and comprise zero-grazing and semi-zero grazing systems. With your funding, the introduction of zero-grazing will create significant value for George's business. This management system is the most suitable for this farmer, considering his land, labor, and capital. Returns from this investment will be put back into the business to drive its evolution into a modern practice. Your loan will elevate the quality of life for George and his family.

loans.use: to start a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro continúa con su negocio de  venta de comida tradicional. El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de un refrigerador para conservar la carne y otros alimentos frescos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su negocio continúa estable, mejorando la calidad de su comida y atención al cliente, “gracias a emprender he podido continuar con mi negocio, mejorándolo para atraer a nuevos clientes y fidelizando a los antiguos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande y lleno, él desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes. Esta es la 5 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pedro solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro continues with his business of selling traditional food. The previous loan was invested in the purchase of a refrigerator to conserve meat and other fresh food items. His repayment was punctual because he did not have problems.
His business remains stable, improving the quality of his food and service to the client, "thanks to Emprender I have been able to continue with my business, improving it to attract new clients and promoting the loyalty of the old ones ..." he comments.
The advantage of his business is that he has daily, continuous sales. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase tables and chairs to serve more clients.
His dream is to have a large, full restaurant. He wishes to purchase chairs and tables to serve more clients. This is the fifth cycle of loans with the institution in 13 years that he is developing this activity. Is is for these reasons that Pedro requests a loan for the purchase of tables and chairs to serve more clients and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs to better attend more clients and increase his earnings

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer de 49 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo de 23 años, y su negocio es la tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, constante, comprometida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Tejada rectangular’ allí pasaban corrientes de agua que eran aprovechadas por los camélidos que pastaban por la zona. Cada día aparecían por allí entre 30 y 50 alpacas provenientes de diferentes lugares, acompañadas por sus dueños, para pastar y beber agua. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Catalina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera) su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia y trabaja en construcción, viven en un cuarto en anticrético (especie de alquiler) construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo, papel higiénico, refrescos, golosinas, etc. en su tienda de barrio ubicada en su mismo domicilio, todos los días de la semana en horas del día, “inicie mi negocio en mi anterior casa con un pequeño capital, cada cierto tiempo amplío los productos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra ubicado en una zona comercial, la desventaja es la falta de capital para el incremento de mercadería. Su sueño es incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar nuevos productos, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda de barrio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Catalina solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Catalina is a 49-year-old divorced woman. She has a 23-year-old son and her occupation is running her neighborhood store. She is a good mother who is patient, steadfast, committed, responsible and hard-working.

Her shop is located in the "Tejada Rectangular" zone where streams of water flowed and from which alpacas that grazed in the area would come to drink. Every day between 30 and 50 alpacas from different places appeared accompanied by their owners to graze and drink water. The climate is cold and dry with temperatures that range from 0 to 12 degrees centigrade (32 to 54 F).

Catalina has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears braided, and is short and stocky in stature. She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl, and pollera skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home, but she speaks Spanish in general and at work. She shares her life with her son who attends school and also works in construction. They live in a room that they do not own (a special type of rental arrangement) that is build of brick and cement with a metal roof and a wooden floor. It has drinkable water, electricity and sewerage.

Her business is the sale of staple items and foods such as bread, sugar, noodles, toilet paper, soft drinks, snacks, etc. from her neighborhood store which is located in her house. It is open every day of the week during the day. " I started my business in my previous house with a little bit of capital, and every so often I would add more products..." she states. The advantage of her business is that it is located in a commercial area, but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to increase her supply of merchandise.

Her dream is to increase her working capital and buy new products. She wants to buy different staple items and foods to stock her neighborhood store. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the five years that she has had her store.

These are the reasons why Catalina is applying for a loan - to buy different staple goods to stock her neighborhood store.

loans.use: to buy different staple articles and food items to stock her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a small dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She has a lovely family and has been doing crop farming, for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her goats. She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand.

Alice is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm by buying seeds.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a responsible, hardworking and enterprising farmer from Nandi Hills, Kenya. He is 51 years old, married, and the father of six children. His main source of income is milk and tea from his farm. Christopher also keeps poultry and grows crops like vegetables for subsistence.

Christopher is seeking a loan to buy a plot of land. This loan investment will make it possible for him to secure more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give his family decent diets and better income. He has been doing farming for over 24 years. He still enjoys farming, because his work produces food that feeds his nation.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Margaret, a 47-year-old mother who is so humble, honest, and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Margaret is a mother of a lovely family that she really adores so much, and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Margaret hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Margaret never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Margaret started farming and has been doing farming for the past three years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience, and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips.

Margaret is a woman who is very enterprising, and she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming on her farm. Margaret wants to take advantage of the favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Margaret make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Margaret hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Margaret's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.
If there is someone that you should trust with your $25 or more then that person is Margaret. Loan to her!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Cumbene Província de Gaza tem 54 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 5 filhos maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a hluvuku em 2011. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir mercadoria como: arroz, feijão, sabão e açúcar para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende ser grande empresário ampliando o seu negócio no estabelecimento comercial e mais tarde casar oficialmente uma vez que ate entao so vive maritalmente.
texts.en:
This borrower was born in Cumbene in the Province of Gaza. He is a 54-year-old father of five children who are of age and lives with his partner. All of them are in school. He is not responsible for anyone else.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2011. This is his fourth loan, which he plans to use to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, soap, and sugar to satisfy his clients' needs.

In the future, he hopes to be a great businessman, expanding his business in a commercial establishment. He also intends to officially get married in the future with his partner, since they are currently only living together.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soap, and sugar.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a smallholder farmer from the village of Kiptuiya in the Nandihills area of Kenya. Monica is the mother of three lovely children. At a tender age, Monica’s passion for farming and education drove her to start practising mixed farming. She has been doing this for the past 12 years. When you ask, she’ll tell you her most valuable asset is her two-acre farm. But it wasn't always this way. For a long time, Monica’s farm couldn't even sustain her family. In 2013, Monica heard about Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance institution that serves smallholder farmers, and their partnership with Kiva. And from that day, life has never been the same. Like many farmers in the region, Monica keeps a dairy cow and poultry, and grows different varieties of crops. Nandihills has a thriving market for dairy products. Monica has sustained herself through dairy farming. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them. Monica dreams of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. From Kiva lenders, Monica is kindly requesting 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more milk for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Monica will be able to cover the high cost of farm production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high input costs. However, with increased income, Monica will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.
Monica loves dairy farming you can support her and get her closer to her goals. Make a loan now and be part of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Group Lwanda

texts.en:
The group is located in a rural area called Bitabago and is comprised of 11 members and of both men and women. They carry out different activities which include: retail shops, charcoal trading, grocery, farming, teaching, coffee trading and operating a boutique.

Robert is a married man with 7 children, 4 of them attending school and he lives with the family in Bitabago. He runs a farm and also teaches as a side business. He started his business in 2000 and works all the 7 days of the week and 15 hours per day. He started the business because it did not need a lot of capital to start, it allowed him to feed the family and even acquire income. He is applying for this loan to expand and improve his farming; he will hire labour to till the land and also buy farm in inputs.

His clients are residents of Bitabago, lwanda, lubugu and those from nearby villages. His hope for the future is to educate his children and also buy more land for farming. His challenge is limited capital. He is described as an honest and hardworking man who encourages lenders to always give clients the loan amount they apply for to enable them to meet their targets. They are a bunch of hard working micro entrepreneurs who are committed to work hard to continue benefiting from the partnership.

loans.use: to hire labour and buy fertilizer to mulch his plantation.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a humble,honest,ever smiling, charming and favorite grandpa. He is 65 years old and admirable because at his age, despite illnesses and other disadvantages, he is still standing and fighting to work in his farm. His primary source of income is milk, crops and some vegetables that he plants. He also engages in a personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture. Geoffrey practices agriculture with a difference; employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural trainings he has been attending to broaden his skills. Although he earns handsome profits from farming, he faces one big challenge and that is the high prices of fertilizers, seedlings and inputs, and this is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro-vet shop in his area.

He is requesting a loan to start an agro-vet shop. The Githu area has only one agro dealer who is catering for thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them extra amounts, since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys a monopoly. Geoffrey wants to change this and seize the business opportunity, and through your loan, he will start an agro-vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market.

Geoffrey will also help the smallholder farmers in his area who for a long time have been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan, Geoffrey will change from the peasant farmer he is right now to a certified agro dealer. Geoffrey believes that there is no doubt that old men like him can find rewarding employment in farming. He patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to start an agro-vet shop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph who is ever smiling is a 43-year-old man, hard-working, thriving and perseverant who with sweat and commitment has been farming for the past 7 years so as to support himself and the members of his household. He resides in the remote area of Kapsowar an area that has harsh living conditions and to survive you must have turf skin. Joseph passionately loves farming. He has been farming for the past 7 years and has always managed to provide for his family. Feeding his family requires a lot of hard work and determination. His other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that he does in order to provide food for his parents and family. In farming, he enjoys the returns he gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living.

The main challenge that Joseph faces is that his cows stray on to his neighbour's compound. This has been causing many losses to him, because he has to compensate for the damages caused by the animals. He is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire. Through the loan he will be able to control his animals, and this will help him a great deal. He will save more money. This loan will change his life and will secure the future of his school-going children. He awaits your kindness. Kindly help him out!

loans.use: to buy for some barbed wire to prevent his animals from straying

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a lively and resilient man. He is from a neighborhood that's very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict, but with work and effort and without complaint, he wants to bring his family ahead.

Zakayo is a father of three from Eldoret, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He has spent the past 7 years of his life farming. He sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on his farm. He also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Zakayo is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which he is involved, poultry farming is closest to his heart. Zakayo wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. He would like to expand his poultry business, but the biggest challenge he faces is lack of capital.

He is requesting a loan of KES 30,000, which he will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Zakayo will be able to expand the poultry section on his farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and he will also be able to save extra money. Zakayo is very concerned about his children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Zakayo dreams of a secure future for his children. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of wood to make bedroom furiniture.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as loving.

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

This is Esther's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

Esther will use this KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future she will live well.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania works with her husband in managing their rice farm in Sibutad, Zamboanga, Del Sur. She has always found ways to add to their core income and improve their living situation. 

She has borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to pay for labor for drying the harvested rice so that she can produce more rice to sell. She expects that the increased sales will enable her to repay the loan and keep a small surplus to help her children. 

In the future, Josephine wants a better quality of life for her family and to produce even more rice.

loans.use: To pay for labor for drying the harvested rice.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Porferia is 53 years old now.

Porferia has a vehicle transportation business in the Philippines. Porferia requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Porferia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Porferia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is fifty years old and married with two children. For the past three years she has been working hard running her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Rosita has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as beverages, condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries. She is working to ensure a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her sari-sari

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 32 years old, strong, full of energy, and hardworking. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. Stella has a handsome husband and two children that she really admires and would do anything for so that they never lack anything.

Through practicing dairy and crop farming, she has always been able to provide food for her family and also meet their basic needs. She has acquired much experience over the last ten years, and this has helped her earn profits. She is seeking a loan for KES 25,000 to buy poultry and, through the loan, she is sure that she will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Chuka, which is densely populated and has a ready markets for eggs and poultry. Because of the immense knowledge that Stella has and also because of the good will she enjoys with the villagers, she will not have any challenge in selling her products. She also believes that through word of mouth she will be able to get more customers and increase her customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Stella and her family, and this will also allow her to make permanent changes to her life and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is on the verge of establishing one of her most cherished dreams which is to increase her poultry business. She is a very hard-working, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kakoy, a remote village in Nandihills area of Kenya. Caroline is happily married and is blessed with six adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, Caroline has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and to earn extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Caroline finds poultry farming very enjoyable: she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is "the increased profits I enjoy". Caroline's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the really high level of demand.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is therefore seeking a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. As a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she is relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, Caroline will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market: this will translate into increased profits and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, Caroline intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry sales to other markets: this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will earn will be used to fully repay the loan, to permanently change her living conditions and to secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Francis, a 30-year-old smallholder farmer who always brings a pleasant feeling when he is at home. He hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that is a city of champions because of producing so many elite athletes. Being a father comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work; hence, Francis has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of his family.

Francis started farming just after finishing high school since he never advanced his education. Because of the high unemployment rate, he ventured into farming, and he has never regretted this because of the profits he has been making. Francis practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in his village, because he is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also doing tea farming. Francis is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy goat farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges he has faced is lack of enough capital.

That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy goat. Through the loan Francis is confident that his life will be transformed and his dream of providing a secure future for his family will be achieved. Francis is relieved to know that his life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small-scale and aspiring men such as Francis.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
At a tender age, starting a new family and home with a small piece of land is a challenge for people in the Kitale area of Kenya. Eunice a lovely mother has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income.

Eunice passionately loves poultry farming and feeding her poultry makes her very proud. Waking up every day in the morning to collect eggs from her poultry makes her feel fulfilled. Although this humble mum makes a profit through selling poultry, the biggest challenge she faces is meeting the demand of the market that is available.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is an institution that serves poor, small-landholding farmers, Eunice has acquired both financial and technical training. With the loan, she intends to increase her egg production from one crate a day to three crates a day. A crate of eggs goes for 450 KES, and with three crates, he will be making 1,350 KES per day. With the loan, she will be able to increase her income and move from subsistence to more commercial farming. With this loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and enhance her food security and that of her community.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is an ambitious woman and looks to a future when she is the leading supplier of horticulture products. She's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill her dream From Kiva lenders, Margaret is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Margaret access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector.

With your loan, Margaret’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seeds and grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty, the will to get ahead and to secure the future of her children, are some of the reasons that made Vibian start practicing mixed farming. Vibian is a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past five years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. Vibian lives near Kabirisan in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming.

Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat "ugali," or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but the cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. The Kabirisan area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down, so farmers cannot grind their maize. Vibian intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area.

She will buy an electric, rather than diesel posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully, breakdowns will be few and far between. To accomplish this, Vibian is applying for an 80,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Vibian sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kindness. Dare to dream and support her!

loans.use: to buy an electric posho mill to grind maize into flour.

loans.name: Cyrose

texts.en:
Cyrose is ambitious, admirable, and a hard worker who wants to triumph. She wants to leave her mark on the world. At 20 years old, she is independent and runs her own mixed farming business. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. 

Cyrose owns a small parcel of land that she uses to grow maize and keep dairy animals. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. The land provides her with not only capital for her business but also a home for her family. She is blessed with a lovely family! 

Cyrose is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for her food and her business. The demand for cereals in the market, only a few kilometers from Cyrose's home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position to supply cereal seeds and still be a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. 

Your loan will directly elevate Cyrose’s livelihood. She strives to give her family a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in. Kindly loan to her!

loans.use: To buy cereal seeds

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Romana, a farming woman and a fighter, pushing ahead at age 32. She is a very hard-working and self-driven farmer who is based in Koyo, a remote village in Nandihills. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives.

Romana is happily married and blessed with four lovely, good-looking children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming.

She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Nandihills area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business.

Romana is a member of Arise and shine self-help group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business. Help out this heroine!

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of one, and from Nandihills, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya.

She has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Lucy is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart.

Lucy wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals to sell.

The Nandihills area has a ready-market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Lucy will be able to sell cereal to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Lucy is very concerned about her child’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay her school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children. Lucy awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Meet Monicah, a 38-year-old mother of four children who resides in the Nandihills area in Kenya. She is very humble and a go-getter. Monicah has been  farming for the last three years on her small plot. Monicah enjoys mixed farming very much and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. Monicah has always dreamed big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to start the shop and make her dream come true. With your loan, Monicah will be able to improve her income level and to comfortably take care of her family. Monicah’s projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: To buy cereals for her shop.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Judy has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. With the little time Judy has, she sells crops from her small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. Judy is seeking a Kiva loan of 30,000 KES to buy seed and grow her agriculture business. Produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. Experience shows that farming offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income. The government, however, fails to ensure that small and poor farmers are afforded opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Judy access to a loan that will support her farm to become a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Judy’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seed and grow her farm.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose continúa con su negocio de carpintería. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de madera para fabricar muebles. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su carpintería funciona con éxito debido a la tendencia para adquirir mobiliario de oficina, comedor, gabinetes de dormitorio y salas, entre otros, “existen empresas importadoras de muebles y muchos centros comerciales dedicados a este rubro, con el boom de la construcción la gente se ve obligada a amueblar esas construcciones…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas frecuentes, la desventaja es el pago para transportar los muebles. Su sueño es consolidar su carpintería, él desea realizar la compra de madera por mayor para fabricar muebles y estabilizar su negocio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera para fabricar muebles y estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en: Jose continues with his carpentry business. He invested his previous loan buying wood to make furniture. He made his payments on time, because he did not have any problems. His carpentry shop is running successfully due to the tendency of acquiring office furniture, dining room sets, bedroom and living room cabinets, among other things. "There are companies that are importing furniture and many malls devoted to this industry. With the construction boom people need to furnish these buildings...", he comments. The advantage of this business is that he has frequent sales, the disadvantage is the cost of transporting the furniture. His dream is to consolidate his carpentry shop. He wants to buy wood at wholesale prices to make furniture and stabilize his business. This is his third loan cycle with the institution in the 11 years he has been working in this business independently. These are the reasons why Jose is requesting a loan to buy wood to make furniture and stabilize his business.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture and stabilize his business.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
Hermogenes es un hombre de 56 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 17 años y una hija de 21 años, y su negocio es la carnicería.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, contante, generoso, atento, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chasquipampa’ que es una zona apta para recibir energía de paz y relajación, se puede realizar turismo de aventura, caminatas, escalar y conocer las leyendas que acechan lo enigmático de la zona. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre 8-21 grados centígrados.
