Hermogenes es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza con su esposa que trabaja en el comercio de verduras y con su hija menor que estudia en la universidad, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la carnicería; diariamente se dirige al matadero municipal donde compra grandes cortes de carne por mayor para llevarla a su carnicería y venderla al menudeo, las partes más comerciales son; Biste, Cuadrado, Cabeza de lomo, Peseto, Filete, hueso blanco, paleta, chuleta, molida especial y molida corriente, “he ampliado mi negocio, continua siendo una tienda de barrio, la denominación comercial exacta es Carnicería Fina, en honor a mi madre…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es de su propiedad, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de reces enteras. Su sueño es ampliar el espacio físico de su carnicería, él desea realizar la compra de una pieza de res completa para la venta en su carnicería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Hermogenes solicita un préstamo para la compra de una pieza de res completa para la venta en su carnicería.
texts.en:
Hermogenes is a 56 year old man, married, and has two sons ages 25 and 17 and one daughter age 21. His business is a butchery. He is a good father and learner, independent, solvent, generous, attentive, responsible and very hard-working. His business is located in the 'Chasquipampa' district, an area suited to receive peaceful energy and relaxation. You can experience adventure tourism like climbing, and hikes, and get to know the legends that lurk mysteriously over the region. The climate is dry and cold with temperatures ranging from 8-21 degrees Celsius. Hermogenes is darker complected, with brown eyes and short black hair. He is of shorter stature, slender, and his native tongue is Aymará which he speaks among his family and he speaks Spanish for the general culture and at his business. 

He lives with his wife who sells vegetables and his daughter who attends university. They live on their own family property, constructed of brick and cement, with a metal roof and wood floors. They rely on potable water, electricity, gas, and sewage. His business is the butcher shop. Everyday he drives to the municipal slaughterhouse where he buys large cuts of meat to bring back to the butcher shop to retail. The most commercial cuts are: steak, chuck round, tenderloin, rib-eye, filet, bone marrow, shoulder, sirloin, and ground beef.

He says "I've grown my business and it continues to be a local shop, the technical commercial designation is Carnicería Fina, in honor of my mother." The advantage of his business is that he owns the property, the disadvantage is the lack of capital needed to purchase entire cuts of meat. His dream is to increase the physical space of his butchery. He wants to be able to purchase a entire cut of meat to sell at his butcher shop. This is his first loan sequence with any institution in 30 years of work. For these reasons Hermogenes is requesting a loan for the purchase of a entire cut of meat to sell at his butcher shop.

loans.use: with the purchase of an entire cut of meat to sell at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a creative, full of life and hard-working young woman who is dedicated to her family. Anyone watching her at work will admire her for the determination and dedication that she puts into each one of her tasks. Farming has been the key to her success. Nandihills area is a rain-fed area popularly known for maize and dairy farming.

With the help of her beloved husband, Grace runs a successful rural enterprise, capitalizing on her small piece of land. The farm consists of her home, a cow, poultry and trees. Grace is planning to grow her farm business, but the only way she can do this without having to purchase more land is by focusing on poultry.

Poultry farming is a very lucrative venture that does not require very much land space to be conducted. Grace is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more heads of poultry in a bid to boost egg production and ultimately increase her income. Her family will use the eggs produced to fill domestic needs and to meet commercial ends. Money generated from the sales will be used to settle the loan debt and pay part of their children's education expenses. Grace vision is to provide for her family and to meet their needs as best as she can.
Help Grace to keep living the dream!

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a 48-year-old farmer who is always deferential to the people she meets. She comes from a small village called Koilot, which is found in the Rift valley Province of Kenya. She is a dairy farmer. Her main income source is milk.

Magdaline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to construct a cowshed. She has six dairy cows that lack shelter. As a consequence, they are exposed to harsh weather changes.

However, with your loan investment, Magdaline will use the money to construct a cowshed for her cows. The housing will offer comfort and protection to the farm animals. The shelter will also pave the way to the introduction of zero-grazing, or confined, feeding. This will have a significant boost to milk production quantities, because the cows will use the energy that they would have otherwise used to wander in search for pasture, to manufacture milk.

Kindly loan to her!

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Leah, who, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They didn't just get together romantically; they joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and has gained so much experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandihills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming and she is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 37-year-old farmer from Kerugoya in the central region of Kenya. He has been blessed with a lovely family and has been doing mixed-farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and earnings from side-businesses. Joseph enjoys milking. Milking to him is a hobby by itself. However, he has not been milking since his cow was pregnant. The cow delivered, but he is still sparing the milk for the calf. This whole situation has had an effect on his livelihood. His own family has not been getting much milk, and also his income has been cut.

Joseph is seeking a loan to purchase a highly productive dairy cow. The cow will produce more milk than that which an average cow can produce in a day. This will get him back on his feet after months of low income. Having an additional cow will also cushion him against losses associated with such scenarios in the future. Returns from this investment will help him to meet some of the high farming-related costs. When he was asked how his family will benefit if he was granted this loan, he said, "The loan will increase the number of my dairy animals. I will use the returns to build a dairy unit that will boost my milk production. The extra income as a result of this loan will help me take better care of my family needs."
Joseph just needs a little help that he can get from you; a loan may change his life.

loans.use: To buy a dairy animal

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Speaking with the ever-smilling Mercy, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Nkubu, along with a handsome husband and their three angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

Mercy has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity.

Mercy is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm.

Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Mercy and her family.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a young farmer from Igoji, a remote village in Nkubu, Kenya. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is the mother of seven children and has been doing farming for the last five years to supplement her income. Evangeline does crop farming and raises cattle and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances to improve her farming and prevent diseases. She is seeking a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase a goat. With this goat, by the end of the year the goat will have given birth to at least four other goats. Through goat keeping, she will be able to get goat skin, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell goat meat which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a small-holder farmer based in Central Kenya. His main source of income is milk. Julius aspires to grow his business, earn more income and take good care of his wife and children.
One way that James can improve his business is by ensuring his cows are more productive. He is seeking a loan to buy a machine that will turn hay into chaff for feeding his livestock. With this asset, his animals will enjoy good fodder, which is cleanly and evenly cut, free of dust, of good color and with a fresh aroma. The chaff cutting machine will also make it easier for him to handle fodder in bulk, especially when mixing chaff with other feed to make a balanced ration for his livestock. 
James can also make additional income by starting up his own chaff cutting operation and Juhudi Kilimo has an agricultural extension officer who provides such advice and technical assistance to such borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a rural small-holder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has three children. Besides crop farming, he also does dairy and sheep farming for extra food and income.  The key lesson he has taken away from many years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.
George is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seed and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase George’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 37-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Mount Kenya. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with lovely, angelic children. On the land, they have kept goats and grown vegetables for three years. Their main income sources are goats and crops. They recently ventured into a “side hustle” business.

From Kiva lenders, Robert is seeking a loan worth KES 50,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi Kilimo has teamed up with Kiva to afford Robert access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business and that will also increase employment opportunities and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Robert’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but it will also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to grow his horticulture business

loans.name: Four Of Us Group

texts.en:
Mary is a member of Four of Us group. She is a married mother of four, all going to school. She is 37 years old and helps her husband to pay school fees for their children. Mary lives in the high-density suburbs of Harare with her family. She joined Thrive, along with her other group members, in June 2015. They received business advice, which she described as a key that unlocks her potential in business. She is very appreciative for the training she received and is very confident that she will be able to manage her business in a better way.

Mary has a butchery at the local shops in Southlands, Harare. She sells meat and other meat products. She started her business four years ago. Mary and the other group members have applied for a combined loan of 1,100 USD. Mary wants to use her portion of the loan to restock more meat in bulk in order to reduce transportation costs and to buy at a discount, which will enable her to reduce her prices.

loans.use: to restock her butcher shop.

loans.name: Macharia

texts.en:
Macharia comes from a remote village found in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. He practices a range of farming activities which include maize/corn, dairy, sheep and poultry farming. Most of his income goes to his family's household expenses. Macharia is determined to grow his business and improve his family’s income.

He is seeking a loan to buy poultry for the purpose of farming meat and eggs for food and income. With the borrowed money, he also plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. He is optimistic that the investment will pay off with the increase in demand for poultry and horticultural products in the market.
With your loan, will seize these important economic opportunities and improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and poultry

loans.name: Tamuka Group

texts.en:
Meet Tamuka group from Chitungwiza. Tamuka is a vernacular word which refers to a group of people who are wide awake. This group is based in Chitungwiza and has a number of tailors and one sole trader. In this group we have Junior, a lady who operates a tuckshop in Unit A. The tuckshop has various groceries. She started the business after she was given a small amount by her husband, another clear sign of how most women act more responsibly when it comes to money matters (especially in poorer communities).

The shop is not fully stocked; she has a lot of empty shelves which needs stock but the potential that she sits on cannot be masked. As a business lady she had challenges of some breakages, which are always costly to her business, usually caused by too frequent restocking days.

She hopes the loan from Thrive will help her to fully restock her tuckshop with groceries rather than restocking on a daily basis with small amounts, a very costly situation.

loans.use: to buy in bulk and save costs.

loans.name: Four Advanced Ladies Group

texts.en:
Four Advanced ladies is made up of four serious ladies, as the name depicts. These ladies started with a rotating savings club amongst themselves.

Juliet has her own small tuckshop from which she sells a small range of foodstuffs and household products. They further advanced their game into a group business, which was to be operated by the group. The scale of their activities is very small but the fact that they have stayed together over the past years shows the determination that these women possess.

These ladies started by rearing poultry in the year 2012, which was followed by making peanut butter. These businesses helped these ladies to buy their home furniture and sending their kids into school. These ladies operate and manage their finances as group; they are hopeful that a loan from Thrive will help them expand their businesses of poultry, peanut butter manufacturing and a vegetable stall, which will make it easier for them to keep their children in school.

loans.use: to expand their tuckshop (small shop selling food) and peanut butter manufacturing business.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is married and has three children. He is able to provide for his family through practicing livestock and crop farming. On his half an acre farmland, he keeps dairy cows, poultry, sheep and pigs. He also grows vegetables, fruits and fodder.

The biggest challenge faced by Boniface is unpredictable weather. In Nkubu, where Boniface is from, farmers who produce food use an irrigation system to get through the dry season. Boniface himself implemented irrigation but he needs your help to acquire water pipes to complete the kit.

These pipes will be used to channel water from the river to the intended areas on the farm. Using the water pipes, Boniface will keep his soil moist and productive. This investment will put Boniface on a straight path of growth and prosperity.

loans.use: to buy water pipes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 24, is a smallholder farmer who lives in a small village called Karurune in the central region of Kenya. In this area, dairy and crop farming are the main economic activities practiced by the constituents. Alice, a mixed-farmer, practices both. 

She has been doing this work for six good years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops and a side hustle business that she does to supplement the income from farming. The mother of one stated that milking is the most enjoyable of her activities on the farm. She is very connected with her dairy animals and has assigned a name to each of them. She has dreams of growing her dairy farm by herding more animals. 

Alice is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES only to purchase a dairy goat. Business-related expenses keep rising by the day, forcing farmers and businessmen alike to reduce costs and/or increase sales. The dairy goat will help in the utilization of pasture and will increase milk production and availability of more byproducts such as fertilizers. Alice will be able to save a bit on the expenses such as fertilizer. She promises that she will use your loan investment wisely to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 45-year-old, ever-smiling smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small agricultural center near Mount Kenya. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with two children. On the land, they have kept goats and grown vegetables for 15 years. Their main income sources are goat milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small side hustle business.

From Kiva lenders, Gilbert is seeking a loan worth KES 30,000 to buy seeds and grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi Kilimo has teamed up with Kiva to afford Gilbert access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business and that will increase employment opportunities and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Gilbert’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income but will also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias, 28, is a father of six who practices small-scale dairy farming in Igoji in the central region of Kenya. The area is popular for dairy and banana farming. He has 10 years of experience in farming. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. He grows bananas too for making 'Matoke,' a sumptuous traditional delicacy made out of boiled bananas.

Elias stated that he enjoys dairy farming most because it is the most profitable of all the farming activities. He would like to grow the business but he is experiencing financial constraints.

Elias is seeking a loan to construct a cow barn. The housing structure will provide adequate bedding and enhance good milking hygiene. His biggest complaint is the cost of the building material. His highest monthly expense is farm inputs. 

Make a loan and help Elias improve the state of his dairy farm. He will make more income as a result and repay the loan with no difficulty. Profits from the investment will go to expansion of the business. You can help Elias with a loan and get him closer to achieving his dreams.

loans.use: to construct a cow barn.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
30-year-old Faith has never set foot in any higher learning institution, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with two adorable children.

For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers from their village seek technical advice from her on the best dairy farming techniques.

Faith is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Faith could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Faith, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Faith believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Faith to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Tatenda Group

texts.en:
Tatenda group is based in Stoneridge, near Chitungwiza, a community that has mushroomed with the potential of business growth. Tatenda is a Shona word and means “We thank you’’. It does not tell who or for what, but I believe they know.

The group has six ladies who are distinct feminine but display a masculine character from their business ventures. In this group we have Mercy, one of the bravest women who has graced this planet since the industrial revolution.

Mercy specialises in the making of sofas, wardrobes, kitchen units - we can name all the furniture but the truth is she is very industrial. Mercy has other labourers who help her to do her primary industry at Glenview area 8 complex. Mercy has dominated this patriarchal industry and has become one of the best manufacturers of furniture since the year 2005. She was able to help her husband to pay school fees for their children and secure a stand where they live.

Mercy has challenges of money, as the furniture manufacturing industry requires large sums of money. She is hopeful, in fact more thankful, for the loan from Thrive as it will help her to buy materials for her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of finished goods to sell.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Fridah, a young farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture.

Fridah is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some varieties of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Fridah passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nkubu and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hardwork and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nkubu and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local markets.

With your loan, Fridah will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. Fridah has been practicing agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through your loan that Fridah's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future. Loan to her today!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is 45 years old and a single woman with 3 children. She runs a small business selling pies in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Sani has requested a loan to buy sack of flour, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings,Sani will hope to extend her bakery and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, cooking oil, fry pan, yeast etc...

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 27-year-old mom who resides in the Nandihills area in Kenya. She is very humble and a go-getter. She is a mother of two. Betty has been practicing farming for the last seven years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. Betty enjoys dairy farming, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming she has been able to take care of her family and provide their basic needs. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. That is why she is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES to start a cereal-selling shop and make her dream come true. With your loan, Betty will be able to improve her income level and be able to comfortably take care of her family. Betty’s projections are that by the end of the first year, she will be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to pay the loan and provide a secure future for her children

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Maliaonolia

texts.en:
Malia is 46 years old and married woman with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Malia has requested a loan to buy sack of flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast, fry pan and etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Malia will hope to renew her business.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan etc...

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Caroline, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business (dressmaking).

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Most people in Africa dream of getting a good education and a well-paying job but this has not been the case for Johana. His highest education level is primary school and he has never succeeded in getting employment. Despite all these adversities he picked himself up and he has been farming for the past 10 years.

He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. Johana has a wife, and has been blessed with four lovely children that he refers to as “my heart beat.” His primary sources of income are crops, milk, poultry, and some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income.

Deciding to practice dairy farming was not difficult for Amos because he emulated what his parents were doing. However, the demand for milk is overwhelming, and he wants to increase his dairy cattle. The biggest challenge is a lack of funds. He is seeking a loan, with which he plans to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow. He passionately loves dairy farming, and when he was asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, he stated, “feeding my cows.” His hobby is milking his cow.

He sells milk to his neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been so high that he cannot meet it. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing his farm's milk productivity. The dairy cow that he plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk per day. This will immediately translate to a higher profit margin and increased income level.

Johana will use profits from selling milk to paying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase his business enterprise. Johana is very visionary, and he intends that in the near future he will start adding value to his milk business through packaging the milk before selling. In addition, he plans to start selling other dairy products, such as cream. An improved income level will assure his family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, he will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a high-quality breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Ning

texts.en:
Ning is a 45-year-old woman who is working in a supermarket. In her free time, she will help her husband to sell a kind of snack, called ”steamed vermicelli rolls” with a motorcycle. They have a daughter who is working in the countryside and they need to support their elderly mother who is 80 years old. 

Ning and her husband have engaged in selling snacks for half a year and the payment is meager, they can only make ends meet in domestic life, so Ning has found another job in a supermarket. For saving on costs, Ning rents a small room to support the family's daily life. 

Ning requested 5,000 CNY from Microcred. She wants to use the money to purchase materials for making snacks. In this way, they could make different kinds of snacks for attracting more clients. In her future, Ning wants to buy a big house which could provide a better life for her elderly mother. Ning has a dream of opening her own restaurant; she and her husband will work together to achieve their dream.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making different kinds of snacks to attract more clients

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a marvelous, good-hearted young woman who makes her living by practicing mixed farming. She is ambitious and full of hope for the future.

She makes a living doing mixed farming in the Kitale area of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry for commercial milk and eggs, respectively. Besides mixed farming, Hellen is also very concerned about the health of the environment. She spends most of her time working on her farm.

Hellen is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to purchase farm implements. These tools will make the work on her farm move much faster and easier. Tending to her farm involves a lot of digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools in the market that are handy for a woman in her line of work. The equipment does not come cheap, however.

The increase in income from this investment will go to her family's welfare and her children's education. All that remains is for her to say "thank you" to the people who are supporting her project.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Today's Women Group

texts.en:
Today’s Women are a group based in Chitungwiza. In this group there is Mary, who is a cross border, usually crossing the South African border to bring in furniture of different varieties. She started the business when she noticed that furniture (especially electrical appliances) are cheaper in South Africa than on the local market.

At present she is mainly buying and selling gas cylinder stoves which are selling like hot cakes owing to the frequent power outages in her community. Mary also has hires out her public announcement system for occasions like weddings, parties and community gatherings. This business is usually active during the weekends, holidays and public holidays. Through her frequent crossborder travels Mary has significantly complemented her husband’s income and now she can even dream of building her own house and buying medical insurance for her family.

She hopes a loan from Thrive will help her to buy cordless microphones, a set of good speakers, a screen and some furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Her unbreakable spirit, winning attitude, perseverance, and determination in her farming have enabled Emily to work hard and commit herself to the fulfilment of her dreams. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business (posho mill business).

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Fananafu

texts.en:
Faananafu is 35 years old unmarried woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Faananafu has requested a loan to buy sack of flour, cooking oil, fry pan and etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Faananafu will save it for unexpected emergencies and to support her family financially .

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan etc...

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 54-year-old, smallholder farmer from Nkubu area in the central region of Kenya. On the farm, she keeps dairy animals and grows crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. Dorothy is seeking a loan to expand her farm by planting bananas. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her banana farm's output.

Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Dorothy. Through a group of 15 members called Mwangaza, Dorothy has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, farming especially banana farming represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitate loans that empower smallholder farmers like Dorothy because the institution believe that women too are actively involved in various segments of the banana farming industry. Her projections are that by the end of the first year she will be selling bananas to different markets in Kenya. Dorothy believes that it takes someone to help someone so kindly lend to her.

loans.use: to plant bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her production of chickens.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a farmer who has does not give up in spite of any circumstances that occur. She is always ready to get resources for her family. She gets up early in the morning in order to tend to her business of raising and selling poultry and vegetables, as well as some personal business she engages in to supplement the meager farming income she earns. Alice is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The women in the area are currently doing tasks on the farm previously performed by men. They have been forced to take over. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business related expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Alice replied, "I will be able to educate my children.

loans.use: To purchase modern farming implements

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 28-year-old, married man from Deir Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, Raed started his own business a few years ago. He manages a store for selling frozen meat also sells grilled meat. This is the only source of income for the family. Raed took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new inventory and meat for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Raed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new inventory and meat for his store.

loans.name: Mati

texts.en:
Mati is a 28-year-old mother with one child. She has a small business of sewing clothes and sells them in her community to earn a living.

Mati has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, tape measure, and container to help her with the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, tape measure, and container.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 42, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support the family, she has been involved in farming business more than twenty years, grows banana and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 3.00 a day, on average.In this farming season.

She is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her banana plantation. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.en:
Abdusamad is a careful father. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1987. He is married and has one child. He works as a security guard for 7 years. He is strong, goal oriented and capable person and is satisfied to have a job. His salary is enough to make repayments on time. 

He feels bad himself and wishes to be treated at hospital. He is willing to get a loan to be treated at hospital. He hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra, aged 36, lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She owns a small business selling beauty products (cosmetics). Kubra contributes her full income to pay household expenses. She is always trying to establish her business through offering the latest cosmetics. Nowadays, there is much demand for the latest cosmetics that are introduced in the market and they are also expensive.

Kubra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the full amount in her business so she can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipsticks, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this loan, she will be empowered to enhance her business. 

Kubra is very thankful to Kiva and Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipsticks, nail polish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Diosdidit

texts.en:
Diosdidit is from Iloilo, Philippines and owns a passenger boat. He is 38 years and has 2 children, aged 5 and 2 years. 

Diosdidit has been running a passenger boat service for 5 years. He works hard to provide for his family's needs. His wife stays at home and takes good care of their children. 

In the future, Diosdidit dreams of being successful in his business. He dreams of improving his livelihood to have a better living. 

Diosdidit is asking for a loan to buy fuels for his passenger boat and to start a new business like buying and selling fuels to the community. He also plans to buy a refilling bottled water machine for an additional income.

loans.use: to buy fuels and refilling bottled water machine

loans.name: Mapaiso Group

texts.es:
Elva es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 1, 3, 11 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad  en su tienda general.
Ella es buena madre, amable, paciente, generosa, dedicada, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que es un lugar especial para los pobladores porque se encuentra el altar de la Virgen, La leyenda cuenta que la imagen fue encontrada por dos campesinos quienes vieron un resplandor que venia del interior del tronco de un árbol, cuando ellos se acercaron encontraron la imagen de la Virgen. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Elva es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (de pie al centro, viste de negro, esta con los brazos cruzados). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela y los menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. 
Sus deseos de superación por la necesidad de generar mejores ingresos para su familia, la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; elaboración de sombreros de sao, artesanía en cerámica, confección de tejidos, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de comida, servicio de limpieza, servicio de moto taxi y salón de belleza, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad  en su tienda general; ella atiende una tienda de barrio en su mismo domicilio dónde vende alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; refrescos, pan, azúcar, golosinas, etc., “trabajo durante toda la semana para que las ventas no se detengan, tengo un negocio exitoso…” comenta. 
La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son contantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir la tienda de abarrotes. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para atender a muchos clientes, ella desea realizar la compra de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad  para abastecer su tienda general. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elva solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad  para abastecer su tienda general y atender a muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Elva is a 36 year old woman. She lives with her partner, and has 4 children ages 1, 3, 11 and 16;  her business is selling staple goods and food in a general store.
She is a good mother, kind, patient, generous, dedicated, responsible and hardworking. Her business takes place in 'Cotoca,' a special place for its residents, because there is an altar of the Virgin; The legend tells that  the Virgen’s image was found by two farmers who saw a glow coming from inside of a tree trunk and when they came close, they found the image of the Virgin. It has a warm subtropical climate with day temperature between 21-35 degrees Celsius.
Elva has a dark complexion, with brown eyes and black long hair that she ties; she is short in stature and has a robust build. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. For business and general knowledge, she uses Spanish. (She is standing at center , dressed in black and with crossed arms). She enjoys her life with his partner, who works as a driver, and her children; The oldest kids study in school and the youngest are not old enough to begin school yet. They live in a rented room built of wood with tin roof and brick floor and have potable water, electricity and sewage.
Her desire to excel by the need to generate better income for her family took her to form an association with people in business such as making Sao hats, pottery crafts, weaving, selling natural health products, selling  secondhand clothes, selling food, cleaning services, motorcycle taxi service and beauty salon, to request a loan and improve their activities. Her business is the sale of staple goods and food in a general store; She works in a neighborhood store in her own home where she sells food and basic items including refreshments, bread, sugar, candies, etc., "I work during the all week; for that, the sales do not stop, I have a successful business …," she says.
The advantage of her business is that the sales are constant, but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock the store. Her dream is to expand her business to attend more clients; she wants to purchase staple goods and food to stock her general store. This is her 1st sequence of loans with the institution in two years she is doing this activity.
For the above, Elva is requesting a loan to purchase staple items and food to stock her general store and serve many customers.

loans.use: to buy staple food and items to stock a general store and serve many customers

loans.name: Ivone

texts.pt:
A cliente Ivone de 28 anos de idade, casada, trabalhadora como educadora de infância, mãe de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primário  e o outro ainda sem idade escolar, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, cimento, areia, porta, janela, pedra, chapas de zinco para dar continuidade da sua obra tipo 3.
A cliente tem como sonho concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e futuramente comprar um carro para o seu dia-a-dia.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o crédito para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Ivone is 28. She is married, she works as a kindergarten teacher and she has 2 children; one of them in grade school and one is too young to attend. She lives in a house that she owns. 
She will use this loan to buy cement, sand, a door, a window, stone, zinc sheets to continue building her three room home.
Her dream is to finish her home to be able to offer a better place to her family; she will also like to buy a car in the future to get around town.
She struggles financially, but she is committed to working hard and with the help of future loans she hopes she'll be able to overcome hard times and fulfilll her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, a door, a window, stone, zinc sheets to continue building her three room home.

loans.name: Pedro Alejandro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre  de 33 años de edad, vie con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 5 años y una hija de 9 años, y su negocio es la Zapatería.
Él es buen padre, independiente, emprendedor, amable, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Natividad’ donde se encuentra el coliseo famoso por sus combates de lucha libre de ‘cholitas’ mujeres de vestir tradicional pelean al estilo lucha libre en el ring. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Pedro es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja independientemente y con sus hijos; el mayo estudia en la escuela y el menor se encuentra en el kinder, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de zapatos de cholita (mujer de vestir tradicional), el cual realiza en su taller propio ubicado en cercanías de su casa, se ocupa de comprar los materiales como; cuero, cuerina, plástico, suelas pegamentos, etc., “inicié mi negocio como ayudante en el taller de mi papá, ya son 7 años que trabajo independientemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que tiene temporadas de ventas fuertes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de coser cuero industrial. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir su casa, él desea realizar la compra de una máquina industrial para coser cuero. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pedro solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina industrial para coser cuero y confecciona zapatos de cholita.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 33-year-old man. He lives with his partner. He has a son who is 5 years old and a daughter who is 9 years old. He is a shoemaker.

He is a good father and an independent, entrepreneurial, patient, friendly, responsible and hard-working man. He has his business in the "Villa Natividad" area, where the arena is located which is famous for the "cholitas" wrestling matches, women who free-style wrestle in the ring wearing traditional clothing. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies between 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Pedro is a short, robust, dark-complexioned man, with brown eyes and short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for his business. He shares his life with his partner who works independently and with his children. The older child is in school and the younger one is in kindergarten. They live in a family-owned home made of brick and cement with a sheet metal roof and wood floor. It has potable water, electricity and a sewage system.

His business is the making of shoes "de cholita"--shoes for women who wear traditional clothing. He does this in his own workshop which is located near his house. He buys material such as leather, "cuerina" [material used to mimic leather and other kinds of natural pelts], plastic, soles, glue etc. "I began my business as an assistant in my father's workshop. I have been working independently for 7 years," he says. The advantage of his business is that it has seasons with strong sales. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy an industrial sewing machine for sewing leather.

His dream is to buy land and build his house. He desires to realize the purchase of an industrial sewing machine to sew leather. This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in the 7 years that he has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Pedro is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to sew leather and make shoes for women who wear traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to sew leather and make "cholita" shoes [shoes for women who wear traditional clothing]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron boards, cement, stone, nails, wire, to continue building his home.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married, has three children and is a smallholder farmer based in the Thika region of Kenya, where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. His main source of income is from his dairy cows.

One way that John can improve his dairy is by ensuring his cows are as productive as possible. He is seeking a 80,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutting machine that will turn hay into chaff to feed his cows. They will enjoy fodder that is cleanly and evenly cut and with a fresh aroma, which will increase their intake and so boost their health and productivity.

The additional income generated as a result of this loan will help John both repay his loan and grow his business. His family will be the greatest beneficiaries of an improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutting machine that will turn hay into chaff to feed his cows.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
A woman full of life, hardworking, honest, and very humble – this is Sarah. Sarah is a mother who takes very good care of her children. She has gone through a lot of adversity in her life, but she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family.

Sarah is a smallholder farmer based in the Nandi Hills in the Rift Valley of Kenya. She owns a small parcel of land that she uses to grow maize and keep dairy animals. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic appearances and environmental health. Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business, but also a home for her family. Sarah is blessed to have five children, with a husband to whom she has stayed married to for 15 years!

Sarah is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in the Nandi Hills area, only a few kilometers from Sarah's home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others.

Your loan will directly elevate Sarah’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up with. Kindly help out this woman who has great desire to succeed. Support the dream of Sarah; be inspired; make a loan!

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a rural, smallholder crop farmer in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He does dairy, poultry, and sheep farming, besides horticulture, and he is looking to improve the efficiency of his business by replacing equipment.

Nickson is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy brand new tools that are modern, improved in design, durable, and comfortable to use.

The impact of this loan will be improved welfare of tool workers, improved quality of work, and efficiency on the farm. This will contribute directly and indirectly to improved productivity of the farm.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline, 32, is happily married and blessed with adorable children. She is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kapomboi, a remote village in Kitale. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years and has gained a lot of experience. She also has another small, personal venture.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, Mercyline has been selling maize, milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable and loves, as she said, “the increased profits I enjoy.” The Kitale area is very populated, so the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high.

Mercyline’s biggest challenge, however, is being unable to take advantage of this high demand for her poultry products. She lacks the money to buy more chickens, and so she is seeking a 60,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to do so. Being a woman, accessing funds can be very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo she is able to do so and is grateful for it.

As a result of this loan, Mercyline will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and in the local market. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more in profits, expand her poultry business into other markets and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her family’s life together and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is a 26 year old smallholder farmer from the rural plains in North Rift Kenya. Sylvester started farming 6 years ago after clearing high school. He was moved by compassion to start looking after his two younger siblings, being the third-orn in a struggling family. Today, he makes a living doing farming. His capital constitutes two dairy cows, a dozen head of poultry and a 1.2 acre crop farm. He recently ventured into the cereal produce industry as a broker. He connects rural farmers to urban buyers.

Sylvester is seeking a loan to aggregate cereal produce from smallholder farmers. With his connection and business network, he intends to sell the produce at a higher price to different buyers in different geographical locations. This move will yield him enough money to repay the loan and settle important bills at home.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 26 year old rural smallholder farmer from the Molo area of Kenya. He makes a living doing dairy and crop farming. He is determined to grow his business and put himself in a better position to provide for his family.

Simon is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan amount on the cow’s insurance as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies.

The impact this loan will have on Simon and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation, and increase in income. His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 50 years old and married with three children.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melanie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, shampoo, soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Marides

texts.en:
Marides is 57 years old and married with eight children.

Marides works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

Marides has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marides aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, shampoo, soap and personal care products

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 42 years old and has two children still in school.

Mary Ann has a buy and sell coco lumber business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coco lumber to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coco lumber to sell

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a farmer and salesperson from Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He practices livestock and horticultural farming for a living. On his 0.5 acre farm, he has cows, poultry, goats, crops and over 200 trees. Besides these sources of income, Abraham aggregates cereal produce from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers at a higher price.

Given that Abraham can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, he prefers to stock large volume of cereal produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers which he will later sell at a higher price, using his understanding of the market conditions and prices.
Income from this investment will help Abraham generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Seventy-five percent of the Kenyan population directly depends on small-scale farming for their livelihood in the rural areas. Lily is one such smallholder farmer. She is a very hard-working, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Nandihills, a remote town in Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with two adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going child.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Esther started farming on a small piece of inherited land in Kigumu, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of six children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Esther believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.
Esther waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Rosemary resides in the Chuka area of Kenya which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family.

Rosemary’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Rosemary has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Chuka area has conditions that favor dairy farming. Rosemary has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10-15 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Chuka area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Rosemary is going to have more milk and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Rosemary to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save energy.
Help her out!

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a seasoned farmer and salesperson from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He is married and has two children. James owns a small piece of land and makes a living doing livestock and crop farming on it. Recently, in an effort to boost his income, he ventured into a side business that involves trading of cereal produce. He has been in this business for a short while but it demonstrates a high potential for returns. James has made up his mind to invest more of his time and resources into it.

James is seeking a loan to aggregate cereal produce from rural farmers. Given that he can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, he will use this loan to build a large volume of cereal produce to make the investment worthwhile. He will use his better understanding of the market and prices to sell the produce at an economic margin.

Income from this investment will help James generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Esther, a young farmer from Nandihills County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture - that it’s for the older generation. Esther is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some varieties of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Esther passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nandihills and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local markets.

With your loan, Esther will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. Esther has been practicing agriculture with a difference employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo and she believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds.

There is no doubt that through your loan, Esther’s life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a sweet 41-year-old woman who has a great sense of humor and belonging with respect to her home and her work. She is a very diligent, honest and organized person who, despite also being a housewife, generates resources by practicing mixed farming. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nkubu area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a responsible, honest, charismatic, smiley and vibrant 41 year-old smallholder farmer. She has been practicing agribusiness for the past ten years and has never looked back. For a living, Winny sells milk and food products from her farm to the local market.

Although Winny has been making profits through farming, she has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge she has encountered is a lack of funds to get her business off the ground. Winny is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kericho and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Winny does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. With this loan, Winny is confident that her income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in her life.

She plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. She also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on her farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Winny will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for her farm. Through this loan, she will assure her large family of secure future and improved living conditions.
Please help this responsible mother today, so that she may achieve this and much more. A loan can change her life.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Full of drive and perseverance is what describes Susan who is 41 years old and a proud mother of a lovely family that she really adores and cherishes. It is through Susan’s perseverance and courage that her family can have a respectable life. Other than doing a side hustle business, Susan is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past four years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Susan practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed animals on her farm. She really enjoys taking care of her poultry. Although Susan has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to be able to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Susan will be assured of a bumper harvest and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Susan will reap more, which will assure her of comfort taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Susan's plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm implements which will increase her yield and enable her to buy more land

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 23 years old and a proud mother of a lovely family that she really adores and cherishes. It is through Vivian’s perseverance and courage that her family can have a respectable life. Other than doing a side hustle business, Vivian is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past four years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming.
