Vivian practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed animals on her farm. She really enjoys taking care of her poultry. Although Vivian has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to be able to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Vivian will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Vivian will reap more, which will assure her of comfort taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Vivian's plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm inputs which will increase her yield and enable her to buy more land

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Муслима. Ей 37 лет. Она жительница города Турсунзаде. Муслима мать троих детей. Ее муж пекарь. Сама Муслима швея. Она у себя дома занимается ручной вышивкой более 10 лет. У нее имеется больше клиентов. Ее клиенты довольны с ее работой, потому что она хорошо вышивает. Муслима хочет расширить свой маленький бизнес. Он планирует приобрести вышивальные принадлежности для расширения бизнеса. Путем расширения деятельности увеличиться ежедневный доход. С такими планами Муслима обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Muslima is 37, the mother of three children, and a resident of the city of Tursunzoda. Her husband works as a baker. Muslima herself is a seamstress; she has been sewing by hand at home for more than 10 years and she has many customers. She is a skilled embroiderer and her customers are very happy with her work.

Muslima now wants to increase her small business. She is planning to buy embroidery supplies and expand her business, which will in turn lead to an increase in her daily income. It is with these goals in mind that she is taking a loan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies and expand her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emily is 45 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Emily has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Emily requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.en:
Maria Lita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Lita is 45 years old and three of herchildren are in school.

Maria Lita has a buy-and-sell personal care products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years/ Maria Lita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotions, etc.

In the future, Maria Lita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotions, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Joyce, 26 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kapkechu, a remote village in Nandihills. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years, and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling tea, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and to make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Nandihills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi, via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
The only thing on Purity’s mind is success; she is a widow at the moment.. She has to work hard and always stay strong through all of the adversities that may arise. Purity, a youthful 27-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbours and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu, which is in the central region of Kenya. Purity is blessed with two lovely angel-looking children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables.

Purity also does a side hustle business, and she has dairy cows. Purity has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce to the market in a timely manner. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: “I have to do something for my family“.

Purity joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her.

She applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Purity is from a remote village that has poor roads, poor terrain and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables and tomatoes), which require timely delivery to the market.

This loan will help Purity to achieve her dream and reach her goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Purity feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts.

The benefits of this loan will be astronomical, because Purity will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivering her produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Purity is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with the farm work. Purity will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

Kindly lend to Purity to keep her big smile because she believes that it takes someone to help someone!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her deliver her perishable products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a very skilled rural person with experience in various areas of agriculture, with an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind. Flora is very young and she has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture that it’s only for the older generation. Flora is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some variety of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Flora passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nkubu and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nkubu and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market.

With your loan, Flora will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. Flora has been practicing agriculture with a difference employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo and she believes that her cereal-selling business will increase in leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through your loan Flora's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future.
Support Flora with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a honest and an eloquent speaker with a strong commanding manner. She resides in Kapchangaa, a remote village in the lush hills of Kericho, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary source of income have been milk, eggs, and crops. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is lack of funds.

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that.

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. Joan is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Joan’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family. You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann is a married woman with two children. Rose Ann is 24 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rose Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Rose Ann requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Rose Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and married with three children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs and other groceries.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from buying and selling fruit.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs and other groceries

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Lydia. She is a super incredible farmer! She certainly ranks among the top successful smallholder farmers on Juhudi Kilimo's client list.

Born in 1956 into a humble family, Lydia's upbringing was difficult. She attended school and finished secondary, after which she got into mixed farming. She also got married to a lovely husband, but her husband died and she is a widow. She is blessed with three lovely children.

Lydia practices farming on a small parcel of land that is owned by the family in the Nkubu area of Kenya. On the farm, she grows different varieties of food crops. She also keeps more than one highly productive dairy cow for milk production. The 59-year-old farmer sells her produce to the nearby market, institutions and local people.

Lydia is also the secretary of Rafiki Mwema Group, a group she formed to help members, who are smallholder farmers, to save, and to use the savings to access loans from financial institutions.

Lydia is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and start banana farming. The Nkubu area has favorable conditions that support banana farming, hence she will reap more from farming bananas.

With your loan, Lydia will have a year-round production of banana crops. Lydia has a great credit history. This will be her second loan. She took a 31,200 KES loan and successfully repaid it. She stated that this loan will change her life. Profits from this investment will be be plowed back into the business to fuel further growth. There is still space on her land for future growth.

If there ever was an opportunity to invest a $25 loan in someone's future, it is here! You won't regret it!

loans.use: To buy seeds and start banana farming

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a creative and hard-working young woman who is dedicated to her family. Anyone watching her at work will admire her for the determination and dedication that she puts into each one of her tasks. Kapsowar is a rain-fed area popularly known for maize and dairy farming. With the help of her beloved husband, Leah runs a successful rural enterprise, capitalizing on her small piece of land. The farm consists of her home, a cow, poultry, and trees.

Leah is planning to grow her farm business, but the only way she can do this without having to purchase more land is by focusing on poultry. Poultry farming is a very lucrative venture that does not require very much land space to be conducted. Leah is kindly seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more heads of poultry in a bid to boost egg production and ultimately increase her income. Her family will use the eggs produced to fill domestic needs and to meet commercial ends. Money generated from the sales will be used to settle the loan debt and pay part of their children's education expenses. Leah's vision is to provide for her family and to meet their needs as best as she can.
Be part of Leah’s dream by making a loan today!

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has 3 children. Besides crop farming, Samson also does dairy farming for extra food and income. The key lesson he has taken away from many years of being in crop farming is to always use quality inputs for quality output.

Samson is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Samson’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer, from Kapsowar, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer in her locality. She lives with her family on a small piece of land. Traditionally, her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, a personal business, and she has been practicing farming for the past 13 years. Having done farming for such a long time she has gained so much experience that she is always ranked the best farmer in her village. Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Nandi tribe (Jeniffer’s tribe) - where cows represent wealth.

Demand for dairy milk has been high and Jeniffer wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Through the loan, Jeniffer will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure that will be used in improving the fertility of her farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer.

Jeniffer has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, are there to make her dream come true. Jeniffer chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Jeniffer underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits Jeniffer plans to permanently improve her living conditions, and to secure the future of her school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. She plans that through increased income, she will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.
You can participate in making her dream a reality by making a loan today!

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is an enterprising woman, a dreamer, a creative person who, with only a little, has achieved great things. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that is a city of champions because of producing so many elite athletes. Being the bread winner of her family comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work; hence, Lydia has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of her family.

Lydia started farming just after finishing high school since she never advanced her education. Because of the high unemployment rate, she ventured into farming, and she has never regretted this because of the profits she has been making. Lydia practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in her village because she is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also doing crop farming. Lydia is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges she has faced is lack of enough capital.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan Lydia is confident that her life will be transformed and her dream of providing a secure future for her siblings will be achieved. Lydia is relieved to know that her life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small-scale and aspiring women such as Lydia.
You can participate and give a loan and a vote of confidence to this young woman who, with her honest work, seeks to change her reality and build a prosperous future.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a rural smallholder crop farmer in North Rift area of Kenya. He is married and has 3 children. Besides crop farming, James also does dairy, poultry and tree farming.


James is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs and construction materials for a cowshed. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. Also, he plans to improve his farm animals health and welfare by constructing a cowshed.
By lending USD $25 to James, you will be supporting the fight against poverty by equipping smallholders with the right financial products and services to enable them seize economic opportunities and improve their lives.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Khusniddin

texts.ru: Хусниддин из города Турсунзаде. Ему 26 лет. Он семейный парень. У него есть маленький ребенок. Его жена работает учительницей в школе. Мам занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке. Хусниддин самостоятельный парень. Он всегда трудится и думает о будущем. Хусниддин 7 лет занимается таксистом. Он уже семейный человек и стал отцом, теперь он днем и ночью работает, чтобы прокормить семью. Его машина сломался, и он хочет ремонтировать, чтобы не потерять источник дохода. И ему надо переоформить свою автомашину. Для этого ему нужно денежных средств, но денег у него нет. Хусниддин  был вынужден, обратится за кредитом. Он хочеть поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Khusniddin is 26 and he is from the city of Tursunzoda.  He is married and the father of a young child.  His wife works as a school teacher.  His mom is a market vendor.  Khusniddin himself has his own business and he always works hard, thinking about the future.  For the past seven years, he has been working as a taxi driver.

Now that he is married and that he has a child, Khusniddin works day and night to provide for his family.  However, his car has recently broken down and he needs to repair it, so that he doesn't lose his source of income.  He also needs to re-register his vehicle.  For all these reasons, Khusniddin needs money, but doesn't have enough.  Someone advised him to apply for a loan.  He hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to repair his car and register it with the necessary documents.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 34 years old and has six children. Rose is married and five of her children are presently in school.

Rose is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rose requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs. Rose has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Herma

texts.en:
Herma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Herma is 28 years old and has three children who are in school. Herma has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell and other supplies to use in her business.

Herma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Emmily

texts.en:
Even if Emmily got a job now she will turn it down, she says she can only concentrate on sheep farming. Emmily is a very honest, hardworking and dedicated farmer who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. Emmily has so much experience in sheep farming, having done it for the past 10 years that she is considered one of the best farmers in her village. Emmily’s primary source of income is selling sheep meat, milk, eggs and crops. Emmily has space on her farm that is unused, and she wants to use it to keep sheep.

She is kindly seeking a loan to buy sheep. This will help Emmily to improve her living conditions and also the conditions of her children by providing them with a solid education, because education is the “key to success.” The Kapsowar area has a large population and a ready market for sheep meat (mutton) and wool. Hence, Emmily will not have a problem selling the meat and increasing her income level. Emmily is very disciplined with finances, and she is sure that, through accumulated profits, she will open a large mutton selling butchery and be able to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia lives in Kitale, a remote town where the opportunities to get ahead are difficult and the living conditions are tough.Most of the young generation people in Kitale dream of getting a good education and a well-paying job, Lucia, from the Kitale area of Kenya, left hers to become a full-time small holder farmer. Lucia is married and blessed with three lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice Poultry farming for Lucia was not difficult because her parents have been doing poultry since she was young.

For the past five years, Lucia has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Lucia is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Lucia is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.
Lenders kindly Collaborate with an enterprising woman who has a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Phidah

texts.en:
Phidah is a 40 year old mother. She is a happy mother because just few years ago the greatest joy arrived to her home, her infant daughter whom she loves and gives everything for. Phidah farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows and does a side hustle business by operating the only diesel poshomill in her area. Phidah has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Phidah mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Phidah is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and through this loan Phidah is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Phidah feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Phidah will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.
Make a loan now and be part of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for fast transport of her farm products to market

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a jovial rural smallholder farmer from Central Kenya. He is married and has 5 children. He keeps rears cattle and plants crops to make a living. The key lesson he has taken away from 15 years of farming is; quality inputs yield quality output.

Peterson is seeking a loan to buy modern farm implements. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved tools for cultivating land.
Through this loan, Peterson will be able to improve the efficiency of his business by employing new tools that will make his work much easier and faster.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
In 2010, Everlyne ventured into farming as a way of life so that she would be able to produce food for her family. Five years down the line, Everlyne is deep into commercial dairy and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments has helped elevate the quality of life of her children who are in school.

Everlyne is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more income. Caught up in this situation, Everlyne will find your loan very handy. With KES 15,000 she is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her horticulture production. She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Meet Nicholas, a smallholder farmer from Nandi Hills area of Kenya who does dairy, poultry and tea farming for a living. He is married and has 3 children. His main income sources are milk, eggs, meat and tea.
Nicholas is seeking a loan to buy a heifer. Currently, he has 2 cows and would like to acquire one more in order to boost the quantity of milk supply and expand his capital base.
As planned, money generated from this investment will be used by Nicholas to repay the loan and whatever remains can go to his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
In the county of Kapsowar there are many enterprising and hard-working smallholder farmers with the desire and strength to get ahead and struggle for a good future. One of these is Margaret, a woman who, with her charisma and great capacity to work as a smallholder farmer, has been able to overcome various obstacles that have arisen in her life.

For 10 years, Margaret has worked in agricultural production. She wakes up every day to go to work and care for her land. This is a skill that she learned on her own and, little by little, has perfected her techniques and abilities in this field. Margaret is dedicated in full to her work. This mum only thinks about going forward and delivering good produce. She knows that many people consume her farm products, and because of this, she makes sure her products are pure and of good quality.

Her primary sources of income have been milk and produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases.

Margaret made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output.

The additional income from the expansion will go to her children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families.

With your loan, Margaret's children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Colectoras Group

texts.es:
Valentina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 8, 12, 15 y 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores, en la mayoría; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, situado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Valentina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste color rosa). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus 4 hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los integrantes son; venta de sándwiches, tejido de ropa de bebe, tienda de barrio, venta de materiales de construcción, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de ropa deportiva, y venta de lácteos. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado a la hora del medio día en su puesto de venta fijo al aire libre. La comidas que cocina son; locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso) y ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), “mi negocio funciona para la hora de almuerzo, busco una actividad para la hora de cena…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para iniciar su segunda actividad por las noches. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante en su domicilio, ella desea realizar la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para iniciar su segunda actividad de venta de hamburguesas por las noches. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que lleva desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Valentina solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para iniciar su segunda actividad de venta de hamburguesas por las noches.
texts.en:
Valentina is 38 years old. She lives with her partner, and she has four children, ages eight, twelve, fifteen, and nineteen. Her business is selling traditional food.

She is a good mother, optimistic, generous, patient, responsible, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the "Plan 3000" zone, which is characterized by the multiculturality of its residents, mostly Aymara, Quechua, and Guarani. Migrants took over the area, which is situated south of the city, and established commerce that is constantly growing. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Valentina has tan skin, brown eyes, and long black hair. She is short of stature with a medium build. Her maternal language is Guarani, which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business. She is seated in the center, wearing pink. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a driver, and with their four children, who are studying in school. They live in a rented house built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. It has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.

On this occasion she is leading the group of entrepreneurs, whose businesses are selling sandwiches, knitting baby clothes, a neighborhood store, sales of construction materials, selling quinoa juice, selling sportswear, and selling dairy products.

Her business is selling traditional food, which is an occupation that she carries out from Monday to Saturday at midday, in her permanent open air sales stand. The foods that she cooks are stuffed peppers (peppers, chopped meat, and onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk, and cheese), and tripe stew (tripe, onions, and tomato, accompanied by rice). "My business works for the lunch hour, and I'm looking for a dinner-hour occupation." she comments.

The advantage of her business is that there are daily sales, and the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of a hamburger cart in order to begin her second occupation selling hamburgers in the evenings. Her dream is to open a restaurant in her home. She wants to purchase a hamburger cart in order to begin her second occupation selling hamburgers during the evenings. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been developing this occupation.

That is why Valentina is requesting a loan for the purchase of a hamburger cart, in order to begin her second occupation selling hamburgers during the evenings.

loans.use: to purchase a hamburger cart in order to begin her second occupation selling hamburgers in the evenings.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell to customers.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Eva May

texts.en:
Eva May is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva May is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Eva May has a general store business in the Philippines. Eva May requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eva May has been in this business for six years. In the future, Eva May would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Riza is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Riza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Riza has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is a married with four children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ronie is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ronie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ronie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ronie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ronie would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 46 years old and has six children who are in school.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rowena has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak has now three children with the little one being just a year-old. There are seven members in their family, including his elderly parents who receive a pension of a total of $130/month.
He owns some land and in 4 dynym of it he's planted apple orchards, 1 dynym with plum orchards and in 6 dynym he plants wheat and corn.

Currently he's got only one dairy cow and a calf.
The loan that he is requesting from you, will be used to pay for some agricultural services.

loans.use: to cover his agricultural expenses.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
With a family to raise Risper has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. With the little time Risper has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. From Kiva lenders, Risper is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports.

While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Risper access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Risper’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.
Kindly lend to her!

loans.use: To buy seeds and grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. Meet Caroline, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 44 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Kararia, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Caroline has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. Caroline is contented with the farming way of life. Caroline is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Caroline feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Caroline is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Caroline so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a tea farmer who is based in Kericho, which is Kenya's largest tea growing area. He grows tea on his small farm and sells the produce to the tea factories scattered around Kericho. The main problem that Nelson is facing is lack of adequate capital to grow his operations.

Nelson is seeking a loan to buy important farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and herbicides. These inputs will be used to prepare more land space and grow more tea.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is a tireless worker who works 7 days a week, 12 hours per day, all of this because she wants to achieve her dream of becoming the largest dairy farmer in her village. She is a woman eager to get ahead.

She is a 53-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family, which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future. Callen was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and has space there to use for dairy farming. In the eyes of Callen, who has a great heart, you can see the effort over the passing years.

She is requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow.

Kenyenya is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Callen, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk.

She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

With the loan you will be able to support a woman full of life and drive for her family!

loans.use: To buy another good quality breed of cow

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica is a very enterprising and creative woman who, for a long time, has wanted to be independent and have her own farming business. She is tenacious and very determined. Faced with unemployment, she decided to start practicing farming 10 years ago. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kenyenya, in the Nyanza region of Kenya.

Dorica is happily married and blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing tea, maize, vegetables and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows.

Dorica has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Dorica mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her.

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Dorica is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Dorica is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Dorica feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Dorica will never suffer losses due to a delay in the delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work.

With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her school-going children and of a secure future.

With your support Dorica will be able to fulfill her dreams, so please help her by making a loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional. El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida y atender a mayor número de clientes. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio funcionó correctamente y no tuvo problemas (la primera de la derecha, viste pantalón vaquero y chompa ploma). En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de personas con negocio como; venta de papas fritas, tienda de barrio, carnicería,  confección de tejido, artesanía en cuero, venta de productos médicos naturales y fabricación de sombreros de sao, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, esta comida se caracteriza por la utilización de alimentos locales como la yuca y viseras como la tripa, hígado, lengua, corazón, etc. Actividad que efectúa de lunes a domingo, para la hora de almuerzo y de cena, “gracias a su ayuda he podido mejorar mi negocio y mis ingresos, mi familia está en deuda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las mentas mejoraron y son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, fideo, arroz, yuca, carne, etc. Su sueño es darle comodidad a su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para contar con material de trabajo constante y estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria continues with her business of selling traditional food. The past loan she invested in buying tables and chairs to sell food and serve a greater number of clients. Her loan installment payments were punctual as her business went well and she had no problems. (In the photo she is the first on the right, wearing jeans and a grey sweater)

At this time she is the leader of a communal bank with businesses like: the sale of french fries, a neighborhood store, a butcher's, weaving, leather handicrafts, the sales of natural medicinal products and making fiber hats in order to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling traditional food. This food is distinguished by the use of local foods like yucca and organs like intestine, kidney, tongue, heart, etc. She runs her business from Monday to Sunday for lunch and dinner. "Thanks to their help I have been able to improve my business and my income. My family is in debt", she comments. The advantage of her business is that sales have improved and are daily and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy cooking supplies like oil, noodles, rice, yucca, meat, etc.

Her dream is to provide her family with comfort. She wants to make the purchase of cooking supplies to have constant work material. This is her second loan with the institution in the four years she has been operating her business independently.

For these reasons Maria is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies to have constant work material and stabilize her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies to have constant work material.

loans.name: Bernidita

texts.en:
Bernidita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernidita is 38 years old and has one child who is in school.

Bernidita has a general store business in the Philippines. Bernidita requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Bernidita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Bernidita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jonaven Rose

texts.en:
Jonaven Rose is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonaven Rose is 39 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jonaven Rose has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jonaven Rose requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jonaven Rose has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jonaven Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Emmy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passengers. Emmy is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Emmy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old, married with one child.

Helen is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine s a smiling and enthusiastic woman who works in her mixed farm in the Chuka area of Kenya. Listening to her referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on her compound; one would mistake her with a certified Agricultural Extension Officer. Traditionally, her primary source of income has been eggs, crops, and a personal business. She has been practicing farming for the past 11 years. Having done farming for such a long time, she has gained so much experience that she is always ranked the best farmer in her village. Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Kikuyu tribe (Catherine’s tribe). Demand for dairy milk has been high and Catherine wants to take advantage of the market.

Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Catherine has already identified the breed of dairy cow that she wants. Catherine always says that, “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.”

She has planted so many trees on her farm that food for the cattle will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge, because she will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. Through the loan, Catherine will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure that will be used in improving the fertility of her farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer.

Catherine has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, are there to make her dream come true. Catherine chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low and is on a reducing basis. Catherine underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training session, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits, Catherine plans to permanently improve her living conditions. She plans that through increased income, she will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, hence saving costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old, widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virginia has a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en:
Etidal is a divorced woman who lives in Madaba. She is a very ambitious woman. Etidal did not let obstacles stand in front of her.

She wants to be a productive woman, and because she is a conservative, divorced woman, she could not work. Therefore, she decided to start selling clothes and makeup and rented a small shop beside her house.

She started her business with a low quantity of products, but when her business started to be known in her region, she applied for a loan to help her buy a larger number of clothes and makeup, and to add accessories to her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of clothes and makeup, and to add accessories to her business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Her name is Melinda, aged 43, and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Nemsie, her business partner, and has four children. The majority of Filipinos do not have luxuries but her family is happy and privileged to live on the beautiful island of Coron. They have a backyard business to provide for their daily personal and household needs.

Melinda has been a hog raiser for four years already. Investing in a piggery is a good and profitable business as female pigs conceive twice a year and can produce as many as 12 piglets each time. To help her raise healthy hogs she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy more feed and piglets. She will be very grateful for your financial help. Her earnings will surely help cover their daily living expenses and send her children to school.

Melinda dreams of someday owning a big piggery business. Like all Filipina mothers she wishes for all her children to finish school. Education is an equalizer among the rich and the poor. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and piglets.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Sixta continúa vendiendo alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes en general. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio trabajo correctamente y no tuvo problemas /sentada a la derecha, viste pantalón verde). En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento los negocios de los integrantes son; agricultura, venta de comida tradicional, elaboración de sombreros de sao, comercio de ganado, venta de ropa de segunda mano, servicio de construcción y venta de artesanía en cuero. Su negocio es la venta alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; azúcar, pan, arroz, fideo, gaseosas, papel higiénico, golosinas, etc. en su tienda de barrio todos los días de la semana en horas del día, “trabajo a diario en mi negocio, mis clientes recorren largas distancias a pie o en moto a comprar sus víveres de la semana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia en varios kilómetros, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de víveres por mayor. Su sueño es ayudar a su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de víveres por mayor para contar con mercadería constante porque las distancias son muy largas. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sixta solicita un préstamo para la compra de víveres por mayor para abastecer su tienda rural.
texts.en:
Sixta continues to sell food and basic use items in her neighborhood store. The loan she had was invested in the purchase of groceries in general. Her loan payments were punctual as her business went well and she had no problems. (In the photo she is seated on the right, wearing green pants). At this time she heads a communal bank where the members have businesses like; farming, selling traditional food, making fiber hats, selling livestock, selling used clothing, a construction service and the sales of leather crafts.

Her business is the sales of food and basic use items like sugar, bread, rice, noodles, soft drinks, toilet paper, sweets, etc. in her neighborhood store every day of the week during daylight hours. "I work daily in my business. My customers travel long distances on foot or by motorcycles to buy their weekly food", she comments.

The advantage of her business is that there is no competition for a number of kilometers. and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy food wholesale. Her dream is to help her family. She wants to make the purchase of food wholesale to have constant merchandise as the distances are great. This is her 4th loan with the institution in the 9 years she has run her business.

For these reasons she is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs wholesale to stock her rural store.

loans.use: to buy food wholesale to stock her country store.

loans.name: La Laguna Group

texts.es:
Beiby es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 9 meses y 5 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de pan.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área muy demandada por aquellos que quieren tener su tienda o negocio de cualquier tipo y al frente está el Mercado Mutualista que es muy visitado por compradores de toda la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Beiby es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la izquierda, viste de negro a rayas horizontales). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a las necesidades de su familia y su negocio, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, confección de tejidos, artesanía en cuero, tienda de barrio, carnicería y venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan, negocio que inicio en su casa, realizando una mínima inversión con la venta de pan Mollete (Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y Manteca), Pan de Arroz (en base de harina de arroz), Pan dulce (Cuya preparación se utiliza uvas pasas, huevo, leche y azúcar), Rosca de maíz (en base a harina de maíz), Tortilla (Es la masa de pan, aplanada y espolvoreada con azúcar y harina, se dobla lo aplanado y se repite varias veces obteniendo después de cocido una especie de pan de hojaldre), a medida que recuperaba su capital, INVERTÍA en la oferta de masitas para el público. “el trabajo de panadero es bastante sacrificado, trabajamos desde la madrugada para tener el pan listo a primeras horas del día…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de un horno grande para hornear mayor cantidad. Su sueño es ampliar su panadería para vender pan por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de un horno industrial grande para ampliar su volumen de producción y vender pan por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Beiby solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial grande para ampliar su volumen de producción y vender pan por mayor.
texts.en:
Beiby is a woman of 30 years old, lives with her husband, has 3 children aged 9 months, 5 and 8 years old, and her business is selling bread.

She is a good mother, cheerful, understanding, patient, responsible and very hardworking. She does business in the ‘Mutual’ district, an area much in demand by those who want to have their store or business of any kind, and in front is the Mercado Mutualista, which is much visited by buyers from all over the city. There is a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius [70-95 degrees Fahrenheit].

Beiby is of a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair worn in a pony tail, with a short, thin physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for everyday use and business. (She is the first one on the left, dressed in black with horizontal stripes). She shares her life with her husband, who works in transportation; they live in a rented house built of brick and cement with a tin roof that has potable water, electricity and a sewer sytem connection.

Due to the needs of her family and her business, she formed a communal bank with others who have businesses (food sales, sales of second-hand clothes, weaving, leather craft, neighborhood store, butchershop and sandwich sales), in order to apply for a loan and prosper in their business activities.

Her business is the production and sale of bread, a business she started at home, making a minimum investment by selling bread Mollete (the ordinary bread made with flour, granulated sugar and butter), rice bread (made with rice flour), pan dulce (sweetened bread, prepared raisins, egg, milk and sugar), rosca de maíz (corn bread shaped into a ring, made with corn flour), tortilla (bread dough, flattened and sprinkled with sugar and flour; the flattened part is folded and this is repeated several times, resulting in a kind of bread puff pastry). As she regained her capital, she invested in offering pastries to the public.

“A baker’s work is very arduous, we work from dawn to have the bread ready in the early hours of the day ...” she relates. The advantage of her business is that sales are daily; the disadvantage is the lack of a large baking oven to bake in larger quantities. Her dream is to expand her bakery to sell bread wholesale. She wishes to make the purchase of a large industrial oven to expand her volume of production and sell bread wholesale.

This is the 2nd cycle of loans with the institution in the two years that she has been working in this occupation. It is for these reasons that Beiby is requesting a loan to purchase a large industrial oven to expand her volume of production and sell bread wholesale.

loans.use: purchase a large industrial oven to expand her volume of production and sell bread wholesale.

loans.name: Litoral Group

texts.es:
Ruth es una joven mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, de exuberante vegetación con enormes extensiones de selva y praderas, de los cuales sólo un tercio comprende una región montañosa y el resto se extiende sobre la planicie amazónica. De clima cálido subtropical, con una temperatura que ronda entre los 21-35 grados centígrados.
Ruth es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lacio lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste chompa negra y pantalón rosa). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; 
Venta de maní, artesanía en arcilla, tejido de sombreros de sao, confección de tejidos, panadería, venta de flores, carnicería y taller de llaves, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano; su trabajo empieza en la clasificación de los zapatos por género y edad, seguido con la limpieza y por último la exposición del producto, “Mi mercancía procede mayoritariamente del mercado europeo y la vendo en su totalidad mis clientes de todas las edades…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de zapatos de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada. Su sueño es abrir una tienda surtida de zapatos, ella desea realizar la compra de zapatos de segunda mano por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad y satisfacer a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ruth solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos de segunda mano por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad y mejorar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ruth is a young woman of twenty-four, she lives with her partner and has a seven-year-old son. Her business is selling second-hand shoes.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, consistent, friendly, responsible and very hard-working. She conducts her business in the southern part of the city, with lush vegetation and large areas of jungle and meadows, of which only a third cover a mountainous region and the rest extends over the Amazon plains. The climate is subtropical, with temperatures of around 21 - 35 degrees celsius.

Ruth has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black straight hair tied back. She is short with a robust physique. She speaks her mother tongue of Guarani with her family and she speaks Spanish culturally and for business. (She is in the center, wearing a black sweater and pink slacks.)

She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and with her son who studies in school. They live in a rented room made of wood with a corrugated iron roof and brick floor. They have drinking water, electricity, and a sewer system.

Her desire to succeed led her to form a communal bank to ask for a loan to improve their businesses such as peanut sales, clay crafts, weaving straw hats, production of weavings, bakery, flower market, butcher shop, and key workshop.

Her business is the sale of second-hand shoes. Her work begins with the classification of shoes by gender and age, followed by cleaning, and then finally she shows the product. “My merchandise comes mainly from the European market and are sold entirely to my clients who are all ages,” she comments.

The advantage of her business is that she always has customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy wholesale second-hand shoes to supply her seasonal customers.

Her dream is to open a store stocked with shoes. She wants to buy second-hand shoes wholesale in order to offer a greater variety and to satisfy her customers.

This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in the one year that she has been dedicated to this activity.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes at wholesale to offer greater variety and improve her working capital

loans.name: Gulguncha

texts.ru: Гулгунча тихая спокойная девушка, хорошо знающая свою работу. Ей 34 года. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Гулгунча работает дома, потому что она может следить за меленькими детьми и делать домашние дела. Гулгунча в 1998 году начала шить и до сих пор продвигает эту деятельность. С тех годов она шьет вот на это машинке, которую Вы видите на фотографии. Гулгунча решила купить новую модернизированную машинку. Но ее собственного капитала не хватает для совершения этой операции, и она обращается к Вам за помощью. Вы можете сейчас поддержать Гулгунча!
texts.en: Gulguncha is a quiet and peaceful young woman who is very skilled at her work.  She is 34 years old and she sews women's clothes from orders that she receives from her customers.  She works from home, which allows her to take care of her young children and to do all the house chores.  She started sewing in 1998 and has been developing her activity since then.  All these years, she has been using the machine that you can see in the photo.  She wants to buy a more modern machine, but she doesn't have enough personal resources for this purchase.  For this reason, she is turning to you for some support.  Will you please help her?

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
With five good-looking children to take care of, water to fetch, and food to cook, Martha has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are important to her family, it’s a job that is normally not given enough attention and gets little appreciation. With the little time Martha has, she sells vegetables from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. From Kiva lenders,

Martha is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government of Kenya takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Martha access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Martha’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Through this loan she will be able to sell more vegetables to both the local market and the neighboring market. Kindly help out this enterprising woman with a loan!

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Meet Vivian from Eldoret, Kenya, she is from a community not known for farming, but she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married, and together with her husband, is blessed with a lovely and cute family. For the past seven years, she has been practicing mixed farming, and, because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from operating a mixed farm, selling milk, eggs, and maize has allowed her to earn a decent income. Vivian passionately loves dairy farming, and animals on her farm have been given names. Vivian has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Vivian to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. Vivian is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry.

She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production, and thus, increase sales volume. Vivian needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses. All that Vivian waits for is your kindness.
You can be part of this dream. Be inspired and support the life of this mum with a loan!

loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Naranjillo Group

texts.es:
Martha continúa con su negocio de panadería. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de harina de diferentes tipos como, harina de arroz, de maíz, de trigo, etc. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio no tuvo ningún inconveniente (sentada la primera de la izquierda, viste chompa blanca y pantalón negro). En esta oportunidad reunió a la banca de personas con el fin de continuar mejorando sus actividades, los negocio de los integrantes son; venta de productos médicos naturales, elaboración de artesanía en cuero, venta de ropa de segunda mano, elaboración de sombreros de sao, tienda de barrio, salteñería, venta de ollas y ferretería. Su negocio es la panadería tradicional, actividad que realiza en su domicilio en un cuarto habilitado como cocina durante todos los días de la semana, “continuamos trabajando en la panadería, mejoramos el negocio y ahora queremos mejorar la cantidad…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de garrafas de gas, para contar con combustible constante para hornear. Su sueño es continuar mejorando su panadería hasta que se estabilice, ella desea realizar la compra de 3 garrafas de gas para tener combustible suficiente para hornear a diario. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de 3 garrafas de gas para tener combustible suficiente para hornear a diario.
texts.en:
Martha continues with her bakery business. She invested the previous loan in the purchase of different types of flour, such as rice, corn, wheat, etc. Her loan payments were punctual because her business did not have any problems.

Martha is seated first from the left, wearing a white sweater and black pants. This communal bank took the opportunity to meet, with the goal of continuing to improve their businesses. The members' businesses are natural medicine sales, leather craftwork, secondhand clothing sales, making straw hats, a neighborhood store, a meat pie store, cooking pot sales, and a hardware store.

Martha's business is a traditional bakery, which she operates from her house every day of the week, in a room made into a kitchen. "We are continuing to work in the bakery, we are improving the business, and now we want to increase the quantity," she comments.
