Her business's advantage is that it sells product every day. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy containers of gas and have constant fuel to bake. Her dream is to continue improving her bakery until it becomes well-established.

She wants to purchase 3 containers of gas in order to have sufficient fuel to bake every day. This is her 2nd loan cycle with the institution in the 4 years that she has been running her business independently.

For these reasons, Martha is requesting a loan to purchase 3 containers of gas in order to have sufficient fuel to bake every day.

loans.use: to buy 3 containers of gas in order to have enough fuel to bake every day

loans.name: Vicitacion

texts.es:
Vicitacion es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 2, 5, 15 y 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de pacumutu.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, activa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El torno’ que se encuentra a 32 km. al Sudoeste de la ciudad, caracterizado por su pintoresco paisaje, y por su topografía levemente ondulada y cubierta por vegetación tropical.  Posee una importante riqueza forestal y diversidad de fauna silvestre. Es también centro de acopio de una gran variedad de productos del campo. Su principal actividad económica es la agropecuaria, con productos de muy buena calidad.
Vicitacion es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lacio, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista asalariado y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 2 menores aún no se encuentran ene3 edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pacumutu, que son trozos de carne de res que se ensartan en brochetas con otros ingredientes, como pimientos rojo y verdes, cebolla,  generalmente se sirve con arroz cocido con queso, yuca y llajua, “El pacumutu es una brocheta de carne tierna que le hará olvidar esos restaurantes griegos, Hay muchos otros platos regionales, tal como el ají de papalisa, el charkekan, la sucacolla y la picana y otros…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida se vende por completo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un refrigerador para mantener los alimentos. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de una heladera para refrigerar la carne y otros alimentos que utiliza en su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Vicitación solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para refrigerar la carne y otros alimentos que utiliza en su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicitación is a 32 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has 4 children aged 2, 5, 15 and 17. her business is the sale of pacumutu.

She is a good mother, enterprising, active, consistent, responsible and very hard-working. Her business takes place in 'El Torno’ which is located 32 km south-east of the city. It is characterized by it's picturesque landscape and it's rolling topography covered with tropical vegetation. It is rich in forests and diverse wild animals. It is also a processing center for a great number of rural products. It main economic activity is farming with good quality products.

Vicitacion is dark-skinned, brown eyed, with long straight, black hair, short and of medium build. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner who works as a salaried driver and her children. The two oldest study at school and the other two are not yet school age. They live in their own house made of wood with a metal roof and a dirt floor. It has well water by pump, electricity but no sewage.

Her business is selling pacumutu which are pieces of beef on skewers with other ingredients like red and green pepper, and onion. It is usually served with rice cooked with cheese, yucca and a hot sauce. "Pacumutu is a tender meat skewer that makes you forget those Greek restaurants. There are many regional dishes like ají de papalisa, el charkekan, la sucacolla, la picana and others" she commented.

The advantage of her business is that her food sells out completely, her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a refrigerator to store her food. Her dream is to open a regular sales stand so she can quit selling itinerantly. She wants to make the purchase of a fridge to store meat and other foods she uses in her business. This is her first loan with the institution in the 4 years she has run her business.

For these reasons Vicitación is requesting a loan to buy a fridge to store meat and other foods she uses in her business.

loans.use: to buy a fridge to store meat and other foods she uses in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking 37-year-old family woman who started farming over 10 years ago to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing cattle, poultry and maize farming. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.
Rose hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs several ventures including a smallholding poultry farm in the Kitale area of Kenya. Her main source of income is farm produce such as eggs and cereals.

Recently, Evelyn set her mind to start a grain mill shop open to public where farmers, traders and families can process cereal grains into flour.
To start up the grain mill business, Evelyn is seeking a loan to purchase equipment. She is seeking KES 120,000 to buy and install a grain-milling machine.
This investment will help farmers to process their cereal harvest into their final form and families to obtain flour for cooking. Evelyn will use the income from this shop to repay the loan, grow the business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a grain mill machine

loans.name: Lorena Estely

texts.es:
Lorena, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y es madre de 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, en su casa solo vive ella, su esposo, sus hijos y su madre. 

Lorena, se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 2 años, anteriormente trabajaba en un restaurante en la ciudad, en el cual aprendió mucho y al salir de ahí decidió montar su propio negocio en su casa, en este también le ayuda su hija, mientras que su compañero de vida, trabaja como vigilante en una agencia de créditos.

Lorena, necesita el crédito para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas, ya que la que tiene está muy deteriorada y quiere brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y la otra parte la necesita para comprar materia prima como bebidas, refrescos y gaseosas.

El sueño de Lorena, es obtener un crédito más grande para mejorar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena is 34 years old. She went to school until the ninth grade. She has a partner and is the mother of 2 children, ages 15 and 10. She lives with her partner, her children and her mother.

For the past 2 years Lorena has made her living selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made of a thick, handmade corn tortilla filled with a blend of cheese, beans and/or meat). Prior to that she worked in a restaurant in the city, where she learned a lot. When she left that job she decided to start her own business in her home. Her daughter helps her, while her partner works as a security guard in a credit agency.

Lorena needs a loan to buy a griddle to make pupusas. The one she has is very worn out and she wants to provide better service to her customers. The loan will also be used in part to buy supplies such as drinks, soft drinks and sodas. Lorena's dream is to obtain a bigger loan to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for making pupusas and to buy drinks, soft drinks and sodas.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old and a born hard-worker. She is dedicated and responsible, and knows how to use her skills as a farmer. Although a humble woman, she is creative and knows how to make the most of opportunities. She lives in Sangalo, a remote village in Eldoret area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Eldoret area is very populated, so demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and extend her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy quality breeds of poultry

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith and her family live and work on a small farm in Waitaluk village, situated in the fertile Rift Valley province of Kenya. She keeps dairy animals and grows various varieties of crops, including fodder to feed her livestock. To Judith, crop farming is just as important as livestock farming because they are interdependent.
The biggest growth constraint for Judith is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity.

She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds and quality fertilizers to grow crops for food, feed and income.
With your lending, Judith will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity, family's food security and income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Villa Rosita Group

texts.es:
Albaines es una mujer de 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos d e 6, 9 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, luchadora, constante, emprendedora, dinámica, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ que se encuentra ubicado al sudoeste de la ciudad sobre la carretera, el clima del lugar se caracteriza por ser templado, al estar comprendido entre las llanuras y los valles mesotérmicos, aunque se registran vientos fuertes y lluvias tormentosas en ciertas épocas del año.
Albaines es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lacio, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (SENTADA A LA IZQUIERDA, SOSTIENE UN FAJO DE BILLETES EN LA MANO). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, shorts, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en horas del día, durante toda la semana, visitando comercios y áreas comerciales, su forma de negocio es la ropa de temporada, “compramos ropa por fardos, procedente de Europa y estados unidos, la clasificamos por género y talla para ofertar a precios accesibles para la mayoría…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende por completo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ropa por fardos. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta para dejar de ambular, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano de temporada de invierno por fardos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Albaines solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa abrigada de segunda mano por fardo para abrir un puesto fijo de venta.
texts.en:
Albaines, 34, is a married woman who has three children 6, 9 and 12 and her business is the sale of second hand clothing.
She is a good mother, striving, constant, enterprising, dynamic, responsible and very hard-working. She does her work in the El Torno locality which is situated southeast of the city on the highway. The climate of the area is characterized as temperate, being located between the plains and the temperate valleys, although strong winds and rainstorms are present in certain times of the year.
Albaines is dark-complected; with brown eyes; long, straight black hair; short stature; and a medium build. Her mother tongue is Guarani which is what is spoken in the area and she speaks Spanish in the general public and in the work she does (seated on the left, she has a wad of bills in her hand). She shares her life with her husband who makes a living in commerce and with her children who study in the school. They live in their own house constructed of wood with a corrugated zinc roof and a tile floor which has well water extracted by a pump, electricity, and no sewer connection.
Her business is the sale of second-hand clothing, such as pants, shorts, athletic shirts, shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc., a job she does walking around during the day for the whole week visiting businesses and commercial areas. Her kind of business deals in seasonal clothing. "We buy clothing by the bale from Europe and the United States and we arrange it by type and size in order to offer it at prices accessible to the majority," she says. The advantage of her business is that she sells out her clothing. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy clothing by the bale,
Her dream is to open a fixed sales location in order to quit walking around. She wishes to invest in her business through buying a second hand clothing for the winter season by the bale. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the three years she has been doing this work.
For these reasons, Albaines is requesting a loan in order to buy warm, second hand clothing by the bale in order to open a fixed sales locale.

loans.use: to buy warm, second hand clothing by the bale in order to open a fixed sales locale.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

Liezel has been in this business for 1 year. She earns more income from an electronic mobile load business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and gasoline.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and use for renovation of a pigpen.

Gloria has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and use for renovation of a pigpen

loans.name: Letresita

texts.en:
Letresita is 49 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles and beverages.

Letresita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig raising.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles and beverages

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 67 years old and married with four children.  

Virginia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virginia has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Haidilita

texts.en:
Haidilita is a 38-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Haidilita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Haidilita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Haidilita has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Haidilita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 12 años, y una hija de 14 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, constante, activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la provincia ‘Vichaya’ se caracteriza por tener una composición demográfica Aymará, es también parte de la riqueza arqueológica, con sus enormes y variados edificios funerales, chullpares que aún persisten luego de cientos de años, guardando en su interior reliquias y restos humanos de las diferentes culturas que pasaron por estas tierras. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Nieves es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera) su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y trabajan en el negocio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de adobe y paja con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para conseguir agua se debe dirigir al rio. Su negocio es la producción de estuco; este es un grano fino compuesto de cal apagada, mármol pulverizado, yeso, pigmentos naturales, etc. Y se endurece al ser mesclada con agua. Se utiliza para revestir paredes y techos, “la producción de estuco es un trabajo bastante agotador, toda la familia ayuda y trabaja en el negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes demandan el producto, la desventaja es la falta de agua y combustible para trabajar.  Su sueño es consolidar su negocio, ella desea abastecer su negocio mediante la compra de carbón y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nieves solicita un préstamo para la compra de carbón y combustible para la explotación de estuco para consolidar su negocio.
texts.en: Nieves is a 36 year old woman. She lives with her partner. She has a 12 year old son and a 14 year old daughter, and her business is to produce stucco. She is a good mother, strong, striving, constant, active, responsible and very hardworking. She works in the province of ‘Vichaya’, characterized by its Aymara demographic composition and its archeological wealth, with its huge and diverse funeral buildings, chullpares, that are still present after hundreds of years, which have in their interior relics and human remains of the different cultures that passed through this land. Here, the weather is cold and dry, with temperatures ranging between 0-12 degrees Celsius. Nieves is dark skinned, with brown eyes, long black hair which she uses braided; short and stocky. She dresses in a traditional way (hat, shawl and skirt). Her native language is Aymara, which is spoken in the area, and Spanish because of general culture and in her business. She shares her life with her partner who works in the same business, and with her children who attend school and work in the business. They live in their own room, built in adobe and straw with corrugated iron roof and dirt floor, with electricity. To get water she has to go to the river. Her business is to produce stucco, a fine grain composed by lime, powder marble, plaster, natural pigments, etc. that gets hard when mixed with water. It is used to cover walls and roofs. "Stucco production is a very tiring job. The whole family helps and works in the business...", she comments. The advantage of the business is her customers' demand. The disadvantage is the lack of water and fuel to work. Her dream is to consolidate her business. She wants to furnish her business through the purchase of coal and fuel to exploit stucco. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years she has been developing this activity independently. These are the reasons why Nieves is requesting a loan to buy coal and fuel for stucco exploitation in order to consolidate her business.

loans.use: to buy coal and fuel for stucco exploitation in order to consolidate her business.

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
Diadema is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Diadema has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Diadema requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dry goods like blankets, lamps, blouses, etc. to sell.

Diadema has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Diadema would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods like blankets, lamps, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

Juliet has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Juliet is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more variety of dried fish to sell to her customers for her buy and sell dried fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary Lee

texts.en:
Mary Lee is 38 years old and married with one child who is currently in school. Mary Lee works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Lee runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, snack foods, beers, noodles, etc. to sell.

In the future, Mary Lee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, snack foods, beers, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 57 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is still in school.

Angeles is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Angeles requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angeles has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 58 years old and married with six children. Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, eggs, etc.

Aida has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a single woman, 47 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cecilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, sugar and additional utensils for her food vending.

Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, sugar and additional utensils for her food vending

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is a 57-year-old married woman with eight children; one child is presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dorotea has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Dorotea has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married with one child and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods like hot dog, sausage and other frozen foods to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 13 years now, and also earns additional income from fruits vending.

She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods like hot dog, sausage and other froozen foods to sell

loans.name: Enrile

texts.en:
Enrile is 55 years old and has five children. Enrile is married and has one child still in school.

Enrile is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Enrile requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies.

Enrile has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 49 years old, married, and has three children; one child is currently in school.

Emelie is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Emelie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emelie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to provide for and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years old, married, and has seven children; three children are currently in school.

Elvie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elvie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana works hard to support her family. Ana is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ana requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Ana has been in this business for 19 years now.

Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y una hija, son las únicas personas que dependen de ella, tiene como negocio la crianza de cerdos y además a tiende una tienda en la que  vende paletas, gelatinas, choco bananos, granos básicos, bebidas, etc., aprendió el oficio de una prima y no tiene un horario fijo para desarrollar sus actividades.
Desea fortalecer mucho más la tienda por lo que solicita un crédito con el que comprara bebidas, azúcar, granos básicos, aceite, etc., tendrá un inventario más surtido y con capacidad para atender las demandas de sus clientes.
Sus proyecciones son saber administrar el crédito para obtener mejores ganancias, cancelar la deuda adquirida y procurar que su familia tenga un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and a daughter. They are the only people who depend on her. She has a business raising pigs and she also has a store where she sells popsicles, gelatin, choco-bananas, basic grains, beverages, etc. She learned this trade from a cousin and she does not have a set schedule to carry out her activities.

She wants to fortify her store more and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy beverages, sugar, basic grains, oil, etc. She will have a better stocked inventory and the ability to meet her customers' needs.

Her goals are to know how to manage the loan to obtain better profits, to pay off the acquired debt and make her family have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sugar, basic grains, oil, etc. She will have a better stocked inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell cashew nut business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Lany would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 38 years old and married.

Emily is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emily has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Emily would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old and married with three children.

Carmen is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy rice seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for 12 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lea is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lea requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Lea has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Nelson Max

texts.es:
Nelson continúa con su negocio de confección de prendas deportivas. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de telas por rollo. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su comercio tuvo los resultados que esperaba. Su negocio continúa mejorando las ventas mejoran porque recibe pedidos por mayor, su necesidad principal es la compra de tela y otros materiales de costura como hilos, cierres, botones, etc. “pasamos la mayor parte del tiempo en el taller de costura y no contamos con el capital de trabajo para comprar el material que necesitamos para que funcione el negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos y constantes para la venta de ropa por mayor, la desventaja es que no cuenta con capital suficiente para realizar la compra de tela por mayor. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos y crear una pequeña empresa. Él necesita realizar la compra de tela por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Nelson solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas para confeccionar chamarras y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Nelson continues with his business of making sports clothing. He invested the previous loan in the purchase of cloth by the roll. His repayments were punctual because his business had the results hoped for. His business continues to improve because the sales are improving since he gets wholesale orders. His principal need is to buy cloth and other sewing materials such as thread, zippers, buttons, etc. "We pass most of the time in the sewing workshop and we don't have the working capital to buy the materials we need in order for the business to function...," he says.
The advantage of his business is that that he has firm and constant customers so as to sell clothing wholesale. The disadvantage is that he doesn't have sufficient capital to buy cloth wholesale.
His dream is to improve his income and create a small company. He needs to be able to buy cloth wholesale. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the five years he has been in this business.
For these reasons, Nelson is requesting a loan in order to buy cloth to make jackets and sell them wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make jackets and sell them wholesale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos médicos para la salud.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, de buena actitud, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Miraflores’ que es la más estable de la ciudad, porque cuenta con tierra firme, donde se encuentra el estadio deportivo. De clima frio y seco con fuertes vientos que provienen de la cordillera. 
Pamela es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello negro corto a la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de productos médicos naturales, estos abarcan una gran variedad de técnicas que no se consideran parte de la Medicina convencional.  Ella se encarga de promover la Medicina Tradicional con el fin de crear conciencia en la población sobre el uso y alternativa de medicinas naturales tradicionales, "Los antibióticos son unas sustancias antimicrobianas, que actualmente están produciendo resistencia y alergias en el organismo de los pacientes, por ello una buena solución es la medicina natural, con productos que están en nuestras cocinas, como el ajo, la cebolla, miel de abeja y propóleo, son productos que ayudan bastante…" comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es natural y barato, la desventaja es la falta de capital para de medicinas naturales para la salud. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio para abrir una tienda, Ella desea realizar la compra de medicinas naturales para la salud. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera continua. 
Es por esos motivos que Pamela solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas naturales para la salud para abrir una tienda naturista.
texts.en:
Pamela is a 42 year-old woman who is single and has a 2 year-old son.  She has a business selling medical health products.  She is a good mother who is optimistic and has a good attitude.  She is also friendly, responsible, and very hardworking.  She carries out her business in the Miraflores neighborhood, which is the most stable in the city because of the land; this is where the sports stadium is located.  This area has a cold and dry climate with strong winds that come from the mountain range.

Pamela has a light complexion, brown eyes, short black shoulder-length hair, a short stature, and a slim physique.  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business.  She lives with her parents, who also work, and with her son who is not yet school-aged.  They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a tin roof.  The house has electricity, potable water, and sewer service.  

Pamela has a business selling natural medicinal products.  These span a great variety of techniques that are not considered part of conventional medicine.  She is in charge of promoting Traditional Medicines with the goal of creating awareness among the population about the use of these alternative traditional medicines.  "Antibiotics are antimicrobial substances that actually produce resistance and allergies in the patients, and so a good solution is natural medicines that use products that are in our kitchens, such as garlic, onions, honey, and pollen.  These are products that are quite helpful," she states.  The advantage of her business is that it is natural and cheap, the disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to buy natural health products.  

Pamela's dream is to open a store.  She wants to buy natural medicinal health products.  This is her first loan with the institution in the 5 years that she has been working in this business.  This is why Pamela is requesting a loan to buy natural medicinal health products so that she can open a natural products store.

loans.use: to buy natural medicinal health products

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Helen has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mario Esteban

texts.es:
Mario continúa con su negocio de confección de ropa deportiva para niños. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de tela e hilos por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio no tuvo problemas. Este emprendimiento personal transforma una diversidad de telas, materiales e insumos en una variedad enorme de prendas de vestir, para hombres, mujeres, jóvenes, adolescentes y niños. La característica principal de su negocio es que comercializa su producto, por mayor y al detalle, en su taller de costura y de forma ambulante vendiendo al detalle, “habilité un espacio en un cuarto grande de mi vivienda, donde instalé una máquina de coser para realizar todo tipo de trabajos desde diseños, cortes, costuras, empalmes y remaches, hasta bordados que se requieran…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de telas por mayor. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta, él de sea realizar la compra de tela por mayor para confeccionar ropa deportiva infantil. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Mario solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para confeccionar ropa deportiva infantil y abrir un puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Mario continues with his business of sewing sports clothing for children.. He invested the previous loan in buying fabric and thread wholesale. His installments payments were punctual as he had no problems with his business. This enterprising person transforms a variety of fabrics, materials and supplies into an enormous variety of clothing for men, women, youth, adolescence and children. The principal feature of his business is that he sells his product wholesale and retail at his sewing shop and itinerantly. "I set up a space in a large room in my house where I installed a sewing machine to do all types of work, from design, cutting, sewing, seams, rivets including embroidery if it is required" he commented.

His advantage is that he has wholesale sales, his disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy fabric wholesale. His dream is to open a sales stand. He wants to buy fabric wholesale to make children's sports clothing. This is his 3rd loan with the institution in the 8 years he has run his business.

For these reasons Mario is requesting a loan to buy fabric wholesale to make infants sports clothing and open a sales place.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale to make infants sports clothing and open a sales place.

loans.name: Patricia Veronica

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 21 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, yy su negocio es la venta de almuerzo.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘pampahasi’ ubicada sobre la ladera este de la ciudad, donde las calles son empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre 8-21 grados centígrados.
Patricia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción, Viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de almuerzo; el almuerzo se sirve a medio día y consiste en varias comidas una después de otra, 1-la entrada, que es una ensalada con una rodaja de pan, 2-la sopa, generalmente es espesa, 3-el segundo, este es el plato principal, 3-el postre, puede ser una fruta, “trabajo en la cocina desde muy niña, ahora cuento con mi propio puesto de venta en el mercado…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina espiadera y freidora de pollo para aumentar el menú de comida. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio y vender comida para llevar, Ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina espiadera y freidora de pollo para aumentar el menú de comida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Patricia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina espiadera y freidora de pollo para aumentar el menú de comida.
texts.en:
Patricia is a woman of 21. She is married and has no children. Her business is selling lunches.

She is entrepreneurial, independent, persevering, friendly, responsible, and very hard-working. She runs her business in the Pampahasi zone located on the east side of the city, where the streets are steep. [The area] has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies between 8 and 21 degrees centigrade.

Patricia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair, short stature, and a medium physical build. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. For business, she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction. They live in a house that belongs to the family. It is made of bricks and cement with a tile roof. It has electrical energy, potable water, and sewage service. 

Her business is selling lunches. Lunch is served at mid-day and consists of several foods, one after the other: first the appetizer, which is a salad with a slice of bread; second is the soup, generally it is thick; third is the main course, this is the principal dish; next is the dessert, which could be a fruit. "I've worked in the kitchen since I was a very little girl. Now I have my own sales stall in the market," she comments. The good thing about her business is that she has long-term customers. The problem is the lack of capital for the purchase of a chicken roaster and a deep fryer for chicken in order to expand her food menu.

Her dream is to stabilize her business and sell food to take out. She wants to make the purchase of a chicken roaster and a deep fryer for chicken in order to expand her food menu. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years that she has been running this business independently. It is for these reasons that Patricia is applying for a loan for the purchase of a chicken roaster and a deep fryer for chicken in order to expand her food menu.

loans.use: to buy a chicken roaster and a deep fryer for chicken to expand her food menu

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Speaking with Priscilla, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Eldoret, along with a handsome husband and their seven angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

For the past 25 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and she grows maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Priscilla has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up, and she states: “I have to do something for my family."

Priscilla joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Priscilla is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Priscilla to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Priscilla feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Priscilla will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. Priscilla is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Priscilla will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Evaristo Florentino

texts.es:
Evaristo continúa con su negocio de producción de estuco. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de leña y combustible. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su producción se vendió con normalidad. El estuco es un material de construcción que se emplea para enlucir paredes interiores, hacer molduras, relieves en muros y bóvedas e imágenes para pintar o dorar, “nuestro negocio se dedica a la fabricación de yeso de construcción, yeso para molduras, estuco de proyección, cal hidratada, cal viva, pero nuestros productos principales son estuco de construcción y de proyección…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ferreterías que compran contantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de leña y combustible para trabajar. Su sueño es comprar una cantera donde trabajar y extraer mineral, él desea realizar la compra de leña y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Evaristo solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y combustible para producir estuco y con los beneficios comprar una cantera para extraer mineral.
texts.en:
Evaristo continues with his business of the production of stucco. The previous loan he invested in the purchase of firewood and fuel. His repayments were timely because he sold his product as usual. Stucco is construction material used to finish interior walls and to make moldings, reliefs on walls and arches and images to paint and gild. "Our business is dedicated to the production of construction plaster, plaster for moldings, stucco for projection, hydrated lime, and quicklime, but our principal products are stucco for construction and projection...," he says.
The advantage of his business is that he has hardware stores that buy constantly. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy firewood and fuel with which to work.
His dream is to buy a quarry in which to work and extract mineral. He wants to purchase firewood and fuel in order to make stucco. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the five years he has been in this business.
For these reasons, Evaristo is requesting a loan for the purchase of firewood and fuel to produce stucco and with the proceeds to buy a quarry in order to extract mineral.

loans.use: to buy firewood and fuel in order to produce stucco and with the proceeds to buy a quarry in order to extract mineral.

loans.name: La Tormenta Group

texts.es:
Alina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano. 
Ella es buena madre, generosa, amable, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realizan en la zona Sur de la ciudad donde priman hoteles y gigantescos edificios para oficinas y comercios. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Alina es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño claro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, viste de celeste y usa una bufanda de colores). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista asalariado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar su economía formó una banca de personas con negocios como; panadería, taller de cerrajería, venta de queso, artesanía en yeso, confección de tejidos, venta de salteñas, venta de productos médicos naturales y venta de verduras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante; todos los días ella junto a su pareja se acomodan en centros comerciales y mercados de la zona, cargados de sacos llenos de ropa y zapatos. Levantan un par de sombrillas y arman un puesto de venta, los transeúntes del lugar se transforman en clientes y compran sus prendas continuamente, “vendo ropa y zapatos en general, nuestros clientes son de todas las edades porque no escogemos la ropa…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los precios de sus prendas son muy accesibles, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería por fardos. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa y zapatos, ella desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Alina solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano por fardos para ofertar a sus clientes continuos.
texts.en:
Alina is a 38-year old woman.  She lives with her partner, and they have two children who are 9- and 12-years old respectively.  Alina's business is selling second-hand clothing and shoes.   
Alina is a good mother.  She is generous, friendly, patient, determined, responsible and very hard-working.  She runs her business in the southern part of the city where priority is given to hotels and gigantic buildings used as offices and businesses.  The area has a subtropical climate with a temperature that averages 21 to 35 degrees Celsius during the day. 
Alina is olive-skinned with brown eyes and short, light brown hair.  She is short in height and of a healthy build.  Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home.  She speaks Spanish when out and about and in her business.  (In the above photo, she is first from the right, dressed in blue and wearing a colorful scarf).  Alina shares her life with her partner, who works as a salaried hauler, and her children, who go to school.  They live in a rented house made of wood that has a corrugated iron roof and a brick floor.  They have potable water and electricity and are connected to a sewage system. 
Because they needed to improve their finances, these people came together to form a communal bank.  Their businesses include a bakery, a locksmith's shop, selling cheese, plaster handicrafts, making fabric, selling meat pies, selling natural medicinal products and selling vegetables.  They are requesting a loan together to improve their businesses.
Alina's business is selling second-hand clothing and shoes as a street vendor.  Every day Alina and her partner set up in the commercial centers and area markets with sacks full of clothing and shoes.  They put up a couple umbrellas and set up their sales space.  The passers-by become customers and purchase their garments regularly.  Alina says, "I sell general clothing and shoes.  Our customers are people of all ages because we don't pick the clothing."  Her business's advantage is that the prices of her clothing are very affordable.  The disadvantage is her lack of capital to purchase her merchandise by the bundle.  
Alina's dream is to open a clothing and shoe store.  She wants to increase her capital so she can purchase wholesale second-hand clothing and shoes and offer a greater variety to her customers.  This is her fourth lending cycle with the Institution in the twelve years that she has been in this business. 
This is the reason that Alina is requesting a loan: to purchase second-hand clothing and shoes by the bundles to sell to her regular customers.

loans.use: to purchase second clothing and shoes by the bundle to sell to her regular customers.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Full of drive and perseverance, Sharon would like to give her family the best life instead of the tough upbringing that she went through. Sharon is a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past five years she has been involved in mixed farming; her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes, and she also keeps dairy cows. Sharon has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. Sharon mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her.

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Sharon is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if they are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Sharon is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Sharon feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. You can help Sharon with a loan that will change her life.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 35 years old, married, with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Leonisa has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Kachibora village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. This year, Juliet's goal is to introduce the zero-grazing technique on her farm.

To achieve her objective, Juliet needs to have sufficient feed inventory and cowsheds in place. Juliet is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. Having a cowshed will make it easier for Juliet to manage the herd. This intervention will result in improved health and dairy management, both keys to having a highly productive dairy farm. Income resulting from this intervention will be used to clear loan repayments and meet her family’s basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy a cowshed

loans.name: Losalina

texts.en:
Losalina is a progressive smallholder farmer based in the Kitale area of Kenya. She makes a living doing small-scale mixed farming. She rears cattle and plants maize/corn and fodder. Income from these farming activities help her to provide food and other basic needs for her family. Losalina's biggest challenge has to do with transport. She needs an easier way to take her produce to the market and get farm inputs and supplies from the market.

Losalina is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, through Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle that will be used for transporting goods to and from the market. With this asset, Losalina will be able to have access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions where prices are much better than in the local markets. Increased income from this intervention will help Losalina to scale up her business and improve the quality of life being led by her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
A large percentage of the people living in Kenya, particularly the Kerugoya area of Kenya, are poor, with the women bearing the brunt of it. Measures to be taken so as to reduce this trend require a concerted effort. It’s against this backdrop that Juhudi Kilimo decided to commit its energy in eradicating poverty by making loans available to women smallholder farmers.

Lenders! The above picture presents to you Nancy, 39 years of age. She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She is a proud mum, and has been doing mixed farming for the past 21 years. Her primary source of income is crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Nancy loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow, and she really takes good care of her dairy cows.

The Kerugoya area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; good soils, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Nancy wants to take advantage of this and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Through improved income she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her family. The financial benefits that Nancy will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits. Support this loan to a farmer from the Kenyan remote area who has great dreams for her family!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a hardworking and enterprising smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He is 26 years old, single and has no children. However, he is the first born in his family and has six younger siblings to look after. He practises dairy, poultry, tea and vegetable farming on a four-acre piece of land.

Cosmas' biggest challenge is lack of adequate space to accommodate the existing activities. This serves as a growth constraint to the progress of his business. He is seeking a loan to buy a plot of land. This investment will enable him to secure more land to cultivate and raise more animals. The impact of this loan investment on his family will be improved diets and better income.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebe recién nacido de 2 meses y un hijo de 10 años, y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es buen padre, solidario, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘Juana Azurduy de padilla’ ubicada al sur de la capital es el área más poblada, es producto de gente que viene de todas partes del país y de las provincias buscando un futuro mejor. Es la zona más próspera ya que en esa región se cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, además de hospital de segundo nivel, cadenas de farmacias y de comidas rápidas, supermercados y sucursales de entidades financiera.
Wilson es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cerrajería, él tiene un taller dónde se realizan puertas, marcos para ventanas, portones, rejas, etc., y todo tipo de estructura metálica. Trabajo que realiza en el patio de su casa habilitado como taller, de lunes a sábado durante todo el día, “realizamos todo tipo de estructura metálica, estamos ampliando el negocio y necesitamos una máquina amoladora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina amoladora. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, él desea realizar la compra de una máquina amoladora para mejorar la calidad de acabado de sus creaciones. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wilson solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina amoladora para ampliar su cerrajería y mejorar la calidad de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 42 year old man who lives with his partner. He has a newborn baby who is 2 months old and a 10 year old son. His business is a metal shop.

He is a good father: supportive, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking. He carries out his business in the "Juana Azurduy de Padilla" neighborhood located to the south of the capital. It is the most populated area, which is a product of the people who arrive from all parts of the country and provinces looking for a better future. It is the most prosperous area because in this region they count on all of the basic services in addition to a second level hospital, pharmacy chains, fast food restaurants, supermarkets, and branches of financial entities.

Wilson is of olive complexion, with brown eyes and short brown hair. He is short in stature, of robust physique, and his mother tongue is the Guaraní that he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish with the general public and in the business he carries out. He shares his life with his partner who works in the same business. They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and cement floor. It has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. His business is a metal shop; he has a workshop where he makes doors, window frames, gates, bars, etc., and all types of metal structures.

From Monday through Saturday during the whole day "we make all types of metal structures, we are expanding the business and we need a grinding machine..." he states. The advantage of his business is that he counts on constant customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a grinding machine. His dream is to expand his business, he wishes to accomplish the purchase of a grinding machine to improve the quality of the finishing of his creations. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years he has been dedicated to this work.

It is for these reasons that Wilson is seeking a loan for the purchase of a grinding machine to expand his metal shop and improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: to buy a grinding machine to expand his metal shop and improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Talisman Group

texts.es:
Mary continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio tuvo el éxito deseado (sentada, la primera de la derecha, viste vestido negro). En esta oportunidad reunió a la banca de emprendimiento para solicitar otro crédito y continuar mejorando sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, ella compra ropa por fardos, la cual la separa y divide según género y edad para ofertarlos a públicos definidos, su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y comercios de la zona, “realicé la compra de ropa y la pude ofertar a mejor precio, en esta ocasión necesito comprar ropa de invierno…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería de temporada. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano de invierno por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mary solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano de invierno para abrigar a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Mary continues with her business of selling secondhand clothing. She invested the previous loan in the purchase of secondhand clothing wholesale. The payments on her account were punctual because her business had the desired success. (Mary is seated, she is the first one on the right, wearing a black dress.) On this occasion she met with the entrepreneurial bank to apply for another loan and continue improving her business.

Her business is selling secondhand clothing. She buys clothing by the bundle, which she separates and divides according to gender and age in order to offer them to defined audiences. She does her work as an itinerant vendor at various fairs and commercial areas in the zone. "I made the purchase of clothing, and I offered it at a better price. At this time, I need to buy winter clothing," she comments. 

The good thing about her business is that she has long-term customers. The problem is the lack of capital for the purchase of seasonal merchandise. Her dream is to open a clothing store. She wants to make the purchase of secondhand winter clothing wholesale. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the five years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Mary is applying for a loan for the purchase of secondhand winter clothing to protect her seasonal customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand winter clothing to protect her seasonal customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Mary started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Inoi, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and also buy seeds to increase her horticulture farming. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Through the loan, she will also be able to take advantage of the good weather conditions and increase her horticulture production.

Mary believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production and horticulture produce. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Mary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit and also buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a smallholder farmer based in Molo, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He makes a living doing crop farming. In the picture, he is seen shelling maize/corn before packaging and transporting to the market.

Samson faces serious challenges involving transportation of his produce to the market. The bags of corn/maize are heavy to carry, he lives far from the market, transport providers' charges are based on weight and distance, poor road network, and few transport service providers.

Samson is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. With this asset, Samson will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair value for his produce. Your loan investing into Samson's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a smallholder farmer based in Kericho, which is Kenya's largest tea-growing area. Japhet makes a living doing mixed farming. He sells his farm produce at a local market near his home and uses the income to run his business and meet his family’s basic needs.

Japhet is facing a challenge that is common to many rural smallholder farmers; high cost of transportation. The alternative is for him to buy an affordable motorcycle that can be customized to carry goods and passengers. Japhet is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas.

With this asset, Japhet will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair value for his produce. Your loan investing into Japhet's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eva Evelin

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 29 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, amable, gentil, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max paredes’ Ubicado al noroeste de la ciudad, Albergó en su tiempo a los famosos Tambos (mercado de frutas) y donde el comercio es la principal actividad, llegando a tener un movimiento económico superior a los 500 mil dólares por día. 
Eva es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño lacio largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hermana menor que trabaja independientemente, viven en una casa alquilada construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida en su restaurante propio, ella se dedica a cocinar y administrar el local, las comidas mayormente demandadas son; bistec (carne con arroz y papas), sajta de pollo (pollo picante, con chuño), pollo al horno y lechón al horno. Ella se ocupa de preparar los alimentos por las noches para dejarlo todo listo y cocinado al día siguiente, “el negocio funciona correctamente, busco mejorar el servicio para atraer más clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un equipo de sonido para mejorar el ambiente del restaurant. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante en su casa, ella desea realizar la compra de un equipo de sonido para mejorar el ambiente del restaurant. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eva solicita un préstamo para la compra de un equipo de sonido para mejorar el ambiente del restaurant.
texts.en:
Eva is a 29 year old woman who is single without children, and her business is selling food.

She is enterprising, friendly, kind, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the "Max Paredes" zone located northeast of the city, which in its time was home to the famous Tambos (fruit markets.) Commerce is the main activity, approaching an economic movement of more than $500,000 per day.

Eva is of olive complexion, with brown eyes and long, straight brown hair she wears tied up. She is of medium stature, medium physique, and her mother tongue is the Aymará that she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish with the general population and in the business she carries out.
She shares her life with her younger sister who works independently. They live in a rented house made of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and a wood floor. It has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

She works selling food in her own restaurant. She is dedicated to cooking and managing the establishment. The most in-demand foods are bistec (meat with rice and potatoes), sajta de pollo (spicy chicken with freeze-dried potato), baked chicken, and baked pig. She busies herself preparing the foods in the evenings to leave everything ready and cooked for the following day.

"The business works correctly, I am looking to improve the service to attract more customers," she says. The advantage of her business is that she counts on daily sales, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a sound system to improve the atmosphere of the restaurant. Her dream is to open a restaurant in her house. She wishes to accomplish the purchase of a sound system to improve the atmosphere of the restaurant. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years that she has been dedicated to this work.

It is for these reasons that Eva is seeking a loan to purchase a sound system to improve the atmosphere of her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a sound system to improve the atmosphere of her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his products to the market in a timely manner and also buy seeds to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a smallholder farmer based in Nandi Hills, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is married and has a child. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. After selling his farm’s products, he uses the income to run his business and meet his family’s basic needs.

A challenge common to rural smallholder farmers that Julius is facing is the high cost of transportation. Julius is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. With this asset, Julius will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair value for his produce.
