Your loan investing into Julius' business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a smallholder farmer who lives and works on a small farmland in Kitale, Kenya. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. After selling his farm’s products, he uses the income to run and grow his business, and meet his family’s basic needs.

In Kitale, the cost of transportation is very high. This is so because the road network is poor and service providers are scarce. Isaac is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas.

With the motorcycle, Isaac will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair value for his produce. Your loan investing into Isaac's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is responsible, hardworking and enterprising man from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He is 62 years old, married, and a father to seven children. He started farming in 1980. He enjoys farming both as a lifestyle and livelihood.

Peter is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land. The plot will give him more space to cultivate and produce more food. This investment will not only enhance his family's access to a sufficient quantity of nutritious food but also boost their income. He loves to feed people and that is why he finds his business fulfilling.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy comes from a remote village found in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He practices dairy and poultry farming on his 0.5 acre farm to earn a living. Kennedy is not earning adequate income for his family because he farms for subsistence. He has a better chance of improving his family's livelihood by shifting to commercial farming.

To enable this change, Kennedy is seeking a loan to buy poultry for the purpose of farming meat and eggs for food and income. He is optimistic that the investment will pay off with the increase in demand for poultry products in the market. Your loan will help Kennedy to seize this economic opportunity and improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is Kenya's largest maize/corn producing district. Joseph makes a living doing maize/corn farming. He sells his produce at a local market and uses the money to cover next season's operations and meet his family’s basic needs.

Joseph has two major challenges; irregular income and high cost of transportation. Crop farming is seasonal and a typical farmer would have more money after harvesting than any other time of the year. The problem is that the farmer will have to incur a high cost of transportation during and after harvesting. For this reason, Joseph is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas.

With this asset, Joseph will be able to transport his produce, at a lower cost, to formal markets far from his local market. This will yield him more income to prepare for next season. Also, the motorcycle will generate regular income for him throughout the year if he offers transportation services to the public. Your loan investing into Joseph's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel comes from a remote village found in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Daniel is married and has four children. He practices dairy, poultry and pig farming to make a living. Pig farming is the most profitable of all the activities he is involved in.

Daniel is seeking a loan to buy poultry for the purpose of farming meat and eggs for food and income. He is optimistic that the investment will pay off with the increase in demand for poultry products in the market. Your loan will help Daniel to seize this economic opportunity and improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 80 years old. He is a husband, grandfather, and father who is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Gitumbi, Kerugoya. He has been practicing agribusiness for the past 20 years and has never looked back. To earn a living, Joseph sells milk and food products from his farm into the local market. He makes extra money doing a side hustle business. He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products and he really feels satisfied.

Although Joseph has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. Joseph is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kerugoya and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Joseph does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good; chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint.

With this loan, Joseph is confident that his income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Joseph will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his large family a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans comes from a remote village found in the Kitale area of Kenya. He practices poultry farming for a living. He owns and works on a one-acre farm which is also home to his wife and two children. He is determined to grow his business and improve his family’s income.

Evans is seeking a loan to buy poultry for the purpose of farming meat and eggs for food and income. He is optimistic that the investment will pay off with the increase in demand for poultry products in the market. Your loan will help Evans to seize this economic opportunity and improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 50 kg of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
With two children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Nancy, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in.

Nancy is seeking a loan worth 100,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily-rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Nancy access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Nancy’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Nancy!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has four children. Besides crop farming, Stephen also runs a poultry farm, a retail store and a grain mill shop. The key lesson he has taken away from 10 years of business is that quality products and services are central to business.

Stephen is seeking a loan to buy quality agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Stephen’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Hello lenders, the above picture presents Sarah, 24 years of age, a hard-working, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Kapsowar. It is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married, and together with her husband, has a lovely family. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Sarah is a tough woman with tough skin and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling.

The Kapsowar area has conditions that favour sheep farming and Sarah has always wanted to take care of a sheep, but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy a sheep. The sheep she intends to buy is not just an ordinary sheep. It’s a breed that produces good quality of wool and has high quality meat (mutton). With this sheep, she will be able to sell more wool, which will translate to more income. Demand for sheep meat in the Kapsowar area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Sarah is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Sarah to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more sheep. Help Sarah to keep living the dream!

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
For 10 years, Eunice has worked in agricultural production. She wakes up every day to go to work and care for her land. This is a skill that she learned on her own, and little by little, she has perfected her techniques and abilities in this field. Eunice is dedicated in full to her work. This mum only thinks about going forward and delivering good produce. She knows that many people consume her farm products, and because of this, she makes sure her products are pure and of good quality.

She is a 45-year-old farmer from Cbebiemit village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She lives with her family on a small piece of land where she keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops. For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk and produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases. Eunice made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Sometime last month, she applied for a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to her children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Eunice's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future. You can help Eunice with a loan so she can fulfill all her dreams.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 45 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de helados.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, emprendedora, activa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El torno’ distante aproximadamente a 32 km de la ciudad, lo compone una vasta zona de bosque subtropical húmedo poseedora de una gran diversidad de flora y fauna. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Marcela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de helados de agua; que es un postre congelado hecho a base de leche o nata combinadas con edulcorantes y azúcar. Los ingredientes que utiliza en su elaboración son: leche, azúcar, edulcorantes, nata de leche, huevo, frutas, chocolate, frutos secos, yogurt y agua mineral, “mis helados son de alta calidad y muy personalizados, empleo sólo ingredientes frescos y al contrario de los helados industriales no utilizo saborizantes, colorantes ni conservantes…” comenta. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en su carro, entregando sus helados por mayor a tiendas y vendedores ambulantes. La ventaja de su negocio es que el clima cálido del lugar la ayuda a vender rápidamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para el manteamiento de su vehículo. Su sueño es mejorar los procesos de fabricación para vender a la ciudad, Ella desea realizar el mantenimiento a su vehículo para poder entregar sus helados a tiempo. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Marcela solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento a su vehículo para poder entregar sus helados a tiempo y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 45-year-old woman, single and has two children who are 10 and 15 years old. She is in the business of selling ice cream.

She is a good woman, patient, entrepreneurial, active, dependable, responsible and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the "El torno" area approximately 32 km from the city. This area is a vast zone of humid subtropical forest which possesses a great diversity of flora and fauna. It has a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Marcela has dark skin, brown eyes, long black hair tied at the back, a short stature and a robust physique. Her native tongue is Guarani which is spoken in the area, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her children who study in school, and lives in her own house constructed of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof and ceramic floor, and also has a pump well and electricity. It does not have sewage.

Her business is the making and selling of "helados de agua" [a type of ice cream]. This is a frozen dessert made of a base of milk and cream combined with sweeteners and sugar. The ingredients she uses in their preparation are: milk, sugar, sweeteners, dairy cream, eggs, fruits, chocolate, nuts, yogurt and mineral water. "My ice creams are high quality and very customized. I only use fresh ingredients and unlike industrial ice creams I don't use flavorings, colorings or preservatives," she says. She makes her sales as an ambulatory vendor with her car, delivering her ice creams wholesale to shops and street vendors. The advantage of her business is that the hot climate helps her to sell quickly. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to maintain her vehicle. 

Her dream is to improve her manufacturing processes to sell in the city. She wishes to perform maintenance on her vehicle so that she can deliver ice cream on time. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in her ten years developing her business. It is for these reasons that Marcela requests a loan to do maintenance on her vehicle to be able to deliver ice cream on time and to continue working.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her vehicle to be able to deliver ice cream on time and to continue working

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 58 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 16 y19 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, optimista, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Chua cocani’ que se encuentra a las orillas del Lago Titicaca, a 75 km del centro de la Ciudad, cuenta con 4 mil habitantes, divididos en 10 comunidades,  La región se caracteriza por su vocación productiva agropecuaria y pesca y fundamentalmente turística. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Elsa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y paja con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida con alimentos que se producen en la región, como; trucha frita (se acompaña con arroz y chuño), ispi frito (con papas hervidas y chuño), ancas de rana (con papas fritas y ensalada), sopa de pescado, Ají de Bogas y otros, “la principal característica del lugar es la comida tradicional, cocinamos todo lo que producimos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la construcción de un cuarto para utilizarlo como comedor. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de material de construcción para construir un comedor para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elsa solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para construir un comedor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 58-year-old woman, married with two children who are 16 and 19 years old, and her business is the sale of food.

She is a good mother, patient, optimistic, generous, responsible and very hardworking. She works in the community "Chua cocani" which is located on the shores of Lake Titicaca, 75 km from the center of the city, and has 4,000 inhabitants divided into ten communities. The region is characterized by its productive agriculture and fishing sectors and is fundamentally touristic. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius.

She has dark skin, brown eyes, long black hair worn in a braid, a short stature and a thin physique. She wears traditional clothing (hat, wrap, and "pollera" skirt), her native tongue is Aymara which is spoken in the region and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her husband who works in agriculture and her children who study and work. They live in their own house built of adobe and straw with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor, as well as a pump well and electricity but no sewage.

Her business is the sale of food made from locally produced ingredients such as: fried trout (with sides of rice and potato starch), fried ispi [fish from Lake Titicaca] (with boiled potatoes and potato starch), frog's legs (with fried potatoes and salad), fish soup, "aji de bogas" and others. "The principal character of the place is traditional food. We cook everything that we produce," she says. The advantage of her business is that she sells daily. The disadvantage is the lack of capital for the construction of a room to use as a dining room. 

Her dream is to improve her business. She wishes to buy construction materials to construct a dining room for her business. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in her three years doing this job. It is for these reasons that Elsa requests a loan to buy construction materials to construct a dining room for her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a dining room for her business

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Nataly continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de un horno industrial. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio no tuvo problemas (al centro, viste chompa marrón y sostiene a su bebe). En esta oportunidad reunió a la banca de emprendimiento para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus actividades, los negocios de la banca son; llantería, venta de artículos para baño, venta de postres, confección de sábanas, venta de carne de cerdo, venta de frutas, artesanía en cuero y venta de productos médicos naturales. Su negocio continúa mejorando, su menú es más variado y también la cantidad de clientes y el número de ventas mejoraron “mi negocio está creciendo, las nuevas comidas del menú atrajeron a más clientes y pierdo ventas porque no tengo muebles donde atenderlos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes. Su sueño es mejorar su puesto de venta de comida, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nataly solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Nataly continues with her business selling traditional food. She invested her previous loan in the purchase of an industrial oven. Her loan payments were punctual because her business did not have any problems (she is in the middle of the photo, wearing a brown sweater and carrying a baby). 

At this time she met with her communal bank to request a loan to improve her business. The businesses in the communal bank are: tire repair shop, sale of bathroom articles, sale of desserts, production of bedsheets, sale of lamb meat, sale of fruits, leather artisan goods and sale of natural medical products. Her business continues improving, her menu is more varied and also the quantity of customers and sales has improved. "My business is growing, the new dishes on the menu have attracted more customers and I lose sales because I don't have tables where I can serve them," she says. The advantage of her business is that she makes sales daily. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy tables and chairs to serve more customers.

Her dream is to improve her food stand. She wishes to buy tables and chairs to serve more customers. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in her three years developing her business as an independent owner. It is for these reasons that Nataly requests a loan to buy tables and chairs to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to serve more customers

loans.name: Felisabel

texts.es:
Felisabel continúa con su negocio de confección de tejidos artesanales. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de lana por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su producción. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘torrini pampa’ ubicado en la zona sur de la ciudad, área residencial donde hasta hace no mucho estaba el área rural, el sitio para hacer excursiones. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Felisabel es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que tiene un año y medio de edad, viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos hechos a mano como; gorros, guantes, pantalones y ropa para bebé, “aprendí a tejer por herencia de mi abuela y mirando a otras personas como tejían…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de lana por mayor. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de lana por mayor para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Felizabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para contar con trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Felisabel continues her knitting business. The previous loan was invested in the bulk purchase of wool. The payment of her dues was timely because she was able to sell all of her production. Her business is done in the ‘torrini pampa’ district located in the southern part of the city, a residential area where until not long ago was the rural area, the site for excursions. The climate is cold and dry with temperatures that vary during the day between 0-12 degrees Celsius (32-54 degrees Fahrenheit).

Felisabel has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair which she wears braided. She is short and slight in stature. Her dress is traditional (hat, blanket and skirt), her native language is Aymara, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish for everyday use and for her business. She shares her life with her son, who is one and a half years old. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a tin roof and cement floor that has well water extracted by a pump, electric power, and does not have a sewer connection.

Her business is the manufacture of articles knitted by hand such as: hats, gloves, pants and baby clothes. "I learned to knit as an inheritance from my grandmother and looking at other people as they knitted ...” she relates. The advantage of her business is that sales are continuous; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy wool wholesale. Her dream is to improve her business; she wishes to buy wool wholesale in order to have a steady supply of work materials. This is the 2nd loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that she has devoted herself to this occupation.

It is for these reasons that Felizabel is applying for a loan to buy wool wholesale in order to have a steady supply of work materials.

loans.use: buy wool wholesale in order to have a steady supply of work materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Cherenganyi village who is involved in dairy and maize/corn farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. She gets help with the work from her family members.

Hellen is seeking a loan to purchase quality farm inputs. Through your loan investment in her business, Hellen will use the money to buy important supplies such as herbicides and pesticides to manage weeds and preserve the harvested produce. She also plans to use part of the money to pay laborers, loaders and transporters.

Hellen is optimistic that this years harvest will be better than last season's. Income from the dairy will be used to make initial loan repayments until the crops are harvested and sold.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Beogneere Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI est responsable du groupe  BEOGNEERE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Madame fait du commerce de céréales depuis 13 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 sacs de maïs, 02 sacs de mil, 05 sacs de sorgho.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Fati is responsible for the Beogneere group. She is married and mother to three children, the eldest of whom is eight years old and the youngest two. One of the children goes to school and Fati has seven dependants in total.

She has been selling cereals for the past 13 years and gets her supplies in the surrounding markets. With the money she is granted, she is planning to buy five sacks of corn, two sacks of millet and five sacks of sorghum. She wants to use the profits she makes as a result of this loan to build up her business and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of corn, two sacks of millet and five sacks of sorghum.

loans.name: Neguelaba Group

texts.fr: Maîmouna est celle  qui est  accroupié sur  la  photo avec  des  condiments  en  mains  entre  les  deux  hommes, Maîmouna  est  une  commerçante de condiments (ingrédients  sauce),  âgée  de  49 ans,  mariée   avec  9  enfants  qui  sont  âges  de  7 à 26  ans,  dont  4  sont  scolarisés.   C’est  une  cliente  très  courageuse  dans  son  activité   commerciale. Elle  est   gentille dans son  travail.  ,  Son  Mari  est  cultivateur,  il  l’ aide  dans  son  activité .  Elle n’a  pas été à l’école. Son  lieu  d’ approvisionnement  est  Kati , et celui  des  ventes  dans  les  marches  locaux. Elle  peut  avoir un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA PAR mois. La marchandise  qu’elle vend sont : choux pomme, ognon,  huile,  tomate  etc….. elle    fait  recourt au  RMC R pour acheter plus de condiments pour servir ses clients. Le prêt  lui  aide  vraiment  dans  son  activité  de  commerce. Elle  est  très  contente  car  elle  pourra  assurer  tous  les  besoins  nécessaire  de ses  enfants. Son rêve est de  construction  un   magasin  pour  le  stockages  de  ces  marchandises  à coté  de  sa  propre  maison.
texts.en:
Maîmouna is the person who is crouching in the photo in between the two men and holding condiments in her hands. She sells condiments (ingredients for sauces) and is 49 years old and married with nine children, aged between seven and 26 years old; four of the children are educated.

Maîmouna is a courageous woman in her business and very kind. Her husband is a farmer and he helps her out in her business. She did not go to school. She gets her provisions in Kati and sells them in local markets. She can make 35,000FCFA per month. The goods she sells are: round cabbages, onions, oil, tomatoes, etc.. She is turning to RMCR so she can buy more condiments for her customers. The loan will really help her with her business. She is very happy because she will be able to provide for all her children's needs. Her dream is to build a shop to stock all her goods next to her house.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone accessories (chargers, cases).

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es una joven mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de utensilios de plástico.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, optimista, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘21 de octubre’ donde recientemente se inauguró las nuevas conexiones a gas domiciliario. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Daisy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan independientemente, Viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de  artículos de plástico, como; platos, cubiertos, botellas, envases, etc., “actualmente resultaría difícil imaginar que alguno de los sectores de nuestra vida diaria, de la economía o de la técnica, pudiera prescindir de los plásticos, Sólo basta con observar a nuestro alrededor y analizar cuántos objetos son de plástico para visualizar la importancia económica que tienen estos materiales…” comenta. Paralelamente  a su negocio ella estudia la carrera de gastronomía por las noches. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra ubicado en una zona comercial, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra vasos y platos plásticos por mayor. Su sueño es establecerse en el mercado y terminar de estudiar, ella desea realizar la compra vasos y platos plásticos por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los libros de estudio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Daisy solicita un préstamo para la compra vasos y platos plásticos por mayor y con los beneficios pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Daisy is a young 32-year-old woman and is single with no children. Her business is selling plastic utensils. She is enterprising, independent, generous, optimistic, kind, responsible and very hard-working. She works in the '21 de octubre' area where new domestic gas supplies have just recently been connected. The area has a cold dry climate with a temperature which varies between 0-12 degrees Centigrade during the day.

Daisy has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair which she wears in a plait. She is short and of medium build. Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks within the family and she speaks Spanish for general purposes and for carrying out her business. She shares her life with her parents who work independently. They live in a house belonging to the family which is built from brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof. It has electricity, a drinking water and domestic gas supply and a sewer connection.

Daisy's business is selling plastic items such as plates, cutlery, bottles, containers etc. "Now it would be difficult to imagine that some aspects of our daily life, from the economy to technology, would be possible without plastics. We only have to look around us and analyse how many objects are made of plastic to see the economic importance that these materials have..." she says.

Alongside her business she is studying a course in gastronomy at night. The advantage of her business is that it is situated in a commercial area while the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy plastic plates and cups wholesale. Her dream is to establish herself in the market and finish her studies. She wants to buy plastic plates and cups wholesale and pay for her study books with the profits. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has been doing this work independently. These are the reasons why Daisy is asking for a loan, to buy plastic plates and cups wholesale and pay for her studies with the profits.

loans.use: to buy plastic plates and cups wholesale and pay for her studies with the profits.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans qui vit à Baguida avec ses  deux enfants. Dédé est une femme dynamique qui cherche l’épanouissement de sa famille. Dédé vend des pagnes, des céréales et est aussi coiffeuse et s’approvisionne au marché pour disposer de bonne qualités de pagnes qu’elle désire commander avec ce prêt. Dédé va pouvoir promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et agrandir son commerce avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera.
texts.en:
Dédé is a married 31 year old woman who lives in Baguida with her two children. Dédé is a dynamic woman who wants her family to flourish.
Dédé sells pagne cloth, cereals, and is also a hairdresser. She gets her supplies at the market so as to benefit from the good quality pagne cloth that she wishes to order with this loan.
Dédé will be able to promote her children's education and expand her trade with the profit margin that she will obtain.

loans.use: to buy 11 pieces of traditional pagne cloth of high and medium quality.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Dans le groupe Celle qui a les pagnes en teinture est Aissata. Elle est Malienne et âgée de 60ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 filles sont à l’école. Elle a pour activité d’acheter des pagnes dogon blancs dans les marchés environnants puis elle les met dans la teinture puis elle les  coud, après afin de les revendre jusqu’au Bourkina Fasso avec beaucoup de profits qui seront investis pour prendre une partie de la charge de ses enfants telle que l’habillement et la santé. Elle exerce cette activité de teinture de pagnes depuis 20 ans. Elle prend un prêt auprès de la caisse pour acheter beaucoup de rouleaux blancs traditionnels pour son commerce. Son rêve est d’acheter des bijoux de valeurs pour ses 2 filles et une moto pour son garçon.
texts.en:
In this group, the one holding the dyed traditional pagne cloth is Aissata. She is Malian and is 60 years old, married and the mother of 3 children of whom 2 girls are in school.
Her activity is the purchase of white traditional cloth (pagne) in surrounding markets, which she then dyes and sews. She then sells these, even in Burkina Faso, with a lot of profits which will be invested to contribute to the care of her children, such as clothing and health. She has been carrying out this activity of dying pagne cloth for 20 years.
She is taking a loan from the bank in order to buy many rolls of traditional white fabric for her trade. Her dream is to buy valuable jewellery for her two daughters and a motorcycle for her son.

loans.use: to buy rolls of cloth to make traditional wraps (pagnes) for sale.

loans.name: Abra  Thèrèse

texts.fr: Thérèse âgée de 48 ; elle est  veuve et mère deux enfants. Thérèse  habit à Adidogomé et fait le commerce des  plats qu’elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois  au marché.  Avec  ce crédit que Thérèse sollicite,  elle  achètera  des  plats et des verres à boire. Les revenus lui permettront de faire face à l’éducation et aux charges de ses deux enfants qui sont à sa charge.
texts.en:
Thérèse is 48 years old, she is a widow and the mother of two children. Thérèse lives in Adidogomé and trades in dishes which she obtains three times per month at the market.
With this loan that Thérèse is asking for, she will buy dishes and drinking glasses. The income will allow her to meet schooling and other expenses for the two children she is responsible for.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of dishes and six sets of drinking glasses.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 50 years old and married with one child.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Florenda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Florenda has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for pigs.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de  37 años de edad, soltero, tiene una hija de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de revistas y comics.
Él es buen padre, independiente, emprendedor, amable, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ donde se encuentra la terminal de buses con destino a pueblos del amazonas. De clima frio y seco con fuertes vientos que provienen de la cordillera.
Victor es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de revistas, comics y artículos de colección. El comic ayuda a los niños en el acercamiento a la lectura, artículos científicos de revistas han editado entre sus artículos, estudios e investigaciones que ponen a las historietas infantiles como herramientas educativas y métodos de relajación, “Una tira cómica basada en una historia atrayente, ayuda a que los niños se interesen por sí solos en la lectura…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia directa, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un televisor para reproducir video y atraer a más clientes. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija, él desea realizar la compra de un televisor para reproducir video y atraer a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Victor solicita un préstamo para la compra de un televisor para reproducir video y atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Victor is a 37 year old, single man. He has a two year old daughter, and his business is selling magazines and comics.

He is a good, independent, entrepreneurial, friendly, steadfast, responsible and very hardworking father. His business is conducted in the Villa Fátima where the bus terminal, with Amazonian town destinations, is located. The climate is cold and dry with strong winds coming from the mountain range.

Victor has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature, and thin physique. His mother tongue is Aymará which he speaks with family. He speaks Spanish with the wider society and in conducting business.

His life is shared with his daughter who is not yet of school age. They live in a house owned by the family. It is constructed from brick and cement with a tin roof and wooden floor that has potable water, electricity and a sewage system.

His business is selling magazines, comics, and collectibles. The comics help children in how to approach reading. Scientific journals have published among their articles, studies and research indicating that children’s stories can be educational tools and methods of relaxation. "A comic strip based on a compelling story helps children interested in reading alone..." he says. The advantage of this business is that it has no direct competition. The disadvantage is the lack of capital for purchases.

This is his first loan with the institution in the four years since he began making a living in this business.

His dream is to improve his daughter's quality of life. He wants to purchase a television in order to play video and attract more customers. For these reasons, Victor requests a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a television for playing video and attracting more customers.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 57 años de edad, viuda, tiene 2 hijos de 23 y 17 años,  su negocio es la venta de artículos de ferretería.
Ella es confiada en sí misma, divertida, leal, honesta y considerada. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizado por la feria, que tuvo sus inicios en los años 60’s, enmarcada dentro de un espacio de no más de 3 cuadras, conformada con la migración campesina y minera que se registró en más de dos décadas. Hoy en día es considerada la  más grande del país.
Adela es morena, de ojos negros, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, físico robusto, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su idioma natal es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son independientes y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de ferretería como; destornilladores, alicates, llaves, limas, pinzas, etc., en un puesto de venta en la calle,  al aire libre los días de feria (jueves y domingo), “comencé vendiendo de forma ambulante, luego conseguí este puesto de venta en la feria…” comenta. La ventaja es que las ventas en la feria son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer su negocio. Su sueño es ser vendedora mayorista, ella desea comprar artículos de ferretería para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en 6 años que trabaja en el negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para comprar artículos de ferretería para vender en su puesto de la feria.
texts.en:
Adela is a 57-year-old woman, a widow, who has 2 children ages 23 and 17. Her business is selling hardware items.

She is confident in herself, fun, loyal, honest and considerate. Her business is located in the 16 de julio zone, characterized by the market, which had its beginnings in the '60s, held in a space of no more than 3 blocks, made up of the rural and miner migration that happened over more than two decades. Today it is considered the largest in the country.

Adela has dark skin, black eyes, long black hair she wears braided, is short, has a robust physique, dresses traditionally (hat, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture. She shares her life with her children who are independent and work, they live in their own house build of adobe with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has drinking water, electricity, gas and sewer services. Her business is selling hardware items such as screwdrivers, pliers, wrenches, files, clamps, etc., at a sales space on the street, outdoors on the market days (Thursdays and Sundays). "I began selling as a street vendor, then I got this sales space in the market..." she says. The advantage is that sales in the market are constant, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock her business. Her dream is to be a wholesaler, she wants to purchase hardware items to stock her business. This is the first loan cycle in the 6 years that she has worked in the business.

For these reasons, Adela asks for a loan to purchase hardware items to sell in her market space.

loans.use: to purchase hardware goods to sell in her space at the market.

loans.name: Los Insuperables Group

texts.es:
Maria es una joven mujer de 21 años, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es conversadora, resistente, libre, soñadora, capaz y exitosa. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘villa santa cruz’ caracterizado por sus calles arenosas de precarias casas, habitadas por humildes familias. Donde la actividad de la micro, pequeñas y medianas empresas, representan un 90% del sector empresarial privado. 
María es de piel morena, ojos obscuros, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, físico delgado, su idioma materno es el Guaraní y habla español (la primera de la derecha, viste polera negra y pantalón celeste claro). La necesidad por cubrir los gastos educativos de su hijo la llevó a liderar la banca de personas con negocios como; comida, artesanía, refrescos, panadería, comercio de fruta, confección de tejidos y venta de queso. Su negocio es vender ropa de segunda mano, que realiza ambulantemente en zonas públicas y comerciales, “todos los días cambio de puesto de venta para variar los clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es el precio económico, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ropa por mayor. Su sueño es comprar un puesto fijo, ella desea comprar ropa por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año de experienjcia.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano para cubrir los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 21-year-old young woman, who lives with her partner, has a 6-year-old son, and her business is selling second-hand clothing.

She is chatty, tough, free, visionary, capable and successful. Her business is in the Villa Santa Cruz neighborhood, characterized by its sandy streets of precarious houses, inhabited by humble families. Here, the activities of the micro-, small, and mid-size businesses represent 90% of the private business sector.

María has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she wears loose, has a thin physique, her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish (she is the first on the right, wearing a black t-shirt and light blue pants). The need to cover her son's educational expenses brought her to lead a bank of people with businesses such as: food, crafts, soft drinks, bakery, fruit sales, making knit items, and cheese sales. Her business is selling second-hand clothing, which she does walking around public and commercial zones. "Every day, I change the sales location to vary the customers..." she says. The advantage of her business is the inexpensive price, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy clothing in bulk. Her dream is to purchase a fixed sales space, she wants to purchase clothing in bulk. This is her 1st loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year of experience.

For these reasons, María asks for a loan to purchase second-hand clothing to cover her son's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing to cover her child's expenses.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Afi est une femme mariée vivant à Baguida avec ses six enfants à charge. Afi est une femme dynamique et courageuse qui prépare de la bouillie qu’elle vend accompagnée des beignets et du pain pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Son activité donne droit au bénéfice indispensable pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Afi s’approvisionne au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maîs, des beignets et des pains pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en: Afi is a 55-year-old married mother who lives in Baguida with six children in her care. Afi is a dynamic and courageous woman who cooks and sells porridge, along with fritters and bread in order to please her customers. Her business allows her to earn money which is indispensable to her family's needs. Afi gets her supplies from market. She is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of corn, fritters and bread which will be resold in order to earn an even greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of maize, four bowls of beans and 30 loaves of bread

loans.name: Raquel Andrea

texts.es:
Raquel continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa interior femenina por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque sus ventas fueron continuas. Actualmente su negocio se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada porque tiene mayor rotación, “las ventas se manejan solas y los clientes deciden que debo venderles, mis ventas van dirigidas de acuerdo a los que mis clientes necesitan y compran rápido…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio oes que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería de temporada como; guardapolvos, uniformes de colegio, y otros. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos para darle comodidades a su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de temporada para vender por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en  4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Raquel solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada para vender por mayor y cubrir los gastos de sus niños.
texts.en:
Raquel continues with her business selling clothing. The previous loan was invested in the purchase of women's lingerie in bulk. The payments were punctual because the sales were continuous. Currently, her business is focused on selling seasonal clothing because it has a better turnover. "The sales take care of themselves and the customers decide that I should sell them, my sales hare directed according to what my customers want and purchase quickly..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that the sales are continuous, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase seasonal merchandise such as dust collars, school uniforms, and more. Her dream is to increase her income to provide her family with comforts, she wants to purchase seasonal clothing to sell in bulk. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 4 years that she has done this work.

For these reasons, Raquel asks for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing to sell in bulk and to cover her children's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell in bulk and to cover her children's expenses.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Dodo est une femme dynamique âgée de 35 ans résidant à Baguida. Dodo est une revendeuse de savon qu’elle fabrique et  qui s’approvisionne du nécessaire au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Désirant commander des bidons d’huile et du soda, Dodo sollicite ce prêt pour gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Dodo is a 35-year-old married mother to four children who lives in Baguida. She is a dynamic vendor who sells soap which she makes herself. She gets the materials she needs from market and sells the finished product in her local area. Dodo is requesting this loan to purchase containers of oil and soda so she can increase her profits. By doing this, she will be able to assist her husband in organising their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase three containers of red oil

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una joven mujer de 21 años, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es autosuficiente, delicada, autentica, risueña, carismática, discreta y oportuna. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chasquipampa’ ubicado al sur de la ciudad, área que antiguamente era para el pastoreo. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-21 grados centígrados.
Graciela, es morena de ojos negros y cabello largo, baja estatura, de cuerpo delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su madre que trabaja y con sus hermanas que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no cuenta con agua ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo, arroz, verduras, huevo, leche, aceite, y otros, actividad que realiza en su tienda de barrio en horas del día durante toda la semana, “inicie mi negocio con un capital mínimo y debido a la falta de competencia mi negocio fue mejorando…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia, la desventaja es el tiempo que usa el negocio. Su sueño es ahorrar para poder estudiar, ella desea realizar la compra de mercadería para abastecer su tienda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Graciela solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Graciela is a 21 year old woman who is single and has no children. Her business is selling staple items and food in her neighborhood store.

She is self-sufficient, dedicated, authentic, cheerful, charismatic, discreet and punctual. She has her business in the ‘Chasquipampa’ area, located in the southern part of the city, and area that used to be pasture. It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 8-21 degrees centigrade.

Graciela has dark skin, black eyes, long hair, short stature, and a thin build. Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She lives with her mother, who works, and her three sisters, who are in school. They live in their own home build from brick and cement, which has electricity, but doesn't have water or plumbing. Her business is selling staple items and food, such as bread, sugar, noodles, rice, vegetables, eggs, milk, oil and more. She does this in her neighborhood store during the day all week long. “I started my business with minimal capital and due to a lack of competition, my business improved," she remarks. The advantage of her business is that she has no competition. The disadvantage is the time that the business takes up. Her dream is to save up to be able to go to school. She wants to buy merchandise to stock her store. This is her first loan cycle with the institution during the year she has been doing this activity.

It for this reason that Graciela is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
A woman full of life, honest, hard-working, and very humble — this is Jenifer. She is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver.

The living conditions in the Kitale area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Jenifer has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Jenifer started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. Her sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market. The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Jenifer is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Jenifer is very determined to succeed. Because she is very disciplined with finances, she plans that she will be able to provide a secure future for herself and for her children through accumulated profits. Jenifer's dream is to provide a secure future for her children by paying tuition fees for them. You will help her realize her dream through your loan.

Like Jenifer, thousands of entrepreneurs are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 51 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos plásticos. 
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, emprendedora, dinámica, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Callampaya’ área donde es la estación del teleférico rojo. Desde las alturas se pueden apreciar sitios específicos como la arquitectura del histórico Cementerio General o el automóvil estancado en medio de una fisura en una de las rutas que une El Alto y La Paz. 
Adela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y le ayuda en el comercio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de productos plásticos como; baldes, sillas, jarras, vasos, canastas, basureros, y otros, “trabajo con plásticos desde hace 5 años, mi actividad la realizo sola y necesito renovar la mercadería constantemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería nueva. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de artículos de plástico para el hogar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos plásticos para su negocio y así mandar a su hijo a la ecuela.
texts.en:
Adela is a 51-year-old woman, who lives with her partner, has a 16-year-old son, and her business is selling plastic products.

She is a good mother, understanding, enterprising, dynamic, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is in the Callampaya zone, an area where there there is the station for the red funicular. From the heights, one can appreciate specific places such as the architecture of the historic general cemetery or the standstill of cars in the middle of a split in one of the routes that connect El Alto and La Paz.

Adela has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair, is short, has a thin physique, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver and with her son who is a student at school and who helps her in her sales. They live in their own house built of brick and cement, with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is selling plastic products such as buckets, chairs, jars, glasses, baskets, trash cans, and more. "I have worked with plastics for 5 years, I do my work alone and I need to update my merchandise constantly..."

The advantage of her business is that she has daily customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase new merchandise. Her dream is to improve her business, she wants to purchase plastic goods for the home. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has done this work.

For these reasons, Adela asks for a loan to purchase plastic products for her business and, so, to send her son to school.

loans.use: to purchase plastic goods for her business and, so, to send her child to school.

loans.name: Erika Jenny

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la peluquería y cosmetología.
Ella es amigable, encantadora, precavida y confiada en sí misma. Sus características físicas son; tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, físico delgada, su lengua es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su madre que trabaja independientemente, viven en alquiler en casa de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella realiza cortes, peinados, tintes y maquillaje para fiestas, bodas, cumpleaños, y todo evento, “en el mundo de la cosmetología no hay límites a las posibilidades para trabajar en todo el mundo...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de equipos de trabajo como, tijeras, peines, cepillos, secadoras, y otros. Su sueño es lograr instalar un salón de belleza grande, ella desea realizar la compra de instrumentos de peluquería para ampliar los servicios de su salón de belleza y mejorar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de instrumentos de peluquería para ampliar los servicios de su salón de belleza y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Erika is a 31-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is a hair salon and cosmetology.

She is friendly, charming, prudent, and self-confident. Her physical characteristics are: dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair, she is short, has a thin physique, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her mother who works independently. They live in a rented house of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a concrete floor which has running water, electricity and sewer services. She does haircuts, styles, dyes, and makeup for parties, weddings, birthdays and all events. "In the world of cosmetology, there are no limits to the possibilities to work everywhere..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it has continuous customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase work equipment such as scissors, combs, brushes, dryers, and more. Her dream is to be able to set up a large beauty salon, she wants to purchase hair salon equipment to expand the services of her beauty salon and improve her business. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years she has done this work.

For these reasons, Erika asks for a loan to purchase hair salon equipment to expand the services of her beauty salon and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair salon equipment to expand her beauty salon services and improve her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old. She is an honest, sensible, charismatic, and hard-working woman. She is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. 

She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kericho, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Jane is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and she grows maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. 

Jane has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: “I have to do something for my family."

Jane joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Jane is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) that require timely delivery to the market. 

This loan will help Jane to achieve her dream and reach her goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Jane feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Jane will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. 

Jane is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Jane will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future. You can be part of this dream. Be inspired and support the life of this super incredible woman with a loan!

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Gregoria Catalina

texts.es:
Gregoria es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 24 años, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas y lácteos en su kiosco.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘el prado’ caracterizada por albergar a edificios públicos y privados, donde existe un gran movimiento comercial y social. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Gregoria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en el transporte y con su hijo que estudia y trabaja, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de electrodomésticos, pudo vender toda su mercadería y comprar un kiosco en el centro de la ciudad. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y lácteos en su kiosco como; gaseosas, refrescos, agua embotellada, dulces, papas fritas, maní, chocolates, galletas, etc. “anteriormente vendía dulces de forma ambulante y también vendía electrodomésticos, cansada de transportar cajas pesadas cambie de actividad y ahora tengo mi kiosco propio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra bien ubicado y las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería surtida para su kiosco. Su sueño es mejorar su capital de trabajo, ella desea realizar la compra de mercadería surtida para abastecer su kiosco y poder trabajar. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gregoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de golosinas y refrescos para abastecer su kiosco y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 40-year-old woman, married, has a 24-year-old son, and her business is selling candies and dairy products in her kiosk.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, reliable, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is in the El Prado zone, characterized by housing public and private businesses, where there is a lot of commercial and social movement. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Gregoria has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she wears braided, is short, has a thin physique, she dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará which she speaks locally and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her husband who works in transportation and with her son who goes to school and works. They live in their own room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Previously, she worked selling household appliances, she was able to sell all of her merchandise and purchase a kiosk in the center of the city. Her business is selling candies and dairy products in her kiosk such as soft drinks, bottled water, candies, french fries, peanuts, chocolates, cookies, etc. "Before, I sold sweets as a street vendor and I also sold household appliances. Tired from carrying heavy boxes, I changed my business and now I have my own kiosk..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that it is well-situated and the sales are constant, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase an assortment of merchandise to stock her kiosk and be able to work. This is her 2nd loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year she has done this work.

For these reasons, Gergoria asks for a loan to purchase candies and soft drinks to stock her kiosk and continue working.

loans.use: to purchase candies and soft drinks to stock her kiosk and continue working.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Farming is the mainstay of Lelan’s economy, where Janet hails from. Dairy, poultry and crop farming produces food and provides a basis for income generation and employment for Janet. However, the potential of her business is not fully realized because Janet still uses traditional tools for crop production, which results in low productivity of land and labor. Low agricultural productivity also contributes to poor health and poverty.

Janet is seeking a loan to buy low-cost, manually operated farm implements that are modified to fit local needs. Your loan will arm Janet with the appropriate tools required to improve agricultural productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Speaking with Priscila, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing.

She lives in a humble home in the town of Lelan, along with a handsome husband and their seven angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

She has been doing agriculture for 36 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity.

Priscila is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Priscila and her family.

Like Priscila, thousands of entrepreneurs are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: To buy farm implements such as fertilizers and good quality seeds

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de productos friales como pollo y embutidos.
Ella es inteligente, independiente, paciente, constante, activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘San Luis’ que se urbaniza a partir del año 1940, al transcurrir los años se va poblando por migrantes del campo que se reubican al no encontrar espacio para habitar en la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Mabel es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su padre que trabaja independientemente, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de productos de frial como pollo y embutidos de todo tipo “empecé este negocio trabajando con mi papá que tenía experiencia en el rubro, tuve que dejar mis estudios para trabajar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería como; pollo, jamón, fiambres, salchichas, chorizo y otros. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y poder estudiar, ella desea realizar la compra de fiambres y embutidos para abastecer su frial y mejorar sus ventas para poder estudiar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de fiambres y embutidos para abastecer su frial y mejorar sus ventas para poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Mabel is a 22-year-old young woman, single, with no children, and her business is selling meat products such as chicken and cold cuts.

Ella is intelligent, independent, patient, reliable, active, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the San Luis zone which became urban after the year 1940; over the years, it has been populated by migrants from the countryside who relocated since they couldn't find a place to live in the city. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Mabel has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair, is short, has an average physique, her native language is Aymará which she speaks locally, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her father who works independently, they live in their own house built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has drinking water, electricity, gas and sewer services. Her business is selling meat products such as chicken and all sorts of cold cuts. "I began this business working with my dad, who had experience in the field. I had to leave school to work..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase the merchandise such as chicken, ham, cold cuts, sausages, chorizo, and more. Her dream is to expand her business to increase her income and to be able to go to school. She wants to purchase lunch meats and cold cuts to stock her meat shop and to improve her sales to be able to go to school. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year that she has done this work.

For these reasons, Mabel asks for a loan to purchase cold cuts and lunch meats to stock her meat shop and improve her sales to be able to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase cold cuts and lunch meat to stock her meat shop and improve her sales to be able to go to school.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao est un homme marié âgée de 34 ans qui habite à Adidogomé. Père de quatre enfants, Yao est un marchand des céréales qu’il achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de sa maison pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des bols de riz et des sacs de maïs, Yao nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao, age 34, is married with four children and he lives in Adidogomé. He makes a living selling cereals that he purchases twice a month at the market to sell in front of his house.

Yao is seeking this loan to buy bowlfuls of rice and sacks of maize. This credit will allow him to replenish his stock and earn substantial profits to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy 80 bowls of rice and 5 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Flabia Pasesa

texts.es:
Flabia es una mujer de 41 años de edad, viuda, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 14 y 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa adela’ caracterizada por conectar a diferentes sitios de la ciudad mediante cruces y caminos, desde este lugar se puede conseguir transporte público a los lugares más alejados de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
