Flabia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; pique macho (papas fritas, con carne picada y ají), lechón (carne de cerdo cocinada al horno), bistec (carne con arroz y papas), sajta de pollo (pollo picante, con chuño), y otros “inicie mi actividad trabajando para mi tía, luego me independicé y ya son 5 años que soy dueña de mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina broastera (sirve para cocinar pollo a la broaster) e insumos de cocina como; aceite, arroz, carne, papa, chuño, etc. Su sueño es mejorar los ingresos de su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina broastera e insumos de cocina. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Flabia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina broastera e insumos de cocina para ofertar nuevas comidas.
texts.en:
Flabia is a 41-year-old woman, a widow, who has 3 children, ages 1, 14, and 17, and her business is selling food.

She is a good mother, strong, determined, generous, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is in the Cruce Villa Adela zone, characterized by connecting the different places of the city through intersections and roads. From this place, one can get public transportation to the farthest parts of the city. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Flabia has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she wears braided, is short, has a thin physique, dresses traditionally (hat, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará which she speaks locally and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the business she does. She shares her life with her children, the older ones go to school and the youngest is not school-aged yet. They live in their own room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has running water, electricity, and sewer services. Her business is selling traditional dishes such as pique macho (French fries with chopped meat and chili), lechón (baked pork), bistec (meat with rice and potatoes), sajta de pollo (spicy chicken with freeze-dried potatoes) and more. "I began my business working with my aunt, later I became independent and it is now 5 years that I have been the owner of my business...." she says.

The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a rotisserie machine (to cook the chicken rotisserie-style) and cooking supplies such as oil, rice, meat, potatoes, freeze-dried potatoes, etc. Her dream is to increase her business's income, she wants to purchase a rotisserie machine and cooking supplies. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Flabia asks for a loan to purchase a rotisserie machine and cooking supplies to offer new dishes.

loans.use: to purchase a rotisserie machine and kitchen supplies to sell new foods.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
Porfiria continúa con su negocio de confección de sombreros. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de tela. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas en su negocio. Actualmente su negocio se estabiliza cuenta con ventas constantes porque los sombreros que confecciona están de moda; el sombrero de ‘chola’ es parte de la indumentaria de la mujer de vestir tradicional, elaborados con fibra de la hierba del esparto (vegetal) y coloreada con el tinte del albayalde (mezcla de carbonato de plomo), “no importa si el sombrero es de copa alta o baja, lo importante es lucirlo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su mercadería está de moda, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de tela. Su sueño es vestir a grupos de baile, ella desea realizar la compra de cortes de tela para confeccionar sombreros y venderlos por mayor. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Porfiria solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela para confeccionar sombreros de cholita a la moda.
texts.en:
Porfiria is continuing with her business making hats. The previous loan was invested into buying fabric. Her loan payments were punctual because she did not have any problems in her business. Now her business is stable and has consistent sales because the hats that she makes are in style. The "chola" sombrero is part of the traditional dress that women wear. They are made with a fibre from the Esparto plant (vegetable) and colored with the dye from the white lead (mixture of lead carbonate).

"It is not important if the hat is tall or short, what matters is how it looks..." she says. The advantage of her business is that her merchandise is in style, and the disadvantage is the lack of money to buy fabric.

Her dream is to dress dance groups. She wants to buy cuts of fabric to make hats and sell them at wholesale prices. This is the 3rd loan sequence she has made with the institution in the 5 years that she has had this job.

It is for these reasons that Porfiria is asking for a loan to buy cuts of fabric to make fashionable Cholita hats.

loans.use: to buy cuts of fabric to make fashionable Cholita hats.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 52 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hija de 33 años, y su negocio es la venta de  peluches y juguetes de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, amable, optimista, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ donde existen fábricas, un bar en cada esquina, el mercado popular asentado en las calles, varios negocios de materiales de construcción, una zona muy comercial. De clima frio y seco con fuertes vientos que provienen de la cordillera.
Juana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que trabaja en el mismo negocio, Viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de  peluches y juguetes de segunda mano, estos los compra por mayor y pueden incluir: Peluches, Juguete duros como, Carros, bicicletas, motos patines a batería, Carritos a control remoto, Camiones, muñecas y figuras de acción, juegos de mesa y rompecabezas, bloques para construir, juguetes para montar, instrumentos musicales, electrónicos, y Juguetes de Fisher Price para bebes, Caminadores, coches con dos funciones, columpios, ejercitadores, etc. “es nuestra prioridad alcanzar la absoluta satisfacción de nuestros clientes convirtiéndonos en su proveedor predilecto enfocado a la venta de juguetes de segunda mano de calidad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de juguetes por mayor. Su sueño es establecerse en el mercado, ella desea realizar la compra de juguetes por mayor para trabajar con su hija. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes de segunda mano por mayor para trabajar con su hija.
texts.en:
Juana is a 52-year-old woman, single, who has a 33-year-old daughter, and her business is selling second-hand stuffed animals and toys. She is a good mother, friendly, optimistic, generous, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the Villa Fátima zone where there are factories, a bar on every corner, a popular market in the streets, and various businesses of construction materials; it is a very commercial zone. It has a cold and dry climate with strong winds that come from the mountains.

Juana has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps braided, is short, has an average physique, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her daughter who works in the same business. They live in a house owned by family, built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting which has electricity, drinking water, and sewer services. Her business is selling second-hand dolls and toys, these she purchases in bulk and can include stuffed animals, hard toys such as cars, bicycles, battery-operated scooters, remote-control cars, trucks, dolls, action figures, board games, and puzzles, building blocks, riding toys, musical instruments, electronics, Fisher Price toys for babies, walkers strollers with two functions, swings, exercisers, etc. "Our priority is to achieve the absolute satisfaction of our customers, making us their favorite supplier focused on quality second-hand toys..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that it has continuous customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase toys in bulk. Her dreams is to establish herself in the market, she wants to purchase toys in bulk to work with her daughter. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has been doing this work independently.

For these reasons, Juana asks for a loan to purchase second-hand toys in bulk to work with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand toys in bulk to work with her daughter.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis vive en una comunidad de Trujillo en Honduras, tiene 36 años y desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica a la cría de cerdos junto con su esposo, es una mujer muy emprendedora, razón por la cual con esfuerzo propio ahora tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende alimentos  y otros productos de consumo general, con el fin de ampliar su negocio ha incorporado  la venta  de lácteos, carnes, refrescos, hielo y otros productos que necesitan refrigeración. Pero actualmente tiene una limitante, ya que en la zona donde vive Gladis y su familia no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, debido a esto tiene que abastecerse y tener en refrigeración estos productos en hieleras, lo cual le genera un alto costo ya que tiene que comprar hielo a diario lo  que se ve reflejado en sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que Gladis está solicitando este préstamo a Soluz Honduras para obtener un sistema  de Frezeer solar, que le ayudara a poder atender de mejor manera a sus clientes y sobretodo ya no gastara en la compra de  hielo y no tendrá que  recorrer grandes distancias para obtenerlo  y de esta manera su negocio aumentara sus ganancias  y sus clientes estarán satisfechos.
texts.en: Gladis lives in a community of Trujillo in Honduras. She is 36 years old and for more than 15 years, she has worked raising pigs with her husband. She is a very enterprising woman, so, with her own effort she now has a small business selling food and other products for general consumption. With the end of expanding her business, she has included the sale of dairy products, meat, soft drinks, ice, and other products which need refrigeration. But, currently, there is a limitation which is in the zone where Gladis and her family live, there isn't access to electricity. Due to this, she has to stock up and refrigerate these products in coolers, which generates a high cost since she has to purchase ice daily, which is reflected in her earnings. For this reason, Gladis is asking for this loan from Soluz Honduras to purchase a solar-powered freezer, which will help her to serve her customers better and, above all, she no longer will spend money on the purchase of ice and won't have to travel great distances to get it, and in this way her business will increase in earnings and her customers will be satisfied.

loans.use: to purchase a solar-powered freezer which will help her to serve her customers better and will increase the earnings of her business.

loans.name: Luis Emmanuel

texts.es:
Luis Emmnauel es un joven estudiante de Licenciatura en Administracion de empresas, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Luis Emmanuel, vivo en San Pedro de Macorís, Rep. Dom. Tengo 25 años de edad y vivo con mis padres y dos hermanas. Mi madre no labora, solo mi padre en una empresa, agropecuaria donde se gana la vida como Asistente y con sus ingresos nos ayuda.
Inicie la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la UASD, porque es una carrera que me gusta mucho elegí, esta universidad ya que es para personas de escasos recursos, pero necesito un dinero para soporte, compras de libros, transporte y sostenimiento ya que queda en otra ciudad y debo estar viajando.
Mi familia no tiene muchos recursos ya que como mencioné anteriormente mi padre es el único que trabaja, por ello puede pagarme solo la matricula pero necesito de ayuda extra porque  el  mismo no puede más. Po este motivo estoy solicitando un préstamo con  ustedes porque si no tengo  esta ayuda no podré seguir estudiando.
Si me aprueban este préstamo, voy a dar lo mejor de mí para graduarme en la fecha que corresponde con honores, podre trabajar en una buena empresa para ayudar a mis padres y a mis hermanas, además tratare de dar lo mejor de mí siempre y aportar cosas positivas para mi país al ser un joven con visión y pensamientos positivos de mejoras que es lo que necesita nuestra sociedad hoy en día, personas con deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Luis Emmanuel is a young Business Administration student. He is asking for a loan to be able to cover his higher education costs. This is his story:

"My name is Luis Emmanuel. I live in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. I am 25 years old and I live with my parents and two sisters. My mother does not work, just my father in an agricultural business where he has made a living as an assistant and he helps us with his earnings. I began my career in Business Administration in the UASD because it is a career that I really like. I chose this university because it is for people with limited resources, but I need some money for support, to buy books, transport and food. As I said before, my father is the only one who works, so he can pay for my enrollment but I need extra help because he can not give any more. For that reason, I am asking for a loan from you guys because if I do not have this help, I will not be able to continue studying. If you approve this loan, I am going to give it my best to graduate on the date that corresponds with honors. I will be able to work in a good company to help my parents and my sisters. Furthermore, I will try to always give my all and bring positive things to my country, being a young person with vision and positive thoughts of improvements which is what our society needs nowadays, people with the desire to excel."

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Poline

texts.en:
Introducing Poline, who is a tireless worker who works seven days a week, 12 hours per day. This is all because she wants to achieve her dream of giving her children a good education. Poline is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Chuka area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya.

Poline has been farming for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been bananas, milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet.

Poline is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Chuka area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Poline could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Poline, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Poline believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Poline to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Like Poline, many entrepreneurs await for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Azangounoss

texts.fr: Veuve de 53 ans, Azangounoss est une femme habitant à Tokoin avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Azangounoss est une femme dynamique et cherchant l’épanouissement de sa famille, vend des tissus et pagnes au marché où elle s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois. Azangounoss sollicite ce prêt pour commander des tissus pour pantalons et pour chemises afin d’épargner et  promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et  agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Azangounoss is a 53-year-old widow who lives in Tokoin with her four dependent children. She is a dynamic woman whose goal is to see her family thrive. She sells fabrics and pagnes at the market where she restocks four times per month.

Azangounoss is seeking this loan to order shirt and trouser fabrics. She wants to save in order to support her children's education and expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy 12 pant fabrics and 15 shirt fabrics.

loans.name: Armando John

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre de 48 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen un hijo de 6 años y una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es el servicio de internet.
Él es inteligente, emprendedor, culto, cómico, divertido, seguro y equilibrado. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘tacagua’ que se encuentra ubicada en la ladera oeste de la ciudad,  a una altura de 3890 metros sobre el nivel del mar, posee calles peatonales de y vehiculares. La zona no cuenta con líneas de transporte público, por no tener calles vehiculares a disposición. 
Armando es de tez morena, ojos obscuros, cabello gris, baja estatura, físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que estudia y trabaja y con sus hijos, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de café internet; en una habitación de su casa, armó un cibercafé que atiende todos los días de la semana “inicie hace un par de años, atiendo todos los días y no tengo competencia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de más equipos. Su sueño es comprar más equipos de computación, el desea comprar muebles para computadora. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Armando solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de computación para su cibercafé.
texts.en:
Armando is a 48 year old man. He lives with his partner. They have a 6 year old son and a 3 year old daughter. He has an Internet business. He is intelligent, enterprising, educated, humorous, entertaining, confident, and fair.

His business is done in the Tacagua area located on the west side of the city at 3890 meters above sea level. It has streets for pedestrians and for vehicles. The area does not have public transportation having no appropriate roadways.

Armando has a dark complexion, dark eyes, and gray hair. He is short and thin. His mother tongue is Aymará and he speaks Spanish. He spends his life with his wife who works and studies, and with his children. They live in a house they own made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. They have drinking water, electricity, and a sewage system.

He has an Internet cafe business in a room at his home. He started a cyber cafe that is open every day of the week. “I began a couple of years ago, opening every day and I have no competition.” he comments.

The advantage of his business is that he does not have competition. The disadvantage is the lack of capital in order to buy more equipment. His dream is to buy more computer equipment.

He wants to buy furniture for the computers and this is the first loan cycle with the institution since he started this activity. These are the reasons that Armando is applying for a loan to buy computer furniture for his cyber cafe.

loans.use: to buy computer furniture for his cyber cafe.

loans.name: Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Zaida es una mujer de 43 años de edad, separada, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 24 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. 
Ella es buena madre, amable, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en el sur de la ciudad, donde la gente se caracteriza por ser alegre, confiada, amable, hospitalaria y cooperadora. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados. 
Zaida es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo castaño lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la derecha, viste compra roja). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos, el mayor estudia y trabaja y el menor estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, taller de llaves, artesanía en yeso, elaboración de sombreros de sao, venta de medicina natural, confección de tejidos, tienda general y venta de comida tradicional, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas; Natura, l’bel, yanbal y otros, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante durante la semana completa, en diferentes ferias y comercios de la ciudad. Los productos con mayor demanda son; aretes, lápiz labial, cremas anti edad, tratamientos faciales, perfumes, mascara para pestañas, etc. “Un buen labial, eso nunca nos debe faltar, si es en la gama de los rosas/fucsias muchísimo mejor, con él podemos ir por la vida escuchando la música de LMFAO de fondo jajaja…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a pedido, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar productos por mayor. Su sueño es mejorar sus ventas para el bien de su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Zaida solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad y con los beneficios abrir un negocio de bisutería.
texts.en:
Zaida is 43 years old, separated, and has two children who are 12 and 24 years old. Her business is selling cosmetics and jewelry from a catalog. She is a good mother, friendly, optimistic, responsible, and very hard working. She is a mobile vendor in the southern part of the city, where the people are cheerful, confident, friendly, hospitable, and helpful. They enjoy a warm, sub-tropical climate with temperatures that range between 21-35 degrees C (70-95 F) during the day.

Zaida has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long brown hair that she wears tied back. She is short with a robust physique. Her native language is Guarani, and she speaks Spanish for general purposes and for carrying out her business. (She is the second from the right, seen wearing a red jacket.) She shares her life with her children. The older of the two studies and works, and the younger studies in school. They live in their own home made of wood, with a corrugated metal roof and a cement floor. It has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Her desire to succeed prompted Zaida to lead a community bank of people so that they could request a loan to improve their businesses, which include selling second-hand clothing, a key-making shop, creating plaster crafts, making straw hats, selling natural medicine, weaving, a general store, and selling traditional foods. Zaida is a mobile vendor of cosmetics and jewelry that she sells through a catalog, with brands like Natura, L'bel, Yanbal, and others. She does this throughout the entire week, traveling to different markets and businesses in the city. The products in greatest demand are earrings, lipstick, anti-aging creams, facial treatments, perfume, mascara, etc. "We should never go without a good lipstick, so much the better if it's in the pink/fuchsia range. With that, we can go through life hearing the music of LMFAO in the background, haha..." she says. The advantage of her business is that her sales are by request. Her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy cosmetics and jewelry at wholesale. Her dream is to improve her sales for the well-being of her family. She wants to buy a stock of seasonal cosmetics at wholesale in order to satisfy the demands of her customers and improve her family's quality of life. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution since she started this business four years ago.

For the reasons mentioned, Zaida is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry at wholesale so that she can offer a greater variety of products and, with her profits, open a jewelry shop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry at wholesale so that she can offer a greater variety of products and, with her profits, open a jewelry shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Farming is the mainstay of Lelan’s economy, where Lydia, a single mother of one, lives.

Lydia does dairy, poultry, sheep and potato farming. The food she produces provides a basis for income generation and employment for Lydia. However, the potential of Lydia's farm is not fully realized because she still uses traditional tools for crop production, which results in low productivity of land and labour. Low agricultural productivity also contributes to poor health and poverty.

Lydia is seeking a loan to buy low-cost manually operated farm implements that are modified to fit local needs. Your loan will help supply Lydia with the appropriate tools required to improve agricultural productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy low-cost manually operated farm implements.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Farming is the mainstay of Lelan’s economy, where Evelyn, a married mother of six, lives. Dairy, poultry, sheep and crop farming produce food and provide a basis for income generation and employment for Evelyn.

However, the potential of agriculture for food and income generation is not fully realized because Evelyn still uses traditional tools for crop production, which results in low productivity of land and labour. Low agricultural productivity also contributes to poor health and poverty.

Evelyn is seeking a loan to buy low-cost manually operated farm implements that are modified to fit local needs. Your loan will help supply Evelyn with the appropriate tools required to improve agricultural productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy low-cost manually operated farm implements.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Jane is a smiling and proud rural smallholder farmer who lives in the Chuka area of Kenya, an area full of hard-working and honest people. Jane, with her mixed farm, generates the income to sustain her family. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking kindly for a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. Jane's upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Jane has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Jane is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

Come on lenders! Support this smallholder farmer who today needs you to be able to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Rene Andres

texts.es:
Rene es un hombre de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 7 años, y su negocio es la chapería y pintura de vehículos.
Él es buen padre, creativo, honesto, sincero, seguro de sí mismo, de buen sentido del humor y sociable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Metropolitana’ que es un punto de acopio de frutas y verduras, donde se inician los procesos de comercialización al detalle para llevar los alimentos a todos los lugares donde acuden los consumidores finales. 
Rene es moreno, de ojos negros, cabello corto, baja estatura, su idioma materno es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en el comercio y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la chapa y pintura de automóviles, él se encarga de pintar y eliminar rayones o golpes en la carrocería de los autos, “contrato ayudante para abastecer las necesidades del taller…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar herramientas. Su sueño es mejorar su taller, el desea realizar la compra de  una máquina compresora y un arco de oxígeno. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica a esta a actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rene solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina compresora y un arco de oxígeno para su taller de chapa y pintura.
texts.en:
René, 36, lives with his partner and has a seven-year-old son. He's creative, honest, sincere, and sure of himself. He has a good sense of humor and is a good father.

His business is body work and painting vehicles. He works in the Metropolitana area, where fruits and vegetables are stored and the sales process is initiated for taking the food to all the places where consumers go to buy them.

René is short and dark and has black eyes and short hair. His native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his partner, a merchant, and his son, a student. They live in their own home, built of brick and cement with a metal roof; they have electricity but no drinking water or gas.

His business is body work and painting automobiles. He paints and eliminates scratches and dents on the body of cars. "I hire a helper to satisfy the needs of my shop," he said. The advantage of his business is that he has customers; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy tools. His dream is to improve his shop.

For these reasons René wants to buy a compressing machine and a welding arc and oxygen for his body shop. This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the seven years he has been in this line of work.

loans.use: to buy a compressing machine and an arc welder and oxygen for his body shop

loans.name: Lucas

texts.pt:
O cliente Lucas de 29 anos de idade, casado, comerciante, possui um estaleiro de venda de blocos, pai de 1 filho ainda sem idade escolar, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, cimento para reforçar seu negócio de fabrico e venda de blocos.
O cliente tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, melhorar as condições da sua casa e futuramente comprar um carro para lhe facilitar no seu negocio
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e a falta de meio para fazer entrega dos seus produtos tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Lucas is 29 years old and married. He is a businessman and owns a builders yard where he sells bricks. He is the father of a child, who is of school age. He owns the house where he lives.

With the requested amount he is planning to buy cement to strengthen his business of producing and selling bricks.

His dream is to expand his business in order to fulfill his customers’ needs, improve his home, and in the future buy a vehicle for his business.

His main challenges are the lack of funding and not having the means to distribute his products. He has continued working and is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement to strengthen his business of producing and selling bricks.

loans.name: Gemima

texts.en:
Gemima is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemima is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Gemima has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gemima requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Gemima has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Gemima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Dolores has been in this business for 53 years. Dolores earns more income from pillow-making.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Warnita

texts.en:
Warnita works hard to support her family. Warnita is widowed and has a food and refreshment vending business in the Philippines.

Warnita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar and mixed fruit etc. for her business.

Warnita has been in this business for 18 years now.

Warnita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar and mixed fruit for her business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth, 35, is a married woman with one child who is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maribeth has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell.

Maribeth has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is married and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now. She works hard to support her family. 

Luciana has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional materials like alcohol, nail polish, nail cutters, etc. for her business.

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr: Amina est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de quatre  enfants. Amina  habite le quartier d’Adidogomé. Amina  fait le commerce général et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Amina sollicite ce crédit pour acheter du savon et des détergents ; ceci lui permettra d’augmenter les revenus de son commerce et pour participer au mieux aux charges de la famille et augmenter son commerce.
texts.en: Amina is 38 years old and married and lives with her four children in the Adidogomé neighbourhood. She sells general foodstuffs and gets her supplies twice monthly from market. Amina is requesting this loan to purchase soap and detergent. This will allow her to increase her working capital and grow her business, as well as give her the mean to better look after her family.

loans.use: to purchase 15 boxes of soap and nine bags of detergent

loans.name: Poline

texts.en:
Poline is a 43- year-old married woman who is hardworking and humble. She is mother to two young children whom she adores with all her heart.

Poline wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. She resides in the Chuka area of Kenya, which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. Poline’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet.

Poline has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Chuka area has conditions that favor dairy farming. Poline has always wanted to take care of a dairy goat but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy a dairy goat. The dairy goat she intends to buy is not just an ordinary goat. It’s a breed that produces many liters of milk a day. With this goat, she will produce more milk, which will translate to more income.

Demand for dairy goat milk in the Chuka area is high but the supply is low. So through this loan, Poline is going to have more milk and comfortably meet the demand. Her increased income will allow Poline to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy goats. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Kerstine

texts.en:
Kerstine, 41, is a loving mom and a hardworking farmer, committed to building a better life for her family. Kerstine is a go-getter and she hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a rural town on the slopes of the famous Mount Kenya. She and her husband support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 15 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been easy. She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. Kerstine’s upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Kerstine has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Kerstine is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 32 years old and has three children. Francisca is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Francisca is in the agricultural business; pig fattening in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Francisca has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia works hard to support her family. Herminia is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

Herminia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Herminia has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Herminia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny, 35, is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.

Jenny is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenny has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs to improve productivity on her farm.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a thriving and honest 51-year-old mother. She discovered that being a smallholder farmer gave her a way out of her economic problems, because it is very difficult to find work in the Kapsowar area of Kenya.

Regina has defied the common thinking of many Kenyans that agriculture is not a profitable venture. Regina is a lovely mother who has been farming for the last 10 years to supplement her income from the small business she does. Regina does crop farming and cattle raising and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are animal diseases and the lack of finances to improve her farming.

Regina is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase sheep. Her projections are that, by the end of the year, these sheep will have given birth to at least four lambs. Through sheep-raising, she will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches good profits. This translates into more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and to grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 30 years now.

Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonarda ella es soltera y tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Señor de Huanca communal bank. This bank is located in the Anta district, belonging to the Anta province in the department of Cusco.

The borrower Leonarda is single, 32 years old, and has 2 children. She has a crafts business selling woven fabrics, sweaters, blankets, looms, and all types of weavings. She works from 8:00 in the morning until 7:00 pm and already has 8 years experience in the business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand the business selling more weavings and looms.

She is asking for a loan to buy woven fabrics, sweaters, and looms. The other members work in the businesses of selling animals, clothing sales, grocery store, and food sales. The borrower is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy woven fabrics, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional products from Avon like deodorant, body spray, lipsticks, lotion, etc., to sell to her customers for her direct selling of Avon products business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Avon like deodorant, body spray, lipsticks, lotion, etc., to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Luis, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, actualmente está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tienen un niño de 3 años de edad.

Luis, se dedica a trabajar como agricultor y jornalero, durante la mañana trabaja en una cooperativa, sus funciones son fumigar y limpiar el cultivo de café, tiene que presentarse a trabajar a las 5:30 a.m. es por ello que sale de su casa a las 5:00 a.m. porque a esa hora pasa el vehículo recogiéndolo, para llevarlo a su lugar de trabajo, el trabajo termina a las 12:00 del mediodía, después de llegar a su casa y descansar un momento, tiene que realizar sus propios cultivos.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, plaguicidas y herbicidas para aplicarlos a sus cultivos, de esa manera asegurará una buena cosecha de granos para la alimentación de su familia.

El desea poder construir su casa de ladrillo, porque en donde actualmente vive es una casa muy humilde, de paredes de bambú y no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos; él desea darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y que crezca en un ambiente más higiénico.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old and studied until the third grade. He currently has a partner who takes care of the house and with whom he has a three year old son.

Luis makes a living as a farmer and day laborer. In the mornings he works at a cooperative. He is responsible for fumigating and cleaning the coffee plants and must be at work by 5:30 am. Luis leaves home at 5 am, when he is picked up by a car that takes him to work, and works until noon. After he returns home, he rests for a bit and attends to his own crops. Luis needs the loan to purchase pesticides and herbicides for his crops in order to ensure a good grain harvest with which to feed his family. He would like to build a brick house, as his current house is very modest—it only has bamboo walls and lacks some basic services. Luis would like to provide his son with a better quality of life and enable him to grow in a more sanitary environment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 54 years old and married with six children.

Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Estelita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Estelita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maribel is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maribel has a buying and selling of frozen foods business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Maribel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla is 43 years old and has three children. Rosavilla is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

Rosavilla is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosavilla requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosavilla has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosavilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evangeline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evangeline has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, meat, fish, vegetables, etc., for her food production business. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, meat, fish, vegetables, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more products like lotion, cologne, cosmetics, bags, deodorant, etc. to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for five years. Maribel earns more income from raising pigs.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products like lotion, cologne, cosmetics, bags, deodorant, etc. to sell

loans.name: Geraldin

texts.en:
Geraldin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. Geraldin has been in this business for one year now.

Geraldin requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. Geraldin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Rufina has been in this business for five years. Rufina earns more income from food vending.

Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pamela Lizet

texts.es: Pamela tiene 21 años de edad es soltera. Ella es una joven estudiante de la especialidad de estomatología. Ella eligió estudiar dicha carrera ya que al culminar sus estudios tiene como finalidad trabajar de manera independiente. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de equipos que necesita para el nuevo ciclo que está iniciando. Ella se siente muy contenta que le falta poco para culminar sus estudios. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Pamela is 21 years old and single. She is a young student specializing in stomatology. Pamela chose this career because it will enable her to work independently after she finishes her studies. She plans to invest her loan on equipment that she needs for the new school year that is just beginning. Pamela is very glad that she will soon be finished with her studies. She thanks Kiva investors for the loan awarded.

loans.use: to purchase equipment.

loans.name: David Romulo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MOSOC KILLA,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio David alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su profesión, el socio es ingeniero civil, el socio trabaja en distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, el socio leva buen tiempo en su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de eta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de unas maquinarias.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuota establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the Mosoc Killa communal bank, which is located in Cuzco province. David alternates his daily activities as he conducts his job; he is a civil engineer and works at various sites where his services are needed. David has been working for some time in this position thanks to his day-to-day dedication. This is how he provides for his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase some machinery. David is grateful for the loan awarded and is committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase machinery.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 41 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items from Avon to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items from Avon to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 39 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cristita has a pig-raising business in the Philippines. Cristita requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cristita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Veraushika Alexandra

texts.es: Veraushika de 45 años es una empresaria independiente que identificó una oportunidad de negocio en el sector donde reside en el municipio de Cartagena; consideró que existía un gran nicho para los almacenes misceláneos, entonces tomo la iniciativa de adecuar un local comercial y surtirlo con artículos como ganchos, pulseras, cepillos, peinillas, papel de regalo y demás.  Así mismo se afilió a una empresa de ventas por catálogos especialistas en productos cosméticos, cuidado corporal y facial, prendas de vestir y calzado, para tener un surtido uniforme a las necesidades de los Cartageneros. Su éxito ha sido muy significativo, ella cuenta con 10 años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada, que diariamente visitan su local en el horario comprendido entre 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar nuevo surtido de variedades, cosméticos y prendas de vestir;  con esta inversión sus ventas se dinamizaran y con las utilidades les aportará un mejor bienestar a sus dos hijos, que dependen económicamente de ella, puesto que es madre soltera. Su meta a largo plazo es hacer más rentable su negocio y continuar educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Veraushika is 45 years old. She is an independent entrepreneur who identified a business opportunity in the area where she lives in Cartagena.

She considered that there was a niche for miscellaneous stores. Then she took the initiative to adapt a commercial facility and supplied it with articles such as hairpins, bracelets, brushes, combs, gift wrap and more. She also joined a catalog sales company specializing in cosmetics, body and facial care, clothing and shoes, in order to have a steady supply of necessities for the people of Cartagena.

Her success has been significant. She has been in business for ten years and has regular customers who visit the store daily during the hours between 9:00am until 5:00pm.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a new supply of items such as cosmetics and clothing. This investment will dynamize sales and the profits will provide a better wellbeing for her two children, who are economically dependent on her, as she is a single mother. Her long-term goal is to make her business more profitable and to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of supplies for her business including cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

Marilyn has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell for her buy-and-sell dry goods business such as curtains, pillow cases, blouses, etc.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell such as curtains, pillow cases, blouses, etc

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 47 years old and has one child. Nimfa is widowed and her child attends school.

Nimfa is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Nimfa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nimfa has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and she has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nimfa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Janet works hard to support her family.

Janet has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Janet is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Vecinos Unidos Group

texts.es:
la asociación Vecinos unidos esta conformado por ocho integrante madres y padres responsables de dies hijos, todos menores de edad, son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con gana de superación personal,  lamentablemente por falta de recursos economices no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad. 
gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Nereyda y tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. en la actualidad el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y por encargo a cliente fijos. EL objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra  de un lote de cerdos en pie para la crianza y venta. Vecinos Unidos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The Vecinos Unidos association is composed of eight members who are the responsible mothers and fathers of ten children, all minors. They are from Malpaisillo, in the northern part of the region, a place characterized by being hardworking, responsible, and having the will for self-improvement. Unfortunately, they did not have the financial resources to be able to study and instead had to work from an early age. Due to her motivation to get ahead, Nereyda serves as their coordinator. She buys and sells live pigs. Currently, she uses her home as her place of business and works on commission for steady clients. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing  one lot of live pigs for breeding and sale. Vecinos Unidos appreciates the help that Kiva investors provide to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to support dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase one lot of live pigs for breeding and sale.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 37 years old and has six children. Angela is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Angela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Angela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Angela has been raising livestock for four years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Erlin

texts.en:
Erlin is 56 years old and married with six children.

Erlin earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Erlin is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erlin has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from nipa roofing.

Erlin is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, candies, cereals, coffee, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for 2 years. Elisa earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, candies, cereals, coffee, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Arnie

texts.en:
Ma. Arnie is 28 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Ma. Arnie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Arnie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Arnie has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, breads, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Arnie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Febe is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Febe has a general store business in the Philippines. Febe requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Febe has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Febe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Teresa is 37 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Ma. Teresa has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 11 years. Ma. Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran mentions that he already has had success in his farming, thanks to Kiva lenders support and kindness. He hopes that his third Kiva loan will also be great and profitable for his farm, particularly for his bee keeping activities.

He and his wife live in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. He earns a living thanks to farming and honey production. On his farm, Tigran breeds cows, sheep, and chickens and he also has many beehives. From his farm, he manages to sell meat, eggs, and very pure and healing honey for which he has a lot of regular customers, who come from far away in order to buy his farm’s honey.

This loan of 400.000 Armenian drams Tigran will use for the purchase of several beehives and also he wants to buy some new tools for extracting honey from the combs.

loans.use: to buy several beehives and also he wants to buy some new tools for removal of the honey from the combs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a buy and sell traditional business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more bags to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more traditional bags to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 43 years old and married with seven children.

Violeta earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Violeta is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Violeta has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from farming bananas.

Violeta is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 41 years old and has three children. Ma. Luisa is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Luisa is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ma. Luisa has been raising livestock for five years now and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Avec six enfants à sa charge, Adjo est une veuve femme qui vit à Baguida pour exercer ses activités. Agée de 50 ans, Adjo est une marchande de toute catégorie de sacs. Adjo s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de sortie, de voyage et scolaire afin de gagner  une marge bénéficiaire assez élevée pour pouvoir couvrir les charges quotidiennes dont elle endosse vis-à-vis de ses enfants et améliorer leur vie éducative.
texts.en:
Adjo, age 50, is a widow with six dependent children. She lives in Baguida where she runs her activities. She sells a wide variety of bags, restocking four times per month at the market.

Adjo is seeking this loan to order dress bags, travel bags and school bags. She hopes to make enough profits to cover the day-to-day expenses of her household and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 6 dress bags, 5 travel bags and 6 school bags.

loans.name: Alsebia

texts.en:
Alsebia is 37 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alsebia has a business selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. Alsebia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business such as flower pots, fertilizers, etc.

Alsebia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Alsebia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business such as flower pots, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 44 years old and has two children. Ofelia is married and has two children who are in school.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ofelia has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a internet café business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.

Dionisia has been in this business for 15 years. Dionisia earns more income from selling purified drinking water.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dionisia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Marites has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

Marites has been in this business for 2 years. Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support her family. Marcelina is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Marcelina requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for 6 years now.

Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Rose is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mary Rose has a direct selling Avon and personal collection products business in the Philippines. Mary Rose requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products like, lotion, body spray, body soap, etc. to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like, lotion, body spray, body soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Alice who is a 46-year-old smallholder farmer from Kericho in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Alice owns a small parcel of land. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This loving mother keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables and has seven years of experience in farming.

Alice is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Alice. Through a group of 15 members called Simotwet Elite, Alice has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral.

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Alice because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.
Support the dream of Alice, be inspired, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Margaret. She is a 53-year-old mother and a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Margaret and her husband have been blessed with 6 children.

For 21 years, Margaret has been a mixed farmer. She grows maize, keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening.

She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.
Kindly consider lending to this honest and charming woman!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Xiomara De La Paz

texts.es:
Xiomara, solicita un nuevo financiamiento para realizar sus actividades agrícolas en la nueva temporada que se acerca, lo invertirá en 3 sacos de abono, insecticidas así como también en el pago de obreros para sembrar granos básicos, espera tener resultados positivos.
El crédito anterior lo invirtió en cerdos y en los cultivos de granos básicos, desafortunadamente, los cultivos se perdieron a causa de la falta de lluvia, sus condiciones familiares son las mismas, a pesar de las dificultades no pierde la ilusión de continuar trabajando para darles a sus hijos una vida más confortable.
texts.en: Xiomara is requesting a new loan to perform farming activities during the new season that is approaching. She will invest it in three bags of fertilizer and insecticide, as well as pay workers to plant basic grains, with which she hopes to achieve good results. Her previous loan was invested in pigs and in planting basic grain crops, but unfortunately the crops were lost due to a lack of rain. Her family situation remains the same. Despite her difficulties, she has not lost the hope to continue working to give her children a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to invest in three bags of fertilizer and insecticide, as well as pay workers to plant basic grains, with which she hopes to achieve good results.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jellin

texts.en:
Jellin is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jellin is 23 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jellin has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jellin requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jellin has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jellin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 59 years old. She is married with seven children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from plastic wares.

Veronica aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 56 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a 5000  PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as hot dogs, bread, spices, sugar and other materials for her food vending business.

Helen has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as hot dogs, bread, spices, sugar and other materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her general store.

Vilma dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.
