She has a rice milling in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling rice.

Magdalena dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for milling rice.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Elizabeth, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. For the past five years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Elizabeth says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her many cows. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 litres of milk a day, and this helps her support her family. Elizabeth also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. .

This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Elizabeth is very visionary. Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Elizabeth believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Elizabeth’s way out of poverty. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina's heart harbours a desire to become one of the greatest horticulture farmers. She is hardworking,honest, charismatic and cheerful, and has a very good sense of humour. These qualities have been her inspiration to work hard on her farm. With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Paulina has little time to make money to financially support her family. With the little time Paulina has left, she sells crops from the family's small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry.

Paulina is seeking a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by steadily rising exports. Although experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that people with small farms and poor farmers are included in the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Paulina access to a loan. This loan will assist her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Paulina’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of the family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seeds to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is 40 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her husband works in an office. She has a small cattle fattening project that she started three years ago in a place she prepared in her house to help her husband with the family income.

She is requesting 7000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 37 years old and married. Noeme has two children who are presently in school.

Noeme is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Noeme requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Noeme has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed five times from NWTF in the past to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pig for 8 years and also earns additional income from rice retailling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old, married, and has seven children, five of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a personal products retail business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Elizabeth requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more personal products to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 60 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melba has a general store business in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melba has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Melba would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
A smallholder farmer full of life, hard-working, and very humble -this is Rose. Rose is a mother of five lovely children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Rose hails from the Kitale area of Kenya.

Rose started farming and has been doing farming for the past twenty eight years. Throughout those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Rose practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

She is seeking a loan of KES 35,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Rose wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Rose to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Rose hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Rose's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Rose is not a selfish mum and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for him on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.
Her biggest dream is to give her children a good education and a comfortable life.
For this reason, she is turning to Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa, utiliza los créditos que le otorgan Padecomsm y Kiva para mejorar la venta de antojitos y gallinas, se siente satisfecha por los buenos resultados que le dan, manifiesta tener mejores ingresos con los que cubre necesidades básicas de su familia y logro hacer reparaciones importantes a su vivienda.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar papas, yuca, maíz, frijol, aceite, etc., para elaborar la venta de antojitos, el resto lo invertirá en gallinas, surtirá el inventario de su negocio para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Rosa has used the loans extended by Padecomsm and Kiva to enhance her sales of snacks and chickens. She is satisfied with the good results achieved, she says that she is earning better income with which she covers her family's basic needs. She's also been able to complete important home repairs.

She is applying again for a loan to buy potatoes, yucca, corn, beans, cooking oil, and more to make the snacks that she sells, and she will invest the rest in chickens. This way, Rosa will replenish her inventory to continue working.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, yucca, corn, beans, cooking oil, and more to make the snacks that she sells. She will invest the rest in chickens. She will replenish her inventory.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Jane, a smallholder farmer from the Lelan area of Kenya where farming is the mainstay of rural economy. Jane has been doing farming for 15 years to provide for his family, which consists of her, her husband and 5 children.

The challenge is that human labour is still the main source of power used in agricultural work in Lelan. In small-scale farms like Jane’s, human labor comes with high cost because the basic wage rate is high, and people are neither easy to manage nor as efficient as machines.

Jane is seeking a loan to buy new farm implements that will cut costs and improve efficiency, productivity and profitability of her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
A woman full of life, hard-working, and very humble - this is Elizabeth. She is aware that she must work hard to achieve the objectives of supporting her family. Elizabeth is a smallholder farmer from Kitale area in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. She owns a 1-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The kind mother keeps sheeps and grows varieties of crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming.

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Elizabeth. Through a group of 15 members called Shikulu, Elizabeth has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Elizabeth because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry. You can help Elizabeth with a loan that will change her life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret would be characterized by her neighbours and customers as an amiable, honest and charismatic woman. She is a country woman full of dreams and ambitions -- chiefly to improve her family's life through the sweat of her brow. This goal is why she went into the business of raising poultry and dairy cows, which is a common livelihood in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She has earned a reputation for her reasonable prices and the quality of the poultry and milk that she sells. To make ends meet and earn extra cash, she also has engaged in another small personal business.

The Kapsowar area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Margaret finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She says the most enjoyable part is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

Margaret lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, thus she is seeking a loan to buy poultry. As a woman, accessing funds is very challenging but, through institutions such as Juhudi, via Kiva, she feels relieved to know that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of this loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market. These sales will translate into increased profit margins and an improved income level. Margaret envisions accumulating more profits and increasing her poultry market to other markets. Doing so would further increase her income and improve her living conditions. She will use the extra income to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a small curtains and cloth project.

He is requesting 8000 EGP loan to buy a modern tailoring machine and some cloth to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a modern tailoring machine and some cloth.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. Loida has been in this business for two years, and she earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional household goods to sell in her general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is 42 years old and married with three children, two in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries to sell.

Lowela has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from vegetables vending.

She aspires to expand her business so she can save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en:
Rhea Mae is 28 years old and married with five children, three in school. Rhea Mae works very hard to provide for her family.

Rhea Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and personal care products.

Rhea Mae has been in this business for four years. 

She would like to save enough so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and  personal care products.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 36 years old and married with one child in school, Lorena works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, and soap.

Lorena has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 28-year-old mother with a total willingness to work. She hails from the Kenyenya area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for banana farming. Sarah has four children whom she adores and cherishes.

Sarah has been practicing mixed farming for the past fourteen years, and is making great strides. She has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling, and personal business. These ventures have enabled her to send her children to school and feed her family. Sarah needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance her farm’s productivity.

The main challenge she is facing is lack of financial products tailored for her kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, she is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva. Sarah is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Sarah acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. Income from this investment will help him to meet her obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as improved seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en:
Snooky is 28 years old and married with two children, both in school. Snooky works very hard to provide for her family.

Snooky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and personal care products.

Snooky has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and personal care products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single diligent Kenyan farmer from Lelan who is blessed with four children.. Fourteen years ago, Susan decided to start farming. Her parents was supportive and they even allowed her to use their 2 acres of land as capital. Today, she has achieved great milestones in terms of diversifying from vegetable farming by introducing farm animals such as dairy cows and hens. However, a large portion of the land is still dedicated to vegetable farming. Susan is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase farm implements. After years of use, her farm tools have become old and worn out. This makes Susan work on the farm very slow and tedious. With your loan, she will be able to acquire new farm implements that are in good condition, better designed, durable and more efficient. The overall effect will be better quality of farm work and better yields at the end of the season.
Be part of her dream by lending today!

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Ha Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, 27 years old, is a Thai ethnic who woman joined the program of M7-MFI in August 2014. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover food for the family and saved a small amount.

She and her husband want to build a house but the saved amount is not enough to buy the materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a spacious and comfortable house bringing them good living conditions.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Tien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tien, born in 1984, is an Thai ethnic woman, who joined the program of M7-MFI in January 2012. She currently lives with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family main income is from cultivation and breeding so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family. She wants to build a sanitatary latrine for convenience of every member of the family, but she does not have enough money to buy materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean sanitatary latrine to give convenience for each member of the family.

loans.use: to build a sanitary latrine.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn

texts.en:
Bunthoeurn, 54, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia and she has five children. To make a living and support the family, she is employed as a teacher and she also is involved in a farming business for more than thirty years. She grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers at the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 8.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farm. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  MOSOC KILLA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Frida alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando para una empresa privada, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para apoyar a su esposo que es mecánico.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the MOSOC KILLA communal bank, which is located in Cusco Province.
This member, Frida, spends her day working for a private company.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She has been working for quite some time, and it has been going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.  Friday wants to to keep working so she can keep helping out her family. 
Frida is requesting a loan to purchase tools to support her husband, who is a mechanic. 
She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase tools to support her husband, who is a mechanic.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlita is 42 years old and four of her children are in school.

Merlita has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Merlita requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Rutheny

texts.en: Rutheny is 26 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Rutheny works very hard to provide for her family. For two years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines. Rutheny requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, and personal care products. She would like to save money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en: Rizalyn, 48, is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For five years, Rizalyn has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients like meat, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her business. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 45-year-old married mother of one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Salvacion has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her local market.

Salvacion has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her local market

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 49-year-old married mother of three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Vilma has a food-production business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like beef, chicken, spices, sugar, flour and other ingredients for her food-production business.

Vilma has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like beef, chicken, spices, sugar, flour and other ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Evangelyn

texts.en:
Evangelyn is 40 years old and married with seven children, three in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, eggs, and bread.

Evangelyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig raising.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, eggs, and bread.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with eight children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Erlinda has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Christine

texts.en:
Ma. Christine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Christine is 28 years old and one of her children is in school.

Ma. Christine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Ma. Christine requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Ma. Christine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu, born in 1987, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two daughters. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. Because her two children are of school age, their income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family.

She wants to invest in her children’s education but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have good conditions for learning, and then they will have a bright future.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Many people in Kenya and around the world enjoy the flavor of milk. Pauline is one of the strong and hardworking dairy farmers who start their work early in the morning (5 o’clock) to make that cup of milk possible. Pauline has one child. She has many years of work experience. She has enjoyed working independently all her life. She always believed that was best for her.

Pauline is a smallholder farmer from Chuka, Kenya, which she has been doing for nine years. Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Chuka has a thriving market for dairy products. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals.

Pauline dreams of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. She is requesting a loan for 65,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more milk for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to repay her loan on time and cover the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Pauline will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Pauline believes that if female smallholder farmers had the same access to capital as men, world poverty would be cut in half.

loans.use: to purchase a high quality dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MOSOC KILLA,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio Jose alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio el socio es director de orquesta de un grupo musical, el socio trabaja en distintas eventos que solicitan sus servicios, el socio lleva buen  tiempo en su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de eta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de un instrumento.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "MOSOC KILLA" communal bank which is located in the province of Cusco.

Jose combines his daily activities with his business as director of orchestra of a musical group. He works at a variety of events that request his services. He has been doing this work for some time now. Things are going well for him thanks to the determination that he brings to his work each day, this being the way he gets his family ahead.

Jose is requesting the loan to buy a musical instrument. He is grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established loan installments.

loans.use: to buy an instrument.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosebela

texts.en:
Rosebela, 43, is a loving mother of 6 children. She works hard on her 5 acre farm to generate income and support her big family. Rosebela practices dairy farming as well as crop cultivation. She has been a farmer for 10 year and she is determined to grow the business and make it a permanent source of livelihood.

One of the major challenges that Rosebela faces is lack of proper farm implements. Primitive tools only make life harder for a farmer like Rosebela, who works in the sweltering afternoon heat. With your loan investment, Rosebela will acquire modern farm implements that are easier and more effective to use. This will improve the quality of the overall work and the quantity of the harvests, as well.

loans.use: to pay for farming implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. Kiva lenders! Meet Dorcas one of the most hard working women on earth. She is 22 years of age, very hard-working and a go-getter. She hails from Moiben, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Dorcas has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business.

Dorcas is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kapsowar area has favourable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Dorcas feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her.

Dorcas is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Dorcas so that her horticulture farming can flourish!
Go ahead and support her with a loan.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming for an increase in her business for the betterment of her children

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 37-year-old woman with a great future ahead of her. She is a mother who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for 10 years. Her primary income sources are maize, milk, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business.

Catherine is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The work women in the area are currently doing on the farm was previously done by men. They have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labour in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business-related expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Catherine replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Deysi Saraí

texts.es:
Deysi, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor en pequeño, tienen tres hijos que estudian y en su casa vive su hermana y su padre.  

Deysi, es empleada de una compañía de cable, tiene dos años de laborar en ese lugar, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. y le proporcionan transporte; antes trabaja como agente de seguridad, pero debido al peligro de ese puesto lo dejó.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ropa para vender, su hermana le ha ofrecido ayuda para salir a vender, ella se enfocará a vender solo ropa para niños y para mujeres.- Anteriormente se le otorgó un crédito, para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas y aún la utiliza y le ha ayudado a generarlos ingresos necesarios para su familia. 

Deysi, desea que este negocio de venta de ropa, funcione y le proporcione los ingresos que espera.
texts.en:
Deysi, 31 years old, finished ninth grade. She is married and her spouse is a small farmer. They have three children in school and her sister and father live with them at home.

Deysi is an employee of a cable company. She has worked for two years there. Her work schedule is 8AM until 4PM and they provide transportation. Before she worked as a security guard but she quit due to the danger of this job.

She needs the loan to buy clothing to sell. Her sister has offered to help her sell. She will focus on selling only children's and women's clothing. Previously, she was granted a loan to buy a grill to make "pupusas" (corn tortillas) and she still uses it and it has helped her to earn income needed for her family.

Deysi wishes that this business selling clothing works and provides the income expected.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo Alonso

texts.es:
Ricardo, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hija, su familia está formada por tres personas, su hija es la única que depende económicamente de él, su negocio es atender una carpintería, elabora sus productos con calidad y los ofrece a precios accesibles en el mercado, trabaja cuatro días a la semana sin un horario fijo, aprendió a desarrollar está actividad con la ayuda de su padre.
Para mejorar la productividad de su negocio solicita un crédito que le será de ayuda para comprar madera, clavos, barniz, pegamento y otros materiales, para elaborar mesas, sillas, roperos, etc., de mayor calidad y atender a nuevos clientes, espera recuperar la inversión con mejores ganancias, los riesgos son que no venda sus productos a un precio adecuado.
Sus sueños son tener estabilidad económica para apoyar a su hija en sus estudios y costear gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is married and lives with his wife and daughter. This family has 3 members, and his daughter is his only dependent. Ricardo has a carpentry business where he makes quality products that he offers to the market at affordable prices.  He works 4 days a week without a fixed schedule.  He learned this trade with the help of his father.

In order to increase the productivity of his business, Ricardo is requesting a loan that will help him to buy wood, nails, varnish, glue, and other materials needed to make high quality tables, chairs, wardrobes, etc., so that he can attract new customers.  He hopes to recover his investment with greater earnings.  The risk is that he might not be able to sell his products at a sufficient price.  

Ricardo dreams of having financial stability so that he could support his daughter with her education and cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a tender and angelic 53-year-old woman who is a smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. In the past twelve years, she has bred more than two dairy cows, developed her farm, and planted and sold a variety of crop. She says the secret to her success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help. Mary was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming.

Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. Mary also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Mary is visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Mary believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will facilitate Mary’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer which will lead to good yields and a better life

loans.name: Noong Het 18 Group

texts.en:
Huong, 23, is an ethnic Thai woman who is married and has two sons, ages 6 and 4. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her two children. Huong works very hard at agricultural production to provide for her family. She cultivates rice and raises chickens, musk ducks, pigs and buffaloes. With the hope of improving her family's living conditions, she has always tried hard to increase agricultural production. This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em program and she will use the loan to buy piglets and expand her pig raising. She hopes that her investment will go well and bring in good income for her family. 

Huong dreams that her family and her children will prosper. In the picture, Huong is at the far right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and expand pig raising

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, born in 1989, is an Thai ethnic woman. Her family has six members, including her parents in law, her husband, her daughter and her son and they are living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. Each year the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family. She wants to bring her son to the hospital for a medical check, because he has an illness, but she does not have enough money to pay for his medical treatment. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her son have good medical treatment and will have good health. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to bring her son to the hospital for a medical check.

loans.name: Thoat's Group

texts.en:
Thoat is an ethnic Thai woman who has been a member of the M7-MFI program since May 2013. Her family consists of her husband, two daughters and a son. Her family is currently living in the Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. Their annual income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the family's living expenses with a small amount for savings . She wants to buy nitrate to fertilize her corn crop but does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan for this purpose. She hopes that the loan will help her family tend to the corn crop for a good harvest that will yield 10 tons per hectare.

loans.use: to buy nitrate to fertilize

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo PROSPERIDAD Y AMISTAD conformado por 7 socios con deseos de progresar. Este es el caso de DELIA una mujer emprendedora  con 49 años de edad. Ella es casada con 4 hijos uno de ellos dependiente. Con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida puso una bodega donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes. Hace más de 16 que puso dicho negocio el cual le va bien. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos. Solicitó el crédito  para la compra de arroz fideos azúcar menestras y aceite. El grupo prosperidad y amistad agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Delia es encuentra de pie es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca color negro.
texts.en: This is the Prosperity and Friendship group, made up of 7 members who have the desire to progress. This is the case of Delia, an entrepreneurial woman who is 49 years old. She is married with four children, one of whom is an adult. With a desire to improve her quality of life, she started a shop where she sells all types of groceries. She started this business more than 16 years ago and it's going well. Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business and help her children. She requested the loan to buy rice, noodles, sugar, grains and oil. The Prosperity and Friendship group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the support provided. Delia is standing on the right side dressed in a black-colored jacket.

loans.use: buy rice, noodles, sugar, grains and oil.

loans.name: Emperatriz De América Group

texts.es:
Tamales de masa, yuca y elote, cabecitas de perro, productos lácteos de una gran calidad como serían los quesos ranchero, añejo y de hebra, las garnachas, los puritos, las papas preparadas, mondongo, rellena, chileatole, tesmole, ropa vieja, machuco, adobo de conejo son los platillos típicos de la región y se disfrutan en todo momento.

Reyna de México y Emperatriz de América es la leyenda que tiene la virgen de Guadalupe y en su honor las integrantes del grupo han elegido el nombre, las integrantes son:

Juana - Calzado
Aurea,  Antonio -Pescado Y Mariscos
Graciela - Papelería Y Venta De Hamburguesas
Edith - Hot Dog
Sandi – Cosméticos Y Calzado

Doña Aurea es una mujer emprendedora tiene 49 años de edad,  madre de 4 hijos y casada con el señor Antonio, desde hace 25 años doña Aurea retomo la actividad familiar e  inicio con un pequeño puesto de cocteles  ubicado en las orillas del mercado con el firme propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, la educación de sus hijos, comenta que inicio con una mesa, 10 copas, 1 nevera y 4 bancos, el sol lo cubría con una pequeña lona.


Con el paso de los años y el prestigio de su negocio le han permitido instalarse en un local dentro del mercado gracias a las ganancias obtenidas además de integrar la venta de chocomil y desayunos por lo que desde las 7 de la mañana la cortina del local está abierta  para que sus clientes disfruten un rico desayuno y durante el día un rico coctel, comenta que la idea de iniciar con esta actividad surgió por la demanda que observaba en los puestos del mercado cuando acudía a comprar la despensa.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han sido de utilidad cada uno de ellos lo ha invertido en la compra de camarón, jaiba, pulpo, salsas, limón, aguacate, maza, crema, queso, aceite, refresco y servilletas, con las ganancias ha cambiado el inmobiliario de igual manera les han permitido aperturar otra coctelera ubicada sobre la carretera la cual es atendida por su esposo, en esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de camarón, jaiba, pulpo, ostiones, leche, plátano, azúcar de tal manera que les permita satisfacer a sus clientes.

Para doña Aurea lo más importante son sus clientes por ello siempre les atiende con una sonrisa en el rostro y trato amable al igual que un servicio de calidad, “lograr lo que tenemos has ahora ha sido fruto de esfuerzo y trabajo, gracias por confiar en nosotros y brindarnos nuevas oportunidades para nuestros negocios” 

El grupo está agradecido por los 6 préstamos que les han sido otorgados para poder hacer realidad sus sueños.

*ellos son os integrantes del grupo Emperatriz de América doña Aurea es quien viste blusa floreada y falda color café.
texts.en:
Tamales made from dough, corn, and yucca; cabecitas de perro [a type of tamale]; high quality dairy products like queso fresco, queso añejo [aged cheese traditionally made from goat's milk], and queso de hebra [Mexican string cheese]; garnachas [fried tortillas with various toppings], stuffed plantains, papas preparadas [potato chips with various toppings]; tripe; stuffed potatoes; chileatole [a traditional drink made from corn]; tesmole [a stew]; ropa vieja [a flank steak dish]; machuco [plantain soup]; and rabbit adobo are the traditional dishes of the region and are enjoyed at all times.

Reyna de México [Queen of Mexico] and Emperatriz de América [Empress of America] is the legend of the virgin of Guadalupe, and it is in her honor that the members of this group have chosen their name. The members are:

Juana - Footwear

Aurea, Antonio - Fish and seafood

Graciela - Stationery store and the sale of hamburgers

Edith - Hot dogs

Sandi – Makeup and footwear

Doña Aurea is an enterprising woman. She is 49 years old, the mother of four children, and is married to Señor Antonio. 25 years ago Doña Aurea resumed the family's work and started a small stall for seafood cocktails, located on the edges of the market, with the firm goal of helping her husband with the household expenses and their children's education. She says she began with one table, 10 glasses, one icebox, and four benches.

With the passing of time and the prestige of her business, she was able to set up a location within the market thanks to the additional profits she obtained from integrating the sale of chocolate milk and breakfast. From 7 in the morning the curtain of her place is open so that her customers can enjoy a rich breakfast, and during the day a delicious seafood cocktail. She says that the idea of starting this job arose from the demand she saw in the market's stalls when she went to buy groceries.

The loans that she has received have been useful. She invested each one of them in the purchase of shrimp, crab, octopus, sauces, lemon, avocado, dough, cream, cheese, oil, sodas, and napkins. With the profits she moved the property, and in the same way was able to open another seafood cocktail business. It is located on the highway and is tended to by her husband.

This time the loan will be used to buy shrimp, crab, octopus, oysters, milk, plantains, and sugar in such a way that will allow her to satisfy her customers. For Doña Aurea the customers are most important, and because of this she always serves them with a smile on her face and treats them kindly as well as with quality service. "To achieve what we have now has been the result of effort and work. Thanks for trusting us and offering us new opportunities for our businesses." The group is grateful for the six loans that have been granted to them so that they may realize their dreams.

*These are the members of the Emperatriz de América group. Doña Aurea is the one wearing a floral shirt and a brown shirt.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crab, octopus, oysters, milk, plantains, and sugar.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 19 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Dorothy has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, hair conditioners, detergent, soap, cereals, etc. to sell.

Dorothy has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, hair conditioners, detergent, soap, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
A fighter of a thousand battles, that's Agnes. A woman smallholder farmer who doesn't give up in the face of adversity and always searches for solutions to her problems.

Agnes decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. She is married and blessed with a lovely family who she refers to as “my heartbeat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. For Agnes, the decision to practice poultry farming was not difficult. She learned from her parents.

For the past five years, Agnes has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry flock, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s the kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is still profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Agnes is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses.

As the times keep getting harder, Agnes is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her farm business by purchasing good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 42 years old and married with one children.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. Mary Jean has been raising livestock for 9 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and all four of her children are in school.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. Mary Jean has been raising livestock for 25 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 41 years old and a proud mother of a lovely family, whom she really adores and cherishes. It is through Edina’s perseverance and courage that her family can have a respectable life. Edina is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past fifteen years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Edina practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income.

Although Edina has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mother. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to be able to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Edina will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Edina will reap more, which will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Edina's plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to improve productivity on her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, requiere de más capital para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas para dar un buen trato a sus cultivos de granos básicos, además pagara mozos y el alquiler de una parcela en la que tiene dispuesto realizar la siembra, el resto le servirá para comprar dos cerdos, fortalecerá su negocio para que mantenga su continuidad y pueda mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
El préstamo anterior Milagro surtió un poco más la tienda de productos de primera necesidad, su núcleo familiar se mantiene y sus condiciones económicas han mejorado un poco.
texts.en:
Milagro needs additional capital to purchase compost, insecticides and herbicides so she can take good care of her crop of staple grains. In addition, she will pay farm hands and the rent on a parcel of land which she has ready for planting. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase two pigs, which will strengthen her business and support its continuity so she can have satisfied customers.
With the previous loan, Milagro stocked up her small grocery store a bit more. She supported her nuclear family, and her financial situation has improved a bit.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs, which will strengthen her business and support its continuity so she can have satisfied customers.

loans.name: Juan Adalberto

texts.es:
Juan, se encuentra acompañado, vive con su pareja, no tienen hijos, él trabaja para cubrir los gastos de su familia; su negocio es ofrecer el servicio de taxista, trabaja de forma independiente, su horario de trabajo es de cinco de la mañana a seis de la tarde, cuenta con una experiencia de más de 10 años, actualmente no cuenta con problemas en su negocio.
Requiere de un préstamo para darle mantenimiento al vehículo y así brindar un buen servicio y seguridad a sus clientes, su objetivo es atender a más clientes y generar más ingresos para respaldar el cumplimiento de sus compromisos.
Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio, generar empleo y tener mejores circunstancias de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Juan is in a realtionship and lives with his partner. He has no children. He works to cover his family's expenses. His business is offering his services as a taxi driver. He works independently. His hours of work are from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He has more than ten years experience and currently has no problem with his business.

He needs a loan to have maintenance done on his vehicle so he can provide secure, good service to his clients. His goal is to serve more clients and generate more income to back up meeting his obligations.

His dream is to expand his business, generate employment and have better conditions for his family life.

loans.use: to have maintenance done on his vehicle so he can provide secure, good service to his clients.

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es:
Verónica, ha notado que su negocio está creciendo y solicita un crédito para comprar maíz, azúcar, bolsas, pan, etc., para elaborar la venta panes con pollo, hot dog y refrescos naturales, además ampliara la cocina para mejorar el ambiente en que trabaja, espera ser capaz de mantener la afluencia de sus clientes y cubrir sus demandas.
Con la facilidad que le dan los créditos Verónica ha contado con los materiales necesarios para mantener su negocio con vida, ha mejorado su vivienda y mantiene la misma rutina de sus actividades, actualmente tiene más trabajo.
texts.en:
Veronica has noticed that her business is growing, and so she is requesting a loan to buy corn, sugar, bags, bread, etc. so that she can make and sell chicken sandwiches, hot dogs, and natural juices.  In addition, she will expand her kitchen so that she can improve her work environment.  She hopes to maintain the current flow of customers and meet her demand.  

With the ease of payment of these loans, Veronica has been able to keep stocked up with the materials she needs to keep her business going.  She has also improved her home and kept to the same routine with her activities, and now she has more work.

loans.use: to buy supplies and expand her kitchen

loans.name: Ameyo Julienne

texts.fr: Ameyo est une femme mariée résidant à Tokoin avec trois enfants à charge. Ameyo est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Ameyo nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants
texts.en:
Ameyo is a married woman living in Tokoin with three children in her care. She is a charcoal seller who gets her supplies twice per month at the market and sells at home.
In order to finance her purchase, Ameyo needs this loan so she can order bags of charcoal to earn more income and help her husband with the family expenses, and allow her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Vey

texts.en:
Vey, 39, lives in Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia and has three children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sells his agricultural product to local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around twenty years. On average, he is able to make an income of 5.00 USD a day.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Proem

texts.en:
Proem, 31, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business. She primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural produce to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD 5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is single and has a business direct selling Fullerlife products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Meriam requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Fullerlife like body spray, lipsticks, kitchen ware, etc. to sell to her customers.

In the future, Meriam would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Fullerlife like body spray, lipsticks, kitchen ware, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tesilyn

texts.en:
Tesilyn is married with two children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. Tesilyn support the family through her auto repair service business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Steward Bonn, 17 years old, who is 2nd of 2 children in the family. He is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the 2nd of this 3 year course.

Tesilyn is borrowing 25,552.58 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Steward Bonn plans when he graduates to help his parents earn an income.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees for a B.Sc. in Marine Transportation

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana, de 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, debido a la situación económica de sus padres, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos, 3 viven con ellos y dos estudian. 

Ana, ha dedicado toda su vida a los oficios domésticos y a lavar y planchar ropa ajena, además le ayuda a su pareja a sembrar maíz y en las otras labores agrícolas; actualmente sembrarán 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, en un terreno que está a 15 minutos de su casa. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, todo para estar preparados, para que cuando llueva tenga lista la tierra para sembrar y tener los insumos listos para utilizarlos. 

Lo que más desea Ana, es que cambie la situación climática y que empiece a llover, porque tiene esperanza de obtener una buena cosecha, pero si no llueve no tendrá granos básicos para alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, never had a chance to study because her parents couldn't afford to send her to school.  She is married now and she and her husband, a farmer, have 5 children.  Three of the children still live at home and all are in school.

Ana has long worked as a cleaner, washing and ironing clothes for others.  She also helps her husband with farm work.  They grow maize on 7,000 square-meters of land that is 15 minutes from their house.  

Ana is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she and her husband need--fertilizer, for example--to plant their next crop.  The investment will allow them to prepare their land so they can start planting once the rains come.

Ana prays for rain.  Her family's hopes depend on rain for the food they eat and without rain, they will not be able to grow the maize that they need for the coming year.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Suzel

texts.en:
Suzel works hard to support her family. Suzel is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fresh fish to sell.

In the future, Suzel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, tiene como negocio la elaboración de tortillas para vender, lo fundo hace 9 años, ya tiene gran experiencia en el área, su clientela es numerosa, su horario de venta es de 8:00 am. a 3:00 pm.; la Sra.: Teresa tiene una edad de 66 años, vive con una hija y tres nietos, cuenta con 18 años de residir en su domicilio actual.
Debido al mal clima las cosechas de maíz han sido escasas, por lo que se decidió a solicitar un crédito para comprar maíz al por mayor, para aprovechar el buen precio que tiene actualmente, espera contar con la materia prima para seguir preparando la venta de tortillas y tener siempre clientes satisfechos.
Los planes de Teresa son incrementar sus ingresos para cancelar su deuda y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa's business is making tortillas to sell. She started her business 9 years ago and she now has much experience in the field and a large clientele. Her hours of sales are from 8 am to 3 pm. Teresa is 66 years old. She lives with a daughter and three grandchildren and has been living in her current residence for 18 years.

Due to bad weather the corn crops have been poor so she has decided to request a loan to buy corn wholesale to take advantage of the current good prices. She hopes to have the raw material to continue to sell her tortillas and always keep her clients satisfied.

Teresa's plans are to increase her income to pay off her debt and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale to take advantage of the current low price. She hopes to have raw material to continue with her tortilla sales.

loans.name: Hung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hung, 27 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI in 2013. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her civil servant salary, so it is just enough to cover the basic living expenses of the family and to save a small amount. Her husband wants to learn to be a driver as a job, but they do not have enough money to pay for the fees of learning. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for her husband to pay for the fees of learning how to drive a car and get a driving license.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her husband complete the training to get a license and then when he graduates, he will have a stable income.

loans.use: 's husband to pay the fees for learning to drive a car and get a driving license.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Dopé est femme âgée de 60 ans qui vit à Baguida. Veuve et mère de cinq enfants, Dopé est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne quatre par mois au marché et le revend à sa devanture dans un hangar. Dopé désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de biscuits et des amuse-gueules en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Dopé is a 60-year old woman living in Baguida. Widowed and mother to five children, Dopé sells food products. She gets her supplies four times per month at the market and sells at her shop front in a hangar. Dopé wants this credit to finance her purchase of biscuits and snacks so as to make a profit and earn more revenue in order to better contribute to the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 55 units of biscuits and 20 packs of snacks.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Eya est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans qui habite à Adidogomé. Ayant quatre enfants à charge, Eya  s’active énormément et vend des détergents  qu’elle achète cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour augmenter son stock de marchandise et gagner plus de revenus pour soutenir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants, Eya demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de détergents afin d’atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Eya, age 38, is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé. With 4 dependent children, she works very hard selling detergents around neighboring districts. She stocks up five times per month at the market.

Eya is seeking this loan to increase her stock. She wants to bolster her income to support her children's academic education. This credit will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy 9 bags of detergent.

loans.name: Djatougbe

texts.fr: Djatougbe est une veuve femme âgée de 60 ans résidant à Baguida. Mère de six enfants, Djatougbe est une revendeuse de perles qu’elle fabrique personnellement. Djatougbe s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Djatougbe sollicite ce prêt pour commander des perles, du fil et des agrafes afin d’en tirer profit puis subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Djatougbe is a 60-year old widow living in Baguida. The mother of six children, Djatougbe sells beaded jewellery that she makes herself. She gets the necessary supplies twice per month at the market and sells from neighbourhood to neighbourhood. Djatougbe is asking for this loan so she can order beads, thread and closures in order to make a profit and provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 units of beads, 10 packs of thread and 10 packs of closures.

loans.name: Phet

texts.en: Phet is a 38-year-old married mother with eight children in her care. All of them live in Takeo Province of Cambodia. Phet and her husband earn main income from cutting grass to sell. Four of her children attend school. Both Phet and her husband can earn around USD 20 per day. She lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use, therefore is requesting a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, her family will be able to have better traveling condition and reduce traveling expanses. For her future plans, she want to expand her business, build a new ground floor room and support her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
KIM, 64, lives in Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia and has five children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and he sells his agricultural product to local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, he is able to make an income of 4.50 USD a day.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Julieta has been in this business for 10 years. Julieta earns more income from general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Cermae is 17 years old and is 2nd of four children in the family. Her mother Erna supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Cermae is studying Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Erna is borrowing Php 4,000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Cermae for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Cermae plans to be gainfully employed so she could help improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees in IT

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is married with three children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.

Anelyn supports her family through her direct selling business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Vladimer. He is 18 years old and is the second of three children in the family. He is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the second year of this three year course.

Anelyn is borrowing PHP 22,198 to pay for tuition fees for her son Vladimer for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Vladimer plans to earn an income to help his parents to send his brother and sister to college when he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Sara Ines

texts.es:
Sara, por la facilidad de pago que se le brinda, decidió solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar lociones, cremas corporales, esmaltes, cosméticos, etc., para atender las demandas que hacen sus clientes y tener su negocio en el mercado.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar el inventario de su negocio y a tener mayores ventas, lo cual le genera mejores ingresos, con los que ha disminuido sus deudas y tiene un nivel de vida más confortable.
texts.en: Sara is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her cosmetics sales business with lotions, body creams and other products that she will resell.  The investment will allow her to meet demand from her buyers.  She used a past loan to buy merchandise for sale, as well, and says that she was able to increase her income as a result.  She paid off debts and lives more comfortably now than before.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business with lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Xuyen's Group

texts.en:
Xuyen, 27 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman, living with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation. Her family has about 8,000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee. The annual income from harvesting coffee is about VND 40 to 50 million, but after deducting costs, it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family while her two sons are at school age. Her eldest son is learning in grade 7, the second son is learning at kindergarten. She wants to buy learning tools and pay for her son’s education fees but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her two sons have better conditions for learning, so her children will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy learning tools and pay for her son’s education fees

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
PHAT, 53, resides in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has six children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland, primarily growing rice and selling her agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike.

This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Adelmo

texts.es:
Adelmo tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Adelmo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de lima, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de lima así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Adelmo espera ofrecer lima de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelmo is 55 years old. He lives with his spouse and his children in their own house made of basic materials. They live in the district of San Felipe which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. Life in this district is quiet and the inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.


Adelmo works in agriculture growing limes. He has 15 years experience in the field and has very good personal and work references in the district. He will use the loan that has been awarded him to buy manure and fertilizer to undertake proper maintenance of his lime crop as well as contracting labor during harvest. Doing this Adelmo hopes to offer better quality limes to his clients which will have a positive impact on his level of income and in the end will improve his quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to undertake proper maintenance of his lime crops and to pay for labor during harvest.

loans.name: Norma Edmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  MOSOC KILLA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
