La socia Norma alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera profesional de docente, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the Mosoc Killa communal bank located in the province of Cusco. She alternates her daily activities with teaching, which is her professional career.

She is a responsible, committed person and has been working for a long time in order to support her family. She wants to be able to keep on working and supporting her family.

Norma is requesting the loan to buy teaching materials. She is grateful for this loan and committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy teaching materials.

loans.name: Yvonie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Yvonie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell vegetables, farming rice and raising pigs.  Yvonie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to  buy more stocks to sell like coffee, egg, milk, sugar, can goods, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Yvonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soft drinks, bread, and chips

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 54 years old, married with six children, one of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Bebiana has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig raising.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with two children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. Liza support the family through her buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her daughter Hanna Bierge, 17 years old who is the 2nd of two children in the family. She is studying for a degree in Aircraft Maintenance and is currently in the 1st of this 2 year course.

Liza is borrowing 10,680 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Hanna Bierge for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Hanna Bierge plans when she graduates to help her parents earn an income.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for a B. Sc. in Aircraft Maintenance

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is 19 years old and is 7th of children in the family. Her mother Florenda supports the family through her business in the Philippines.

Ma. Flor is studying Bachelor of Arts in English and is currently in the 1 of this 4-year course.

Florenda is borrowing Php 4,000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter for the first semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Ma. Flor plans to graduate and be gainfully employed so she could help improve the quality of her family.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for a BA in English

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
May is 21 years old and is youngest of five children in the family. Her mother Edna supports the family through her business in the Philippines.

May is studying Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course.

Edna is borrowing Php 6,500 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, May plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for a B.Sc. in Criminology

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 25 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Assoupé

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 40 ans, Assoupé est femme habitant à Baguida avec ses six enfants à charge. Assoupé prépare et vend du jus fait avec du maïs et du sucre généralement appelé « LIHA ». Assoupé s’approvisionne du nécessaire au marché et revend sa marchandise au bord de la route et dans les quartiers environnant. Assoupé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs et de sucre afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation
texts.en:
Assoupé is a 40-year-old widow who lives in Baguida with her 6 dependent children. She sells a juice typically called "LIHA" that she makes with maize and sugar. She buys the necessary ingredients at the market and sells her juice by the roadside and in neighboring districts.

Assoupé is seeking this loan to buy bowlfuls of maize and sugar so as to better meet customer demand. She wants to become fully self-sufficient financially to help her children pursue their education.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowlfuls of maize and 18 bowlfuls of sugar.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Remedios is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fely is 59 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a buy-and-sell sea shells business in the Philippines.

Fely requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea shells to sell.

She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Fely would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more seashells to sell.

loans.name: Le's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Le, 30 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman who lives with her husband, her daughter and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. Both of her children are obedient and good at learning, the eldest daughter is at grade 4th while the young son is at grade 2nd.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and her family has more than 7000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee. The income from each harvest of coffee after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and to save a small amount.

However, because she has to pay for her children’s education so the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for her children’s education fees and buy learning tools for them.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have good learning conditions and on her side, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education

loans.name: Las Ñustas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ÑUSTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Julia ella es casada y tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de carne, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The LAS ÑUSTAS community bank is located in Cusco, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Our member, Julia, 45, is married and has 3 children.  She operates a food business serving hardy meals like soups and baked chicken.  She generally works from 8:00am to 6:00pm.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it is successful.  For the future, she hopes to move the business to a dedicated space.  

Julia is applying for a loan that she will use to buy rice, vegetables and other supplies for carrying on her business.  She had to work on the day that the group photo was taken and is pictured in the small photo at the bottom-left of the larger photo.  The other members of the group operate a range of businesses that include animal sales, meat sales, a corner grocery and food sales.  

Julia is grateful for the help that she and others have received from Kiva and is committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared food business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie owns and operates a food selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for 15 years and earning well to sustain their living. With her revenue, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. Improving the business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC.

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional ingredients for her pork barbeque.

She plans to have a chicken barbeque to gain more income. Margie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her pork  barbeque.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old, married with five children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Delia has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Delia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 53 years old and married.  

Saturnina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Saturnina requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Saturnina has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Saturnina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 54 years old and married with eight children, two of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Meriam is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Meriam has been farming rice  for 38 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and fishing.  Lea is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business for her buy and sell dried fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant and catering business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ingredients for her restaurant and catering services like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc for her restaurant and catering business.

Leonida earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients for her restaurant and catering services like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 59 years old and married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like woods, gasoline, fishing nets, etc. for her business.

Marina has been in this business for 20 years. Marina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like woods, gasoline, fishing nets, etc. for her business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 58 years old and has five children. Cherry is married and has one child who is still in school.

Cherry is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cherry has been farming rice for 5 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cherry would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor works hard to support her family. Flor is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Flor requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Flor has been in this business for 5 years now.

Flor would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, four attend school.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 4 years. She needs a loan to purchase canned goods, eggs, milk, and soap.

Jacquelyn has borrowed and repaid 8 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income renting boarding house units.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  canned goods, eggs, milk, and soap.

loans.name: Leizl

texts.en:
Leizl is a 37-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leizl has had a general store business for three years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Leizl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 38 years old and has seven children. She is married and has five children who are in school. Roselyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gapua

texts.en:
Gapua is 64 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, sugar, flour, drum stick,snacks etc. She has been doing this for 1 year.

Gapua needs a loan to buy a new chest freezer, bag of sugar, bag of rice, bag of flour etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and also to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, bag of rice, bag of flour, chest freezer etc.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a kind and understanding person. He is 53 years old, married, and the father of two children. Said is considered a successful entrepreneur in his area. One can buy all sorts of sweets from him, and he is always ready to serve his customers with a smile. Said has been running this business for over 20 years and it is the sole source of income for his family.

Soon it will be September 1st, the start of the academic year, and Said needs to buy a computer, school supplies and clothes for his children. But Said does not have enough funds for this and so he has applied for a loan. Said is really relying on your attention.

loans.use: to buy a computer, school supplies and clothes for his children.

loans.name: Jomratie

texts.en:
Jomratie is a hardworking  entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store  and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods and personal care products to sell in her general store.

She earns additional income growing rice and  coconuts.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Jomratie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her coconut plantation.

loans.name: Rolin

texts.en:
Rolin is a 36-year-old married man with one child who attends school. He is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rolin has had a fishing business for 16 years and requests 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

In the future, Rolin would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Noong Het 19 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tam, 46, is a Thai ethnic lady who live in an old small house with her husband and her two children. Her family relies mainly on agricultural production for a living and because of the instability of the income from agriculture, Mrs. Tam and her husband work very hard at plenty of activities, including cultivating rice, raising buffalo, chicken, muscovy ducks and pigs.

Recently, she has requested the sixth loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough money to buy a buffalo to develop farming. Mrs. Tam is also satisfied with the training and counselling provided by the program, which has helped her constantly overcome the difficulties in cultivation and animal husbandry and make the production more efficient.

She hopes that her investment this time will go successfully just like previous ones so that she could provide better for her family.

Mrs. Tam dreams that her family will have a more abundant life and her children will have good job with bright future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to have enough money to buy a buffalo to develop her farming.

loans.name: Emperatriz Elena

texts.es:
Emperatriz, es viuda, vive en casa propia con una hija, dos hijos más ya son independientes; sus ingresos provienen de atender un chalet en el que vende pupusas, bebidas, comida, golosinas, etc., además recibe una pensión mensual, inicio su negocio en el 2013, lo ha ido ampliando con las ganancias obtenidas, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en la unidad de salud de su  localidad, trabaja de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Con el propósito de tener mejores ganancias solicita un crédito para comprar bebidas, maíz, harina, arroz, frijoles, quesillo, aceite, etc., al por mayor para adquirir los productos a menor precio y elaborar siempre la venta de comida y pupusas, espera saber administrar el crédito y resarcirlo sin problemas.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio, ofrecer mercadería más variada y enseñar a su hija la administración del mismo.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a widow.  She has a house where she lives with a daughter.  She also has two other children, both grown and living away.  Emperatriz started a prepared food business in 2013 and has used her earnings from the business to steadily grow it.  She also has a monthly pension.  She operates the business at a local clinic and normally works from 6:00am to 4:00pm.  

Emperatriz is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of the flour, rice, cooking oil and other supplies that she needs to make pupusas and other prepared foods.  She will make the most of the loan, she says, and repay it in the agreed-upon time.  For the future, she hopes to carry on the business and eventually pass it along to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of the flour, rice, cooking oil and other supplies that she needs to carry on her prepared food business.

loans.name: Niuia

texts.en:
Agnes is a 18 years old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Agnes has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, seeds, wheel barrow. She has been a member of SBPD since July this year 2015. With her profits, Agnes hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a chemicals, wheel barrow, weed sprayer, seeds etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 53 years old, married, and has eight children. She operates a small business selling popcorn in her community, which she has been doing for two years. 

Susana has requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy cooking oil, salt, plastic paper, and corn seeds. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital.  Susana will use her earnings to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, salt, plastic paper, and bags of corn seeds

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar es dueño de una despensa carnicería, se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 5 años, es casado, y comenta que con sacrificio ayuda a su familia, y que siempre se ayudan todos, ya que es una familia muy unida.
 Oscar  es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y conocida en su barrio por ser muy amable con todos, el motivo que le impulsa a pedir este préstamo es para para poder invertir en su negocio y surtirlo con bebidas, comestibles variados, panificados y otros, y continuar de esa forma abasteciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oscar is the owner of a grocery store and butcher's. He has been running this business for more than 5 years. He is married and he comments that with sacrifice he supports his family. They always help each other as it is a very close family.

Oscar is a very hard-working and enterprising person who is known in his neighborhood as being friendly with everyone. The reason he decided to request this loan is to be able to invest in his business and stock it with drinks, a variety of foods, bakery products and others and in this way continue to supply his customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, various foods, bakery goods and others to stock his store.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is a 50-year-old woman from a remote area of Kompong Speu Province and is a mother of two children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. She is able to make an income USD 2.50 per day, on average. So far, he has been involved in this type of business for around twenty years.

She would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen less smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate than its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a personal care products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to resell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling frozen foods.

Amy dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to resell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 48 years old and has three children. Eden is single and has two children are presently in school.

Eden is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Eden requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eden has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, two of whom in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, milk, etc.

Loreta dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, milk, etc

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 36 years old and has one child who is in school.

Alma has a general store business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a married woman, 46 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Eulalia has a buy and sell water purified business in the Philippines. Eulalia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of water to sell.

Eulalia has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of water to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 38 years old and has five children. Gregoria is married and has four children are still in school.

Gregoria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gregoria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gregoria has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. Luzviminda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like net, gasoline, wood, etc.

Luzviminda  has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, ya tiene su propia familia, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 4 años de edad; se dedica a cultivar maíz, con la cosecha abastece a su familia y comercializa otra parte para generar ingresos y así subsistir con su familia, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Por la necesidad de ampliar su negocio solicita un crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y semilla mejorada de maíz, de esta manera aumentará la probabilidad de tener una mejor cosecha y generar más ingresos.
Su visión es tener un negocio más competitivo en la zona y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and 4-year old son.  He grows maize, some of which he sells for cash and the rest for feeding his family.  He normally works from 8:00am to 5:00pm.  

José is applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and the other supplies he needs to carry on his farming business.  The investment will increase his chances of harvesting a good crop and bringing in more money for his family.  For the future, he hopes to build a competitive business and continue inching his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy the supplies he needs to carry on his farming business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 60 years old and married.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorna has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pelise

texts.en:
Pelise is a 58 years old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Pelise has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, seeds, wheel barrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014. With her profits, Pelise hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a chemicals, wheel barrow, weed sprayer, seeds etc.

loans.name: Sotun

texts.en:
Sotun, 35 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two children who are currently in school. So far, she has been in this type of business for ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Ivie

texts.en:
Ivie is 24 years old and has two children. Ivie is married and has one child still in school.

Ivie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ivie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ivie has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Lydia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, can goods, egg, rice, etc. for her restaurant business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, can goods, egg, rice, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Margarita has been in this business for 2 years. Margarita earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, plastic wires, etc.

Maribel has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, plastic wires, etc

loans.name: Chanthet

texts.en:
Chanthet is a 23-year-old single student, who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting in his third year at a university in the city. He is from the Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. His parents are farmers who earn their main income from vegetable farming.

Now Chanthet is lacking the finances to cover his university fees from his third through his fourth year, so he would like to take out a Kiva loan through the KREDIT MFI. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances for earning a bachelor’s degree with skills for his future job. After graduation, he is going to find a good job with a decent salary.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for a B. Sc. in Accounting, from his third through his fourth year.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina, 30 years old, is living in a community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 8.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Faafua

texts.en:
Faafua is 25 years old and married with 3 children.She runs a small business selling pork buns, coconut biscuit and more in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Faafua has requested a loan to buy bag of flour, bag of sugar, cooking oil etc. She joined SPBD in August this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faafua will use to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, cooking oil, bag of salt etc.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Marichu has been in this business for 18 years. Marichu earns more income from motorcycle transport.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Ma.paz

texts.en:
Ma.Paz is 60 years old and married with four children. Ma.Paz works very hard to provide for them.

Ma.Paz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, noodles etc.

Ma.Paz has been in this business for 5 years and earn additional income from E-loading.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, noodles etc

loans.name: Germain

texts.es:
Germain, comparte su casa propia con su compañera de vida y dos hijos, tiene 20 años de vivir en su localidad, no tiene ayuda económica de parientes, su actividad económica es la de sembrar maíz, cuando no hay lluvias lo hace mediante regadillo, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a desempeñar dicha actividad; como habita en una zona rural el oficio lo aprendió de otros agricultores, en su tiempo libre ofrece el servicio de albañil para tener mejores ingresos.
Con el crédito tendrá liquidez para comprar insumos agrícolas para fumigar y dar un buen desarrollo a su cultivo de maíz, con ello evitara que las plagas lo dañen, espera desarrollar sus actividades en el tiempo indicado y tener buenos resultados.
Él tiene como sueño obtener cosechas abundantes, cancelar la deuda adquirida y llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
Germain shares his own house with his life companion and two children. He has lived here for 20 years and he has no economic support from his parents. His economic activity is growing corn. When there is no rain he irrigates a bit and he has been carrying out this activity for 20 years. As he lives in an rural area he learned from other farmers. In his spare time he works as a bricklayer to improve his income.

With the loan he will have the money to buy agricultural inputs to fumigate and promote good development of his corn crops avoiding damage from infestations. He hopes to carry out his work at the opportune time and have good results.

His dream is to have abundant harvests, pay off his debt and provide daily sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to fumigate and promote good development of his corn crops avoiding damage from pests.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 50 years old and married with six children, four children are presently in school, Merlina works very hard to provide for them.

Merlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, drinks and other personal care products.

Merlina has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in beauty products such as nail polish, nail polish removers and cuticle trimmers, as well as in catalog promotions to sell to her customers and respond to requests for orders.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 35 years old woman and mother of two children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a son and one daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years but for the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income.

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Farzana has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Farzana is so much thankful to Kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 22 years old woman who is single with 2 children. She runs a business sewing and selling elei clothes in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business.

Susana has requested a loan to buy materials, sewing machine, scissors, needles, elei paints etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, scissors, materials, sewing machine.

loans.name: Paua

texts.en:
Paua is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, sugar, flour,drum stick,snacks etc. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Paua needs a loan to buy a new freezer, bag of sugar, bag of rice, bag of flour etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and also to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, new freezer, bag of rice, bag of sugar, snacks etc.

loans.name: Sautupu

texts.en:
Sautupu is a 64 years old woman who is single with 5 children. She runs a business sewing and selling elei and kids suits in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business.

Sautupu has requested a loan to buy scissors, sewing machine, materials, threads etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to  buy scissors, thread, needles, colour paint, etc.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao, 37, lives in a small community of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has two children and grows rice to earn an average of $ 2.00 a day. He has farmed for more than ten years. He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. He will use the loan from KIVA to build a latrine which will help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Muslima was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into the family of farmers. She is living in a big beautiful city well known with its dry fruits and nuts. She is married and her husband is an entrepreneur. She has 22 years of practice doing business with sewing traditional women dresses and embroidering. She well knows her activity. Her daughters inspire her while she is working on a new dress. She has wide imagination and thinking of stylish design to her customers’ orders. Her daughters are now married and all of them learned from her how to sew a dress.

Muslima came to IMON and asked a loan to be treated at a hospital. She is willing to be healed and recover her health. Healing at hospital would help her business, because she would be more active and do her job effectively. She is hoping to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to be healed and recover her health. Healing at hospital would help her business, because she would be more active and do her job effectively.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary ann is 28 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary ann has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary ann requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Mary ann has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family by operating a welding shop. She earns additional income raising pigs. Lyn is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase iron and plain sheets for her welding business.

Lyn has sustained her business through 23 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman, 46 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nida has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase pants, dress, short, underwear, slippers, blouse and other ready to wear products to sell.

Nida has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, dress, short, underwear, slippers, blouse and other ready to wear products to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina owns and operates her variety store for three years.She is a widow and blessed with five children. Her four children had settled for marriage while the other one is still single and working. Regina also had rice farming and hog raising business.

She plans to buy more stocks of grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, seasonings and cooking oil but she struggles for shortage of capital. With regards to this matter,she decided to borrow additional capital amounting to 40,000 PHP. She’s hoping to obtain her loan request. In this way, she could increase her sales and provide all her customers demand.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, seasonings and cooking oil to sell
